jobs.title: Team Member
jobs.description: PURPOSE OF POSITIONThe Team Member is responsible and accountable for performing specific tasks and duties, as assigned, within the restaurant. The Team Member provides each guest with a positive guest service experience, prepares quality food products and keeps the restaurant clean.KEY ACCOUNTABILITIESGeneral Accountabilities & Work tasks Follow guest service guidelines and procedures; take appropriate action to ensure guests receive service beyond their expectations Work assigned stations accurately and productively; clean and stock station areas; perform other cleaning duties as assigned You may be required to cook as an when required by your supervisor Handle all food products according to RBL procedures Follow RBL food safety, food handling and sanitation requirements, to ensure the health and safety of guests and employees Report faulty equipment and fixtures to the manager on duty Work Tasks could include: Order taking and serving food and beverage orders. Operating an electronic register, receiving payment and making change. Packing products into food packaging for takeaway or trays for serving, with condiments. Handing packed orders to customers from the packing bench to front counter or out the drive-thru window to the customer’s vehicle. Washing, cutting, dicing, slicing vegetable and salad ingredients. Measuring and mixing foods e.g. potato mix, gravy mix Using a potato scoop to scoop mash potato into pottles and pouring gravy on top. ∙ Preparing food such as burgers, wraps and salads Operating cooking equipment such as potato mixer, microwave, warmer timers ∙ Heating simple food items e.g. burger buns, rolls and tortillasMonitoring food timers for food safety ‘shelf life’ control and discards products Loading chip basket with raw fries placing in to the fryer, lifting and dumping cooked chips from the basket into the chip hopper, ready for serve. Scooping hot chips using a chip scoop into takeaway packaging. Moving chicken trays from the warming cabinet into the chicken display. Cleaning food preparation areas, cooking surfaces, food containers and utensils ∙ Handling general purpose detergents and sanitiser for cleaning Clearing tables of food packaging, emptying rubbish bins and carrying rubbish bags to the rubbish skip back of house. Training and Development Strive to improve personal skills and performance Relevant cook training may be provided as and when required Communicate to immediate supervisor when additional training, guidance and practice are needed Keep immediate supervisor informed of anything which might affect guests, other employees and overall operations Is performance oriented and driven; understands performance expectations and is aware of performance results Effective Business Management Consistently meet job expectations to positively impact the sales and profits of the restaurant ∙ Contribute to the restaurant’s success by accomplishing the expected work during each shift; consistently produces quality work Support the goals, decisions and directives of restaurant management; perform additional duties and responsibilities as directed Follow RBL guidelines for food and cash controls, follow cost control guidelines to maintain and minimize restaurant costs; properly use all products, suppliers, equipment and facilities Health and Safety Take reasonable care for your own health and safety at work, and that your actions/omissions do not cause harm to any other person in the workplace (including, for example, co-workers and customers) Participate in creating and maintaining a safe and healthy work environment, particularly by complying with instructions, policies and procedures Advise manager of any/all work related injuries, accidents, near misses and hazards or potential hazards (including any faults to equipment), and risks or potential risks to health and safetyMOST FREQUENT CONTACTSRestaurant Manager Assistant Restaurant Manager Customers Area Managers Store TeamCritical Qualifications/Skills/ExperienceQualifications: Ideally a minimum of NCEA Level 1 or working towards Level 1 Business/Technical Skills Previous customer service or customer facing experience is favoured but not essential Experience (Behavioural): Places customer first and goes out of their way to ensure customer satisfaction ∙ Able to work under pressure, remaining calm at all times Works well with others and is supportive and collaborative Focused on achieving results and strives to meet targets Acts with integrity at all times Works within guidelines, policies and rules and is a natural rule follower Focused on the safety and wellbeing of others at all times including customers and peersCommunicates effectively verbally with customers and the team and is clear and concise ∙ Able to comprehend written English and able to complete online training modules and follow written procedures and policies with ease Manages time well to complete set tasks and works quickly and with purpose to maintain momentumThis Position Description summarises the primary responsibilities of this role at the time of commencement. Various other responsibilities not listed here may also fall within the responsibility parameters of the position. From time to time and with the natural developments of business structure and practice, an employee may be required to perform additional or new responsibilities that fall reasonably within the expectations of this role. Any significant adjustments to role responsibilities will always be made after consultation with the employee.P22-225233-2

jobs.title: Stockroom Manager
jobs.description: Are you a detail-oriented individual with a knack for organization? Glassons is seeking a proactive and experienced Stockroom Manager to oversee our inventory and ensure efficient operations behind the scenes!Position: Stockroom ManagerLocation: Glassons - Te Rapa (Hamilton)Job Type: Full-time (Tuesday to Saturday, 35-40 hours per week)About Glassons:Glassons is a leading fashion retailer offering the latest trends in women's clothing and accessories. With a vibrant and dynamic atmosphere, we pride ourselves on providing customers with exceptional service and on-trend fashion choices.Role Overview:As the Stockroom Manager, you will play a crucial role in the smooth functioning of our store by managing all aspects of stockroom operations. You will be responsible for maintaining accurate inventory records, organizing stock efficiently, and ensuring that merchandise is readily available for the sales floor.Key Responsibilities:Manage all stockroom activities, including receiving, unpacking, and organizing merchandise deliveries.Maintain accurate inventory records through regular stocktakes and reconciliations.Ensure that stock levels are sufficient to meet customer demand and assist in replenishment as needed.Implement efficient storage and organization systems to maximize space and accessibility.Train and supervise stockroom staff to ensure compliance with company policies and procedures.Requirements:Previous experience in stockroom management or a similar role, preferably within the retail industry.Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.Attention to detail and accuracy in inventory management and record-keeping.Excellent communication and leadership skills to effectively manage a team.Flexibility to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities.Benefits:Opportunities for career advancement within a leading fashion retailer.Staff discount on Glassons and Hallensteins products.Ongoing training and development opportunities to enhance your skills in inventory management and leadership.Be part of a supportive and collaborative team in a dynamic work environment. Join Glassons as a Stockroom Manager and play a vital role in ensuring the smooth operation of our store behind the scenes! To apply, please submit your resume outlining your relevant experience and why you would be the perfect fit for this role.

jobs.title: Social Media Community and Content Specialist
jobs.description: Work with an energetic and supportive team that values creativity and innovation. Lead exciting social media projects and help shape the University’s digital voice. Enjoy professional development opportunities and career growth. Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleAre you a social media whiz with a passion for creating engaging content? Do you thrive in online communities, love sparking conversations, and have a knack for storytelling? If so, we have the perfect role for you!We’re looking for a dynamic Social Media Community & Content Specialist to take our social presence to the next level! You'll be at the forefront of our digital engagement, crafting compelling content, managing online communities, and ensuring that our social media channels are buzzing with activity. Whether it’s creating viral posts, engaging with students, or covering major events like Open Day and graduation, this role is all about bringing our University to life online. Oh, and did we mention? You'll also get the chance to step into the hooves of Moosy the Cow, our beloved University mascot!For your application, instead of submitting the traditional cover letter & resume, we would like to see your creativity shine through submitting us one social-media-style asset (either a short-form video or a carousel post) that introduces you as if you were creating content for the University of Waikato Social Media Team.Your submission should cover:Who you areWhat you do professionallyA bit about your personality or interestsRelevant work experienceA career highlight you’re proud ofWhy you want to join the University of Waikato’s Social Media TeamIf this sounds like you and you’re ready to take on a role where your ideas matter, your creativity shines, and your social media expertise makes a real impact, apply now and be part of something amazing at the University of Waikato! Salary will be in the range of $85,279 to $97,532 per year based on skills, knowledge and experience brought to the position. This is a full-time role (37.5 hours a week), based on our Hillcrest Campus.For more information on the role please see the position description. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?Holding a Bachelors’ qualification in marketing, communications or a relevant field you will have over 4 years’ experience in the digital/ social media field.In addition, you will also have: A strong understanding of social media platforms, trends, and best practices. Experience in content creation, including video production, graphic design, and copywriting. An eye for analytics—knowing how to measure success and optimise content for engagement. Excellent communication skills and the ability to work with a wide range of stakeholders.A proactive, creative mindset with the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines. Bonus points if you have experience in the education sector!Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that some groups of people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about one of these roles but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly, we encourage you to get in touch or to just apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The Marketing Team at the University of Waikato is all about innovation, creativity, and making a lasting impact. As part of the Office of the Vice-Chancellor, we work to protect and elevate the University's reputation while connecting with our diverse audiences in meaningful ways. We collaborate across departments to bring our brand to life and drive engagement through powerful digital storytelling.He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students, and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. E herea ana te Whare Wānanga ki te kaupapa kia whakaratohia te mea angitū ōrite ki ngā tāngata katoa.Applications Close on Friday 16th January 2026Requisition number: 1003235

jobs.title: ECE Registered Teacher
jobs.description: Want to teach in a centre where diversity is celebrated, rooms feel peaceful and intentional, and relationships are the real curriculum? We are looking for a Registered Teacher to join Busy Bees Grandview Road and help our tamariki grow with confidence, curiosity and a strong sense of belonging. About usBusy Bees Grandview Road is a multicultural centre with a reflective team and three clearly defined spaces for pēpi, teina and tuakana. You walk into rooms that are thoughtful and designed for child-led play. The team here care about pedagogy. Intentional teaching sits alongside open-ended play, with planned provocations, good questions and solid documentation in line with Te Whāriki. You will be joining colleagues who talk about practice, who are open to feedback, and who want to keep lifting what they do. Relationships with whānau are strong and genuine, which makes your work with tamariki richer and more grounded in their worlds. As part of Busy Bees Aotearoa, we are supported by national systems and PLD while keeping our own centre identity.About you:You are a registered ECE or Primary trained kaiako who brings warmth, skill and curiosity to your teaching. You value well organised, aesthetically considered environments and know how to use them to invite rich, child-led learning. You are confident planning and documenting through Te Whāriki and enjoy weaving tuakana teina, intentional teaching and genuine child agency into everyday practice. You communicate clearly, work collaboratively and like being part of a reflective team that talks about practice and keeps lifting the bar together. Why you’ll love it here:Full Pay ParityDiscounted childcareFirst aid certification, annual flu vaccination and staff uniformGenerous PLD budget where you choose what you want to grow inComprehensive induction, mentoring and coachingReal opportunities for career growth within Busy Bees AotearoaWe would love to hear from you so do not hesitate, apply now send by sending through your CV and cover letter today!Please note: Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. We are an Accredited EmployerWhy Work for Busy Bees?If you’re passionate about early learning, Busy Bees is the place to be. Although we are part of a global organisation, our company was founded by three families looking for better, more enriching childcare. Three decades later, we still keep the same values at heart.We know that we couldn’t do what we do without the important people in our teams. We invest in our people and work with them to build career pathways that inspire.

jobs.title: Police Officer
jobs.description: Working at Police (who we are) New Zealand Police delivers services that ensure people can be safe and feel safe in their homes, on our roads and in their communities. Police operate 24 hours a day in a complex environment actively targeting and preventing crime and harm. With around 16,000 staff, we work from urban and rural stations and larger policing hubs.We operate on land, sea and in the air, and respond to more than 1.2 million events per year – answering more than 992,000 111 calls and over 650,000 non-emergency calls. We’re working towards specific goals and targets that highlight our intent to work collaboratively with iwi and communities, other government sectors and business partners to deliver ‘Our Business’ and achieve long-term changeValues: Our Values provide a guide to the way New Zealand Police work, operate, and make decisions, and reflect what is important to us and the communities we serve. Professionalism: Taking pride in representing New Zealand Police and making a difference in the communities we serveRespect: Treating everyone with dignity, upholding their individual rights and honouring their freedomsIntegrity: Being honest and upholding excellent ethical standards Commitment to Māori and The Treaty: Acting in good faith of, and respecting the principles of Te Tiriti O Waitangi – partnership, protection, and participationEmpathy: Seeking understanding of, and considering the experience and perspective of those New Zealand Police serve Valuing Diversity: Recognising the value different perspectives and experiences bring to making us better at what we do Position Overview (where you’ll be working) The purpose of the District Operations is to deliver Our Business. To support the delivery of District outcomes the General Duties Constable will maintain and enhance public security and welfare through response to incidents requiring police attention and the conduct of relevant enquiries. The purpose of leadership in this role is to deliver (or enable others to deliver) Our Business. Responsibilities (what you’ll be doing) The Constable – General Duties will:1. Be safe and feel safe Understand the hazards in your work area and eliminate or minimise the associated risk.Report all accidents, incidents and near misses in MyPolice in a timely fashionActively participate in Wellness and Safety initiatives and training 2. Service delivery Patrolling Undertakes patrols and responds to situations to enforce law and/or maintain public order by the following: Undertaking patrolling in accordance with organisational requirements, principles of non-discrimination and supervisors instructions in a manner that optimises achievement of the patrols goals. Correctly assessing emergent situations and taking appropriate action Establishing, maintaining and utilising knowledge of the local patrol area Responding to incidents, taskings and requests for assistance in accordance with accepted operational procedures Utilising situational problem-solving techniques to resolve issues Assessing situational behaviour of people and determining/implementing appropriate reaction/response strategies Providing first response control/command and/or co-ordination at incidents Conduct Initial Police Investigation Assesses and preserves crime/incident scenes, and assists in the investigation process when required Collects and analyses information relevant to investigations Identifies, seizes, processes and manages exhibits in accordance with legislative and administrative processes Considers and utilises all organisational avenues of inquiry and investigative procedures in order to identify subjects and persons Conducts searches of persons, property and vehicles with due regard to lawful authority and organisational procedures. Decisions to caution, report or arrest are made at the discretion of the officer and conveyed to the person(s) concerned in accordance with organisational and legal guidelines. Affords rights to suspects and victims of crime by treating them in a fair, equitable and non-discriminatory manner.Gathers, Collates and Records Information Collects and records information relevant to police issues in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Takes comprehensive statements that contain all details relevant to the matter being examined and are in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Completes the full range of complaint correspondence in a concise and timely manner Completes arrest files, not guilty prosecution files, and other correspondence including notifying of complainants, witnesses and dealing with exhibits Conducts and records interviews in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Carries out access, storage and retrieval of information in accordance with jurisdictional laws and organisational Codes of Ethics/Best Practice. Uses interview and evidence recording equipment in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and proceduresIdentifies and utilises communication linkages within the organisation to exchange/share informationProcesses and provides for persons in police care or custody Ensures persons in care or custody are provided for, processed and escorted/transported in accordance with jurisdictional laws, policy and procedures Fosters a positive organisational image in the community Acts on opportunities to explain and promote the organisations activities in order to encourage community recognition and support Represents the organisations position on particular issues in a way which acknowledges community concerns and promotes community awareness Advises and involves the community in public safety activities Contributes to the objectives of the Safety Administration Programme S(A)P and the National Road Safety Plan Provides an initial police response to traffic crash events and emergencies Assists in reducing the number of road deaths and enhances the safe and efficient use of roads through: Patrol duties directed at compliance of general traffic law and the promotion of safe driving practices Targeting of alcohol / drug impaired road users Speed control enforcement Promoting and enforcing the use of vehicle restraint devices Providing peak traffic flow supervision Enforcing vehicle maintenance regulations through vehicle checks Issuing Traffic and Infringement Offence Notices Provides assistance/support for: Accident investigation officers Summons service CARD centre Judicial Processing Prepares and manages evidence, witnesses and offenders for the relevant judicial authority in accordance with jurisdictional laws and organisational policies and procedures by: Managing witnesses Monitoring offenders Liaising with and assisting prosecutions section Undertaking post-court procedures 3. Personal professional performance Effectively manages personal professional performance in order to ensure public confidence in the police service by: Modelling high standards of personal performance, ethics and integrity Reviewing and monitoring personal performance Developing and maintaining ongoing personal competence Assisting and supporting other personnel Maintaining personal physical and emotional health. 4. Team work Works effectively as a member of a team within the community Co-operates and works with other members of the section in order to achieve team goals Establishes and supports open honest and constructive relationships with colleagues Takes a constructive approach to team efforts and supports other team members where possible Customer service Ensures all service requests and complaints are met with a professional, customer focused and timely response. Assesses the changing needs of the customer and implements strategies to respond to them. Ensures services are delivered promptly, impartially and safely. Ensures that Policing services are delivered with a quality customer service and Māori Responsiveness focus. Fosters an atmosphere where being responsive to customer needs is a priority. Provides services designed to target general public attitudinal and behavioural change for the purposes of producing safer communities. Provides high quality policing services in conjunction with other members of the team. Ensures that service delivery conduct and performance integrate both Treaty principles and Māori values and principles consistent with the spirit and substance of the Treaty of Waitangi. 6. Relationship management Creates and maintains networks to ensure local examples of best practice are identified and communicated so that duplication of effort is avoided. Establishes and maintains a positive working relationship with other members of police including members of Dog Section, the Criminal Intelligence Branch, Scene of Crime Officers, Police Photographers, Training Service Centre staff and Prosecutions Service Centre staff. Establishes and maintains a positive working relationship with members of the community and other Government and service agencies such as CYPS, WINZ, Victim Support organisations, cultural groups, local government, churches, schools, neighbourhood watch, and community service groups such as Lions, Rotary and Zonta. 7. Universal Responsibilities All employees of New Zealand Police are expected to: Adhere to New Zealand Police standards of integrity and conduct. Comply with legislative and statutory requirements within area of expertise, including employment and privacylegislation. Model the New Zealand Police Values – Professionalism, Respect, Integrity, Commitment to Māori and The Treaty, Empathy and Valuing Diversity. Respect diversity and demonstrate inclusiveness. Understand the hazards in their work area and eliminate or minimise the associated risk. Report all accidents, incidents and near misses in MyPolice in a timely fashion. Actively participate in Wellness and Safety initiatives and training. Perform other duties and participate in projects as required. Additional information: (what you need to know) Required Qualifications For selection purposes, candidate suitability will be considered in relation to: potential to perform well in the position, given a reasonable period of time for familiarisation and/or training. personal attributes and temperament relevant to the position. general health which will allow for the performance of all duties and functions of the position (for constabulary employees a current PCT is an indicator of general health). Pre-Employment Checks Core children’s worker, safety check required. Drug and alcohol testing, as required, according to guidelines.

jobs.title: Pharmacist | Rototuna
jobs.description: Roster option 1Tuesday Saturday 9:00 AM 6:00 AMWelcome to the Pharmacy TeamAt Woolworths Pharmacy, we have a growing network of over 45 pharmacies across the country. We come together to provide our local communities with options and convenience in meeting their pharmaceutical needs.Joining our pharmacy team you’ll be the sort of person that thrives in an environment where you can make a meaningful difference, where our customers come first, and where you can leverage your knowledge and experience for the benefit of our communities.What you'll doWe’re looking for a Pharmacist to join our Rototuna team here as part of our Woolworths Pharmacy business reporting to our Pharmacy Manager. Joining our team and you’ll take accountability for:Delivering professional health services that support the wellbeing of our wider communityDispensing medicines accuratelyAssisting customers with pharmacy product queriesReviewing stock levels delivering high standards of merchandisingProvide outstanding customer serviceThis is a full time position working Tuesday to Saturday 9.00am to 6.00pm.What you'll bringTo succeed in this role you will need to be the sort of person that thrives in an environment where you can make a meaningful difference, where our customers come first, and where you can leverage your knowledge and experience for the benefit of our community. You will always strive to do the right thing for our customers.To be successful in this position, you will have completed a Bachelor of Pharmacy and be a registered Pharmacist with a current APC and hold valid right to work documentation for Aotearoa. What you'll experienceOur purpose is to make Kiwis' lives a little better every day.As a Woolworths Pharmacy team member you will receive a generous salary, bonus and company shares as well as:Travel/transfer opportunitiesRegular pay reviewsSupportive team environmentSupport further learning - we will pay for courses and trainingClear supportive career developmentReimbursement of APC, PDA and membership to PSNZGrocery discount card - 5 -10% off your groceries!Half price online delivery and free online delivery for new parentsEmployee Assistance ProgramDiscounts on health insurance, dental, optometrists, gym memberships, JB Hi-Fi, PB tech and many more!Samsung partnership - AMAZING discountsWe’re friendly, down-to-earth, and energetic - we work hard but we have a great time doing it, and we love what we do. There is plenty of scope for new ideas, lots of room for you to add value, and importantly, you’ll be working with a business that touches the lives of three million New Zealanders a week. Endless possibilities with Woolworths GroupWe're a proud part of the Woolworths Group – 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives working together connected by a shared Purpose – ‘to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow.Here you’ll be supported and empowered to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week. Backed by a culture of genuine care, a flexible approach to work and the support to grow your career and make a meaningful impact, the possibilities for what we can achieve together are endless.Everyone belongs Woolworths GroupWe believe that diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging are key to realising our purpose of better together for a better tomorrow. We recognise the value our team’s diversity brings to our business, our customers and our communities, and that teams with diverse experiences and backgrounds enrich our group and are better able to innovate and solve problems. As one of the largest employers in Australia and New Zealand, we aim to create a truly inclusive workplace where everyone feels that they belong, can be their best self and reach their full potential.We encourage all candidates to apply, please let us know in your application if we can support you with any adjustments in the hiring process.

jobs.title: TECHNICAL SERVICE SUPERSTAR
jobs.description: Foton New Zealand - Hamilton Head OfficePlease Quote Reference Number 14643Trade Qualified Automotive TechnicianMake a real impact at a distributor levelSupportive team in a new, purpose-built facilityFoton New Zealand is the official importer and distributor of Foton commercial vehicles in NZ. As we undergo an exciting brand and product transformation, we're gearing up for the next chapter. That's why we're looking for a Technical Service Superstar who is ready to lead, train, diagnose and support our national dealer network, as well as help roll out the next generation of commercial vehicles, including new energy.Based at our brand-new, purpose-built head office in Hamilton, this is your chance to join a fast-expanding truck brand in NZ and make a real impact at a distributor level. You'll have the support of a small but super-human team who genuinely back each other when things get tough.If you're the type who loves solving tricky faults, coaching techs, building dealer network capability, and being the person everyone calls when things get weird - we want you!What You'll Do:Deliver hands-on & virtual training for dealer technicians nationwide.Support diagnostics, complex repairs, and technical queries across the network.Develop clear, effective training materials, bulletins, and job aids.Spot emerging technical trends and drive improvements.Assist with product rectification, and new product launches.Build strong relationships across dealers, OEM, and internal teams.Manage warranty-based repairs for support service agents nationwideSupport the warranty department to assess, guide and submit claimsWhat You'll Bring:Trade-qualified Automotive Technician with proven workshop experience.Minimum 5 years' experience as a Light/Heavy automotive technician.Strong diagnostics skills across ICE and ideally EV/hybrid systems.Strong problem-solving abilities.Excellent written and verbal communication skills for clear, effective interaction with our team and customers.Solid organisational skills and the ability to work independently.A full, clean, and current driver license (class 2 or higher would be even better).Experience as a technical trainer would be a big plus.Why Foton NZ?This isn't just a "sit behind a desk" role. It's hands-on, influential, and sometimes mission critical. You'll shape capability, lift standards, and help drive the future of the Foton brand in New Zealand. Plus, did we mention you'll get to work with a super awesome team?If you're ready to step into a role where your technical knowledge actually matters, hit Apply - we'd love to hear from you.Please Quote Reference Number 14643

jobs.title: Loss Prevention Manager
jobs.description: Farmers The Base is searching for our next Loss Prevention Manager who has experience in managing a team of people and most importantly understands the fundamentals of creating a loss prevention culture within a business!As a Loss Prevention Manager you look after Health and Safety, compliance and operations as well as continuously delivering customer service. You will be responsible for leading a culture in store that promotes preventing stock losses from all avenues within our store. As an expert in Loss Prevention and or retail operations, we know that you'll bring a wealth of knowledge with you and to set you up for success.We will provide you with a structured training programme to support you as you learn all about our business and way of operating. Experience in retail leadership is preferred as this role is not a sit behind the cameras role but rather, leads the team from the front.We'll expect you to identify areas and opportunities for improvement, drive a culture of loss prevention through your management of your loss prevention team and the wider store team; by taking the business forward through expert leadership.So what else will you need?Previous experience managing a team of peopleA proven history of loss prevention management and/or retail operationsStrong communication skills both written and verballyA High level operator who knows about trends and takes corrective actionThe ability to work autonomouslyGreat organisational and planning skills and the ability to prioritise workloads to effectively meet deadlineWhat does an average day look like?Completing action plansImplementing safe work practices and adhering to Health and Safety standardsUncovering internal theft, Implementing strategies to prevent theftWorking with the store management team to identify high risk areas and taking steps to reduce the riskWhat's in it for you?A competitive salary and ongoing training and development to help you achieve your career objectivesA generous staff discount package across the Farmers and James Pascoe GroupA fantastic opportunity to join a well known New Zealand retail brand.This is a Full Time role working 40 hours per week and will require flexibility for early starts and late nights. Weekend work is required as part of the management roster.This role is all about having an exceptional loss prevention team who are dedicated to implementing our core loss prevention strategies. It revolves around reducing risk through managing a culture of customer service in store - this role is highly customer focusedAt Farmers we offer excellent career progression - we are seeking an ambitious high performing leader who sees their career in our business. Apply online today! Entitlement to work in New ZealandIn accordance with the Immigration Act 2009, you will be asked to provide evidence of your entitlement to work in New Zealand during the selection process. If invited to interview, you will be required to bring original documentation with you. Please refer to our Frequently Asked Questions on our Contact Us page for more information.

jobs.title: PLAYGROUND INSTALLER ASSIST
jobs.description: Handy on the tools? Finishing up a trades course? Leaving School? We’ve got a job for you! We’re looking for a Playground Installer Assist to help us construct and install innovative playgrounds around New Zealand.If you enjoy working outdoors, aren’t afraid of doing the hard yards, and are ready to join a company where teamwork – and fun - comes to the fore, then look no further.So, what does a Playground Installer Assist do? You’ll be an integral part of our construction team, helping to build and install playgrounds in the education sector and for local communities. If you’re a recent school leaver, someone who has finished a pre-trade course, or someone looking for a career change, we think this role could be perfect for you.You’ll need to be confident using construction tools, take pride in your work, and know the importance of playing by the rules – health and safety is non-negotiable here. A positive attitude and a sense of humour are on our checklist too. MORE ABOUT PLAYGROUND CREATIONSPlayground Creations is a locally owned Waikato business that designs, manufactures and installs playgrounds for councils, community groups, and the education sector. Our head office and factory are based in Hamilton/Kirikiriroa, but we install playgrounds across Aotearoa.Our motto is to create play for every day! We design unique playgrounds that reflect and respect the surrounding environment, use natural sustainable materials, state-of-the-art equipment, and install it all with a dynamic team. We are leaders in the field who create playgrounds that inspire and ignite the magic of play.What the job involves............As a Playground Installer Assist, you’ll be a versatile, all-rounder who enjoys:being a part of the installation team on our customer siteshelping to ensure our playgrounds are delivered to a high standardlearning from our lead installers and following their instructionsconstructing our timber playground components in our workshophelping to keep the yard and workshop organisedassisting with the movement of our equipment Please note, because our playgrounds are installed throughout New Zealand, there will be overnight travel required from time to time (usually 1-2 weeks at a time).What skills and experience do you need?......To be a successful Playground Installer Assist you will need some knowledge and experience in the use of a variety of tools and construction methods, but you will also receive excellent training on the job to help grow your skills. You will think creatively, thrive on challenges, show initiative, and be willing to listen and learn.You will also need to:have a valid and clean NZ Driver’s Licensebe self-motivated and able to work unsupervisedbe a team playertake instruction and be adaptablebe fit and healthy and capable of carrying out a wide range of workbe willing to participate in Health and Safety conversationsbe willing to travel throughout New Zealand and be away from home for periods of time (usually only a week or two). Accommodation, meals, and allowances will be paid.Due to the nature of our clients the successful applicant will need to pass a police vetting process and may need to undergo drug testing. Applicants for this position should have NZ Residency or a valid NZ Work Visa.Ready to apply?As Confucius says: “Choose a job you love and you will never have to work a day in your life”. This is your opportunity to be involved in a locally owned and operated company where people are valued, work is appreciated, and fun is had!If this sounds like you apply today!

jobs.title: Experienced Bricklayers Wanted
jobs.description: Join a Leading Labour Hire Team!Are you a skilled bricklayer looking for consistent work with great pay and long-term opportunities? Extrastaff is currently hiring experienced bricklayers for upcoming construction projects across Hamilton and the wider Waikato region.Whether you're qualified or have solid hands-on experience, we want to hear from you.What We Offer:Competitive hourly ratesConsistent ongoing workWeekly payOpportunities for permanent placementPPE provided + site inductions arrangedSupportive team environmentYour Duties Will Include:Laying bricks, blocks, and pavers with precisionMixing and applying mortarReading and interpreting plans or site instructionsWorking efficiently to meet deadlinesEnsuring quality workmanship on all buildsFollowing all health & safety protocols on-siteWhat You’ll Need:Proven experience as a bricklayer (qualified or experienced)Good understanding of bricklaying tools and materialsAbility to work independently and as part of a teamReliable transport to and from siteStrong work ethic and attention to detailSite Safe and/or relevant certifications (preferred but not essential)About ExtrastaffWe are one of New Zealand’s leading labour hire companies, supplying skilled workers to top-tier projects nationwide. Our focus is on building strong relationships with our workers and clients through reliability, safety, and performance. Apply Now!Email your CV or a brief introduction to: zaheen@extrastaff.co.nzStart your next bricklaying role with a company that values your skills and supports your career growth.

jobs.title: Whāngaia Ngā Pā Harakeke Coordinator
jobs.description: WNPH- Integrated Safety Response Coordinator !Based at MSD Contact Centre – Te Rapa Park, HamiltonBand HPolice EmployeeFixed term - Full Time – 12 MonthsNAVJR 5640266 E tῡ ki te kei o te waka, kia pakia koe e ngā ngaru o te wā.Stand at the stern of the canoe and feel the spray of the future biting at your faceMō te tūnga | About the roleIntegrated Safety Response (ISR) is a multi-agency initiative ensuring families experiencing family violence get the help they need from Government and community services. ISR involves core agencies closely working together to support victims, perpetrators, and their families. ISR operates in two sites, Christchurch, and Hamilton. Police is the operational lead and hosting agency for ISR, as part of Te Puna Aonui - the Joint Venture for Family Violence and Sexual Violence. ISR operates seven days a week, so flexibility is required as you may be required to work some weekends and statutory holidays. Key Accountabilities:Review and triage all reports of family violence received via Police, Corrections, and partner agencies. Facilitate and coordinate multi agency Safety Assessment Meetings. Ensure a balanced allocation of work to service providers based on the needs of families and whanau. Review and monitor process of cases. Lead and influence appropriate information sharing to ensure whanau safety. Liaise with Partner Agencies as appropriate to ensure accurate information sharing and progress of Family Safety Plans. Ability to lead collaborative engagement with partners or stakeholders. Ability to foster and encourage innovative and diverse approaches. Know how to proactively manage or escalate identified risks. This role is Individual Contributor/Emerging Leader level. Our employees enjoy significant investment in their development not only at an individual level, but also at the team and community practice level. jobs.title: Baker
jobs.description: Roster option 1Sunday Thursday 3:00 AM 12:30 PMWorking with Woolworths Supermarkets New Zealand | Te Mahi ki Woolworths Supermarkets New ZealandWith over 185 stores and 20,000 team members across Aotearoa, we've made it our mission to make Kiwi lives a little better every day. We're friendly, down-to-earth, and energetic - we work hard but we have a great time doing it, and we love what we do. There is plenty of scope for new ideas, lots of room for you to add value, and importantly, you'll be working with a business that touches the lives of three million New Zealanders a week.We embrace diversity of thought and love to take on challenges with a pragmatic and innovative approach. Our culture thrives on mutual respect, care, curiosity, openness, and a proactive attitude. We continually seek ways to pair, collaborate, support, and learn from each other as a team!About the Role | Mō te TūrangaWe’re looking for a Baker to join our Woolworths New Zealand team.We’re proud of the diversity of our team and the roles they play in running our store - this role is great for anyone who is looking to build their bakery career. Join the best smelling department in the store, test your creativity and showcase your passion! As our new Baker, you could expect to:Prepare and bake quality cakes and breads for the departmentChampion Health and Safety and Food Safety practices to ensure an excellent level of customer service for our bakery customersTrain, develop and supervise apprentices and team members in the Bakery Department About You | MōuWe are looking for our next Baker to have:Previous experience and demonstrated knowledge in bakingA strong customer focus, excellent communication skillsThe ability to work under pressure, work flexibly and to tight framesOur Benefits | To Tatou PaingaOur Team Members are at the heart of everything we do and we’re always looking for ways to support your career journey and reward great work including:Everyday Rewards team card, providing a range of benefits including discounts and bonus points for groceries and discounted online shopping delivery.Banking and insurance (health, life etc) discounts Global and local career opportunitiesEndless possibilities with Woolworths GroupWe're a proud part of the Woolworths Group – 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives working together connected by a shared Purpose – ‘to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow.Here you’ll be supported and empowered to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week. Backed by a culture of genuine care, a flexible approach to work and the support to grow your career and make a meaningful impact, the possibilities for what we can achieve together are endless.Everyone belongs Woolworths GroupWe believe that diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging are key to realising our purpose of better together for a better tomorrow. We recognise the value our team’s diversity brings to our business, our customers and our communities, and that teams with diverse experiences and backgrounds enrich our group and are better able to innovate and solve problems. As one of the largest employers in Australia and New Zealand, we aim to create a truly inclusive workplace where everyone feels that they belong, can be their best self and reach their full potential.We encourage all candidates to apply, please let us know in your application if we can support you with any adjustments in the hiring process.

jobs.title: Class 4/5 Drivers
jobs.description: NOW HIRING: Class 4/5 Truck Drivers – Asphalt & Civil ProjectsLocation: HamiltonCompany: ExtrastaffAre you an experienced Class 4/5 Truck Driver with a background in asphalt work or civil construction? Join Extrastaff, New Zealand's leading provider of skilled labour, and play a key role in delivering essential infrastructure projects across Auckland.We’re looking for reliable, motivated drivers to join our growing team. If you're ready for ongoing, long-term work with great pay, job security, and career development, we want to hear from you! About the Role:You'll be transporting asphalt and civil materials to and from worksites, supporting road construction and paving teams. This is a full-time role with steady hours and potential for permanent placement.Key Responsibilities:Drive and operate Class 4/5 trucks safely and efficientlyTransport asphalt and aggregates to siteAssist paving crews as neededEnsure vehicle and load safety at all timesFollow health & safety procedures on active job sitesCommunicate effectively with site supervisors and crew What We Offer:Competitive pay based on experienceOngoing work with major civil projectsPPE provided and support with trainingOpportunities to upskill and growA safety-first, supportive team environmentWhat You'll Need: Full NZ Class 4/5 Driver's LicenceAsphalt or civil site experience (preferred)Strong reliability and time managementUnderstanding of site health & safetyWillingness to work in a team and assist on-site if needed Ready to Apply?Send your CV to zaheen@extrastaff.co.nz or apply today to join a company that values your skills and supports your career!

jobs.title: Mobile Phone Repair Technician
jobs.description: DescriptionSeeking an experienced Mobile phone repair technician. We provide high-quality mobile repair service and are the one-stop shop for all your digital device repair needs. The candidate should have at least three years of mobile phone repairing experience or min. Level 5 qualification. The pay would be from $26 - $32 (depending on experience) for a full-time and permanent job. Hours per week: would be between 30 – 50 hours per week The following are the job duties that would be performed:Determining software and hardware requirements to support and provide requirements with knowledge and the maintenance of mobile phones.Responding to inquiries and resolving technical problemsIdentify causes of software and hardware malfunctions and coordinate and carry out repairs or replacements neededInstalling and downloading software required by individual customerEnsuring efficient use and knowledge of equipment with products knowledge of new devices and software packages that have come into the country with research to support valued customersUse knowledge of hardware to repair and replace peripheral equipment and any faults, damage, or other issues with hardware on clients’ devices.Refer clients to appropriate avenues where a repair is outside the scope of our business.Assist with sales of services (repairing devices) and products (mobile phone-related gadgets) like mobile phone cases, cable, tempered glass, etcInstall accessories for customers and advise on appropriate product useMay serve Customers by phone and Email with technical issues raisedKeep track of all devices and inventory while safeguarding all store stockUtilize the point-of-sale system to maintain an accurate record of customer information and the real-time status of each repair

jobs.title: Carpenters
jobs.description: We are looking for experienced Carpenters to join our business, Extrastaff Limited. Our growing business requires organised and trustworthy individuals who pride themselves on quality workmanship. You must be motivated and result driven.You might be asked to work across the country to assist with our projects, so flexibility on work locations is preferred.The Carpenter and Joiner is responsible for:Shape or cut materials to specified measurements, using hand tools, machines, or power saws.Follow established safety rules and regulations and maintain a safe and clean environment.Measure and mark cutting lines on materials, using a ruler, pencil, chalk, and marking gauge.Install structures or fixtures, such as windows, frames, floorings, trim, or hardware, using carpenters’ hand or power tools.Verify the trueness of structure, using plumb bob and level.Build or repair cabinets, doors, frameworks, floors, or other wooden fixtures used in buildings, using woodworking machines, carpenter’s hand tools, or power tools.Select and order lumber or other required materials.Assemble and fasten materials to make frameworks or props, using hand tools and wood screws, nails, dowel pins, or glue.Remove damaged or defective parts or sections of structures and repair or replace, using hand tools.Maintain records, document actions, and present written progress reports.Inspect ceiling or floor tile, wall coverings, siding, glass, or woodwork to detect broken or damaged structures.Erect scaffolding or ladders for assembling structures above ground level.Finish surfaces of woodwork or wallboard in houses or buildings, using paint, hand tools, or panelling.Studying drawings and creating forming shutters for concrete workCreating structures, forms or chutes for pouring concrete for large concrete jobsArrange for subcontractors to deal with special areas, such as heating or electrical wiring work.Cover subfloors with building paper to keep out moisture and lay hardwood, parquet, or wood-strip-block floors by nailing floors to subfloor or cementing them to mastic or asphalt base.Fill cracks or other defects in plaster or plasterboard and sand patch, using patching plaster, trowel, and sanding tool.Apply shock-absorbing, sound-deadening, or decorative panelling to ceilings or walls.Prepare cost estimates for clients or employers.Work with or remove hazardous material.Perform minor plumbing, welding, or concrete mixing work.All other duties as assignedPay conditionsMin $27.00 per hour to a maximum of $33.00 per hourHours of workMinimum 30 hours of work is guaranteedSkills and experience required:2+ years relevant experience in carpentry OR relevant qualification is preferred, but not essentialFriendly, with good time management, & excellent work ethic are essentialTime management skillsA commitment to learning and developing your skills within the industrySound knowledge of H&S proceduresReliable and hardworkingLocationYou will primarily be required to work in Auckland, Waikato, Bay of Plenty, Hawke's Bay, Taranaki, Gisborne, Wellington, Nelson-Tasman, Canterbury, and Southland, with occasional travel to Otago, West Coast, Whanganui-Manawatu, Marlborough, and Northland.This role will be permanent and full-time jobIf this sounds like you, please send your resume and brief covering letter outlining your experience.Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

jobs.title: Technical Officer, Health Science
jobs.description: Bring learning to life by supporting world-class teaching, research, and simulation in health sciences.Are you a hands-on technical professional with strong laboratory or clinical-skills experience, and a passion for supporting teaching, research, and innovative digital technologies?This is a fantastic opportunity to join the Division of Health and contribute to the delivery of high-quality learning experiences that help shape the next generation of health professionals. Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleAs a Technical Officer in the Division of Health, you’ll deliver high-quality technical support that underpins our teaching and research in Health Science from applied sciences and clinical skills to simulation and cutting-edge digital technologies. Your primary focus will be on clinical skills and simulation technologies, including the set-up and operation of high-fidelity manikins, task trainers, virtual-patient platforms, AV systems, and VR/AR devices. You will also support applied science laboratories, working collaboratively as part of a team of Technical Officers to ensure seamless delivery across the Division. While you’ll have your own focus area, you’ll also share knowledge and responsibilities across the team, particularly with colleagues in applied sciences, ensuring our staff and students receive seamless, expert support at every stage.Salary will be in the range of $71,275 to $84,695 per year, prorated based on skills, knowledge and experience brought to the position. This is a one-year fixed-term 1 FTE parental cover role (37.5 hours a week) based at our Hillcrest Campus.For more information on the role please see the position description. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You are an experienced technical professional with at least five years’ experience in a clinical skills, health science, or laboratory-based role. You bring strong practical skills in operating and maintaining laboratory equipment, clinical devices, and/or simulation technologies.You will demonstrate:Hands-on technical capability with scientific and clinical equipmentExperience troubleshooting, calibrating, installing and maintaining instrumentsStrong ICT capability, including digital tools, data management and AV/VR technologiesExperience supporting teaching and/or research environmentsExcellent communication skills, and the ability to support staff and students in real timeStrong organisational and time-management skills, including project coordinationKnowledge of health and safety requirements and laboratory complianceFlexibility to support varied teaching schedules and operational needsA relevant tertiary qualification (Master’s degree desirable) Preferred candidates will also bring experience in:Simulation manikins and scenario programmingVR/AR and digital learning technologiesAV/IT systems for teaching and simulationYou are a strong team player, collaborative, proactive, customer-focused, and committed to continuous improvement.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The Division of Health is committed to achieving better, fairer health outcomes across Aotearoa through high-quality teaching, innovative research, and partnerships with Māori, Pacific and community organizations.Our programmes span Biomedical Sciences, Health Promotion, Healthy Active Living, Human Performance Science, Midwifery, Nursing, Pharmacy and Sport Development and Coaching. A major strategic focus is the establishment of the New Zealand Graduate School of Medicine, opening in 2028.You will join a dynamic technical team that supports state-of-the-art laboratories, clinical simulation facilities, and digital-learning technologies, all designed to enrich student learning and enhance research capability.He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?This is an exciting opportunity to play a key role in supporting the development of future health professionals. You will work with new and emerging technologies, contribute to meaningful teaching and research, and be part of a collaborative and forward-thinking Division.Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. E herea ana te Whare Wānanga ki te kaupapa kia whakaratohia te mea angitū ōrite ki ngā tāngata katoa.Applications Close on January 18, 2026Requisition number: 1003246

jobs.title: Technical Officer in Chemistry and Environmental Sciences
jobs.description: Contribute to world leading researchJoin a supportive and innovative Science team Great work environment with additional university leave and competitive superannuation Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleAs a Technical Officer within Te Aka Mātuatua School of Science, you’ll provide high-quality technical support that underpins teaching and research across the Chemistry and Environmental Science programmes. You’ll be part of a collaborative team of skilled technicians, each with their own area of expertise, working together to ensure our laboratories run smoothly and safely.From maintaining and operating specialist equipment to supporting staff and students in their learning and research, you’ll play a key role in creating an environment where scientific discovery and innovation can thrive.Salary will be in the range of $71,275 - $84,695 per year based on skills, knowledge and experience brought to the position. This is a full-time role (37.5 hours a week), based on our Hillcrest Campus.For more information on the role please see the position description. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted. Please note: Applications will be reviewed as they are received.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You’ll bring a relevant tertiary qualification in Chemistry or Environmental Science with a strong background in a scientific and chemistry environment with excellent laboratory and technical skills. You have a proven track record in operating and maintaining laboratory instruments, equipment, reagents etc. Additional experience in operating a variety of analytical instruments including liquid and gas chromatography and spectrometry is desirable. Highly organised and detail-oriented, you can manage competing priorities while maintaining a safe, efficient, and innovative lab environment. You’re an excellent communicator, confident with data and ICT systems, and committed to professional growth.Collaborative yet able to work independently, you build positive relationships across diverse teams and student groups. Flexible, proactive, and service-driven, you approach challenges with initiative and problem-solving flair. Most importantly, you’re dedicated to continuous improvement, cultural safety, and supporting the University’s values, including our partnership with Māori under Te Tiriti o Waitangi.Don’t meet every single requirement?Research shows that some people are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. At The University of Waikato, we’re committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and genuine workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t perfectly match every listed qualification, we still encourage you to apply. You might be just the right person for this or another opportunity on our team.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? STEM, The Division of Science, Engineering and Computing comprises the Schools of Te Aka Mātuatua Science, Te Kura Mata-Ao Engineering and Au Reikura Computing and Mathematical Sciences. The Division also has several research units, including the Environmental Research Institute and commercial/equipment units which embody staff and research activities.He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here.Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. E herea ana te Whare Wānanga ki te kaupapa kia whakaratohia te mea angitū ōrite ki ngā tāngata katoa.Applications Close on Sunday 11th January 2026Requisition number: 1003209

jobs.title: Truck Driver
jobs.description: About Us You've probably seen our recognisable polar bear logo on trucks going from town to town across our beautiful country. No surprise if you have - Big Chill Distribution is a leader in the storage and express delivery of chilled and frozen products nationwide, with eleven depots strategically positioned throughout New Zealand. We pride ourselves on delivering excellence in transportation services from collection to delivery. About the Role We are looking ano experienced Class 2 Truck Driver to join our team. You will have at least 6 months' experience and ideally experienced in temperature-controlled transport, as you will be working with chilled and frozen goods.Being the face of Big Chill out on the roads, you will also bring to our team excellent communication and customer service skills. This is a full-time role, working Monday to Friday starting at 5:30am, with rostered weekend work and based in our Hamilton branch.Key responsibilities include Delivery and pick up of chilled and frozen products Providing assistance to the Stores team to present product for loading/unloading Collaborating with dispatchers to ensure timely deliveries Compliance in delivery times and temperature control of customer goods About You Qualified Class 2 driver with at least 6 months' experience OSH Forklift Operator certified with experience operating a forkliftExperience working in frozen/temperature-controlled environments Demonstrable organisational and time management abilities Committed to delivering exceptional customer service at all times Strong understanding of Health, Safety and Compliance. What can Big Chill offer you? Well-maintained, top-of-the-line vehicles equipped with the latest technology for your safety A supportive team who uplift one another and strive for success A business with over 25 years of industry experience - the opportunity to learn is endless Our Values At Big Chill, our core values are the foundation of everything we do. We are committed to Family and Team, Encouragement, Accountability and Honesty, Image and Brand, and Respect. We support each other to work safely together, empower and encourage people to be their best, take accountability for our actions, are dedicated to exhibiting a positive image, and we have respect for one another. If you're ready to join our team and embark on a rewarding career in transportation, we want to hear from you! Apply here now - please submit your resume and cover letter to embark on a cool adventure with Big Chill. The successful candidate will be required to pass a drug test and satisfactory MOJ criminal check and ACC check prior to commencement.

jobs.title: Parts, Accessories & Inward Goods Representative
jobs.description: About the roleJoin the team at Boyd Motorcycles' as a full-time Parts, Accessories & Inward Goods Representative. In this integral role, you will be responsible for managing the inward goods for our busy motorcycle dealership. Based in our Hamilton Central Waikato location, this is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the smooth running of our operations.What you'll be doingProcessing and organising the receipt of new motorcycle parts and accessories deliveriesMaintaining accurate inventory records and stock levels to ensure timely fulfilment of customer ordersAssisting with the preparation and dispatch of parts orders to customers and our service departmentProviding excellent customer service to both internal and external customersActively participating in the ongoing improvement of our parts and accessories management processesSupporting the wider team with general operational duties as requiredWhat we're looking forPrevious experience in a similar parts, accessories or inward goods role, ideally within the automotive industryStrong attention to detail and organisational skills to maintain accurate inventory recordsExcellent communication and customer service skills to liaise effectively with customersA proactive and solutions-oriented approach to problem-solvingCompetent with using inventory management systems and computer softwareA genuine passion for motorcycles and the automotive industryWhat we offerAt Boyd Motorcycles', we are committed to providing a supportive and rewarding work environment for our team. In addition to a competitive salary, you will enjoy ongoing training and development opportunities, staff discounts on motorcycle parts and accessories, and a range of wellness initiatives to support your wellbeing.About usBoyd Motorcycles' is a leading motorcycle dealership in the Waikato region, known for our exceptional customer service and extensive range of new and pre-owned motorcycles, parts and accessories. As a family-owned business with over 20 years of industry experience, we pride ourselves on fostering a positive, collaborative culture where our team members can thrive.Apply now to join our team and be a part of the exciting journey ahead!

jobs.title: Showroom Picker
jobs.description: Are you someone who enjoys a mix of hands-on work and customer interaction? As a Showroom Picker, you'll play a key role in ensuring our customers have a seamless and positive experience from start to finish. Working closely with our sales team, you'll be responsible for picking products from the warehouse and bringing them to the showroom's collection area. Whether it's helping a customer get a fridge to their car or simply making their day with a friendly chat, your role is crucial to making sure they leave satisfied.What You'll Do:Product Picking: Retrieve products, such as fridges, from the warehouse based on orders from showroom sales consultants.Customer Interaction: Bring products to the showroom's collections area, and assist customers in transporting them to their vehicles.Customer Service: Engage with customers in a friendly manner, ensuring a positive final interaction as they complete their purchase.What We're Looking For:Forklift License: Essential for safely operating in the warehouse environment.Warehousing Experience: Familiarity with inventory management and order picking.Customer Service: Basic customer interaction skills to assist with product collections and queries.Hours:Monday - Friday: 8am - 6pmSaturday - Sunday: 8:30am - 6pmSet roster: Tuesday - Saturday or Sunday - ThursdayWhy Join Us?This role offers a great balance of warehouse duties and customer interaction. With a supportive team environment, a set roster, and competitive pay, this is a fantastic opportunity for someone who enjoys making a positive impact on customers' experiences. Plus, you'll have the satisfaction of knowing you've helped someone complete their purchase and leave with a smile.

Automotive Employment NZ has been awarded Sourcr Automotive Agency of the Year for the second year in a row (2024-2025).We are looking for an experienced trade qualified automotive technician with franchise dealership experience and a current WOF licence to join one of New Zealand’s most significant automotive dealership networks.The roleGeneral servicingDiagnostics and fault findingMinor and major repairsWOF checksAssisting wherever required in the workshopExplaining repairs to customers when requiredRequirementsTrade qualified automotive technicianYou MUST have a current WOF licenceFranchise brand training is a bonusKeen to live and work in Hamilton - it would be beneficial if you already live in the area or have accommodation availableSolid diagnostics capabilityGood communication skillsAbility to work well in a busy, productive workshopAccurate worker with good efficiencyGood referencesIn returnYou will be paid a solid hourly rate with a monthly performance bonus and have the opportunity to work in a well-appointed workshop in the beautiful Hamilton region.New Zealand's fourth largest city, Hamilton, is a thriving metropolitan hub on the banks of the Waikato River. jobs.title: Customer Service, Showroom and Sales Support

jobs.title: Operations Assistant - SESTA
jobs.description: Reference: 6839096We are seeking a motivated people person to assist with the day to day running of our Hamilton SESTA (Specialised School Transport Assistance) operation.SESTA is a highly rewarding community service that we provide for the Ministry of Education, this service ensures the safe transport of around 420 students daily from their front door to school, and home again.Based at our Hamilton office, you will assist with the planning of runs as part of the support team for drivers, parents/caregivers, and schools, along with administrative duties including recruitment and payroll.The role:Administrative tasks to support the smooth day-to-day operation of our SESTA services.Assist with the planning, implementation, and monitoring of SESTA runs to ensure they are fit for purpose and operate efficiently.Provide driving coverage for SESTA runs as required.Monitor compliance to ensure contractual and legislative obligations are met.Support the SESTA Operations Manager with various tasks as needed.Act as the key liaison for SESTA drivers, schools, and parents/caregivers, responding to queries and providing support.What are we looking for?Excellent communication skills, verbal & written with a strong attention to detail.Professional, well-organised, and reliable.The ability to establish and maintain positive relationships with schools, parents / caregivers and drivers.A natural problem solver with a proactive approach to finding solutions.Tech savvy, and a willingness to adapt to new systems.A positive and can-do attitude.Held a full Class 1 NZ Drivers Licence for more than two years (Passenger Endorsement required but we can assist in obtaining this)Ability to pass a medical, police vetting check and undergo a pre-employment drug and alcohol test.What can we offer?Generous employee discounts across our wider group of companiesWellbeing benefits including free flu vaccinations and EAPFull induction with ongoing training and development with the wider CCR team.Who are we? Cross Country Rentals is more than just a rental company having a wide range of vehicles in the fleet and providing specialised transport services. We are a kiwi, family owned and operated company with branches throughout New Zealand. Transporting people is extremely important to us, taking students to and from school. Supporting our local community is a big part of what we've been doing for almost 100 years! Our fleet has grown rapidly comprising over 2000 vehicles nationwide, from small cars to large trucks and everything in between.Interested or want to know more? Please email: recruitment@crosscountryrentals.co.nzApplications will be reviewed as they are received. All candidates for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work permit.Applications Close: 05 Jan 2026

jobs.title: HEAD GROOM WANTED AT BOUTIQUE RACING STABLE
jobs.description: Come and work in a job where you can be outside and work with horses with a fun and professional team. We have a small and very professional team of racehorses. Although we train racehorses to a high level, we also have a 30-acre property that has horses grazing and also starting horses under saddle. What we need is someone who is looking to develop their knowledge further in all aspects with horses but also someone who can come in and be an asset to the team straight away. Time management is very important and also getting jobs finished in a timely manner.This isn't an easy job, early mornings, very physical and a degree of danger comes with working with young racehorses. Having a hard working, positive attitude and being able to work well with others and follow instructions is very important. We start at 5am-9am, Monday-Saturday and 6:30am-8am on Sunday mornings, if you can't wake up and be at work on time please do not apply, we are a small team and if one person lets the team down it takes a toll on everyone else. Afternoons are from 2:30pm-4:30pm every day.We have a roster that requires you to work every second weekend and you will get afternoons off during the week; we are flexible on afternoons and weekends for the right candidate. So please apply even if you can't work every second weekend but happy to work in with the team and happy to work a weekend during the month. If you want to ride, we are happy to help but this will only be after we have seen a video of your riding and/or see you riding. If we are happy and comfortable you can ride to a level that is required, we will put the time and effort into teaching you further if required.Experience is a bonus but not a must, there is a certain amount of learning on the job. But animal sense, following instructions and reliability is extremely important.
