jobs.title: Substation Design Engineer
jobs.description: You will undertake 33kV and 11kV substation and network design works, along with the design of ancillary systems by applying professional design and estimating practices throughout the processAre you familiar with power transformers, GIS switchgear and protection relays?Have you got a passion for safety in design principles?Annual salary reviews and health, life and income protection insuranceWorks Programme is a key group within the core operational groups here at WEL. As a group we always aim to deliver work within targeted times, meeting and exceeding customer expectations, with a workforce model which is capable, scalable, and adaptable to shifting demands and requirements. These goals are being challenged through a significant and positive change in the growth of Hamilton City and Waikato.About the roleAs a Substation Design Engineer, you will undertake 33kV and 11kV Substation and network design works, along with the design of ancillary systems, ensuring they meet safety, customer, operational, quality and commercial requirements by applying professional design and estimating practices throughout the design process. The Substation Design Engineer role is central to the core capabilities of the Works Programme team, with the specialist knowledge and skills to generate quality designs that enhance electrical network assets while collaborating with Project Managers and Planner/Estimators to assure designs are constructible.About youWe are looking for someone who has:A recognised BE Electrical or equivalent degreeA minimum of 5 years’ experience in the construction or design of electricity network infrastructure within the substation environmentKnowledge of Safety in Design and delivery principles for electrical equipment and networksExperience with SAP or similar software is desirableA proven commitment to safety in our workBest-in-class benefitsAt WEL, we look after our people, and you’ll benefit from a powerful package of benefits:Medical, life and income protection insuranceFlexible working options – work from home up to two days per week, ability to purchase additional annual leave, 9-day fortnight, and much moreRelocation costs, andAn excellent salary package, including annual salary reviewsWe are committed to making sure our people go home safe every day, and with a drug and alcohol-free worksite we will require you to undertake testing as part of your pre-employment health assessment as well as participating in our annual health assessment programme.About WEL NetworksWEL Networks is unique. We’ve been serving the Waikato for over 100 years, distributing electricity from the national grid so we can power over 100,000 homes and businesses.With around 320 employees, we’re proudly based in Hamilton and are owned by the community we work for. We play an important role in the region's economic and social development by identifying and investing in new technologies to future-proof our region – and keep our communities flourishing. Our vision is bold. And our ambition even stronger, especially as we diversify from traditional ‘poles and lines’ to an innovative and sustainable business.Ready to learn more? Start here.We actively value diversity, inclusion and want extraordinary people to join us. It is important to us that we get to experience a little bit of the 'real you' in your application. Check out the full position description for more details.Applications will be screened as they arrive, and we may move quickly to interview.

jobs.title: Machine Operator
jobs.description: About UsLaminex New Zealand forms part of the Building Products division of Fletcher Building and we are a trusted business partner with market-leading brands for great design spaces, offering expert knowledge and exceptional value to our customers. We have a fantastic people culture at Laminex, and our priority is to make all our people feel welcomed when they join and feel valued as they continue their journey with us.About the Role:Our Hamilton plant based in Pukete has been making Melteca board for over 40 years and you’ll find Melteca in your home, schools, hospitals, retirement villages, and commercial buildings. As a Machine Operator, you will play a vital role in our safety-driven production environment as you gain experience, you’ll take on responsibilities of setting machine parameters, monitoring system performance, making real-time adjustments via digital control panels and switches, operating forklifts, quality control and troubleshooting to ensure safe, smooth, and efficient production. This role has rotating shifts: 4 days on and 4 days off – 2 days, 2 nights (42-hour week). To succeed in this position, you should have:A minimum 2–3 years of hands-on experience as a Machine Operator in a manufacturing or production environment.Proven ability to operate both industrial machinery and forklifts safely and efficiently.Strong attention to detail and a solid commitment to maintaining quality standards in a safe work environment.Physically fit, and occasional shared lifting of up to 25 kg, and comfortable working at heights or in confined spaces.Quick to learn new processes, with strong technical aptitude and the ability to apply knowledge in a practical, hands-on setting.Able to work independently while contributing effectively to a team.Basic computer literacy, with the ability to navigate digital control systems. Preferred Class 1 Full Drivers Licence, and OSH Forklift Licence (advantageous).To ensure your and others safety, we do require pre-employment medical testing and a criminal history clearance. Please only apply if you are legally entitled to work in New Zealand.What we offer:You will receive on the job training with skills-based pay – you learn and earn higher hourly rates as you go. As part of Fletcher Building, you will have access to a wide range of great benefits including parental leave, education fund grants for you and your immediate family, employee recognition programmes, company discounts with retailers. If you believe you can take this role on and be a big part of an inclusive, diverse and fun-loving team then apply now!Our teams thrive on diversity, embracing various nationalities, languages, religions, customs, and lifestyles. We are proud of our diversity and see it as one of the things that make us better together.Studies indicate that some females and minority groups may hesitate to apply unless they meet all the criteria. If this role interests you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every requirement.

jobs.title: Lecturer in Psychology
jobs.description: Additional university leave; competitive superannuation. Contribute to innovative research and teaching in Psychology.Lead and inspire students in a dynamic academic environment. Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleThe position of Lecturer in Psychology is an exciting opportunity to make a significant contribution to Te Kura Whatu Oho Mauri, The School of Psychological and Social Sciences. We are looking for a stellar individual who will bring professional and academic experience to facilitate our portfolio of research, teaching, and postgraduate supervision in the areas of developmental psychology, perception, and cognitive neuroscience. The ideal candidate will have skills across more than one of these areas in addition to the capacity to provide leadership and innovation in teaching.Along with teaching, your well-defined programme of research will help to advance the research capacities of the School. You will also develop a range of strategic research initiatives and engage with the wider community as a consequence of your research activities.Salary will be in the range of $90,125 to $110,407 per year based on skills, knowledge and experience brought to the position. This is a full-time role (37.5 hours a week), based on our Hillcrest Campus.For more information on the role please see the position description. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted. Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You will have PhD in a relevant discipline with broad and in-depth knowledge of discipline areas that are relevant to the fields of either developmental psychology, perception, or cognitive neuroscience. The ideal candidate will have skills in more than one of these three subfields of psychology. You will have a peer reviewed publication record indicative of success in research within your subfields. You will have a clear research plan inclusive of several significant concepts that you will be developing to facilitate the field and your academic career.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? Te Kura Whatu Oho Mauri has lab based facilities on site including an EEG suite, a virtual reality system, eye tracking facilities, and a fully equipped driving simulator. We have existing links with local hospitals and external agencies for an array of research activities including fMRI work, concussion research, and ultrasound and fetal research. Te Wānanga o Ngā Kete the Division of Arts, Law, Psychology and Social Sciences (ALPSS) is a large and dynamic Division that includes Te Kura Toi the School of Arts, Te Kura Whatu Oho Mauri the School of Psychological and Social Sciences, and the School of Law, Politics, and Philosophy. The Division also has two research institutes: Te Ngira the Institute for Population Research (IPR) and Te Puna Haumaru the New Zealand Institute for Security and Crime Science (NZISCS).He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths.As a School, we are seeking to grow our lab based research portfolio and we want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. E herea ana te Whare Wānanga ki te kaupapa kia whakaratohia te mea angitū ōrite ki ngā tāngata katoa.Applications Close on December 17, 2025Requisition number: 1002718

Your day to day kitchen tasks will include maintaining cleanliness and ensuring food safety compliance, training BOH team to handle feedback professionally, collaborating with venue Business Leader on training needs and innovation and ensuring BOH team finds new ways to innovate and confidently complete services. With a competitive hourly pay range of $29 to $34 an hour for a minimum of 30 hours of work each week, this is an amazing opportunity to grow your skills and build experience with our amazing brand.To excel in this role, you should have at least two years of experience in a Sous Chef or relevant position, delegating tasks, coaching and training kitchen staff to meet common goals, and ensuring high standards of food quality and safety in a busy restaurant setting. jobs.title: Pilot Home – Whānau Support Worker Homes
jobs.description: OverviewTwo Pilot Homes are being established in Dunedin and Hamilton. This is an amazing opportunity to be a part of a new approach to care in our Homes, helping to increase the capacity for care in regions and to be a part of a wider community of practice in the region.The pilot Home will test some new concepts which are aimed at reducing challenges we face when caring for tamariki and rangatahi in small group home settings.The Homes will provide emergency, respite or planned care for up to 5 tamariki in each location. Care in the Homes will be provided by full-time live-in caregivers, supported by skilled Care Workers.These 12-month pilot Homes, named 'WHARE', will:Provide Whānau-like care with fulltime, live in caregiversBe Helped by a small group of flexible and qualified care staff, overseen by a Supervisor (Social Worker)Be focused on Achieving the goals and aspirations that tamariki and whanau have set in their All About Me PlanFocus on providing Relational and restorative careBe closely Engaged with local communities, sites and regions with leadership coming from regional teams and accountability to local, external stakeholders What successful candidates will bring to the roleQualificationsMinimum tertiary level qualification (Level 3 minimum) in humanities area in courses such as such as Social Work, Community Services, Health Services, Education or Social Science demonstrating critical thinking, ethics and sound interpersonal and communication skillsA clean, current driver’s licence is essentialSkillsAbility to develop warm, safe and meaningful relationships.Ability to be flexible and open to new learning.Understanding and appreciation of cross-cultural issues and concerns, in particular, knowledge of tikanga Māori, and Pacific peoples’ culture.Ability to develop and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and to work as a part of a multidisciplinary team.Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas to a range of audiences.The ability to collaborate with others, internally and externally, to achieve mutually agreed goals.An ability to advocate and influence action in areas where this is needed.Ability to build and maintain rapport with others based on their own integrity and honesty, demonstrating effective interpersonal skills.Sound decision making and judgement with the ability to anticipate and resolve problems and make decisions based on risk management analysis in a calm manner.This is a fixed term, full-time position based in Hamilton with an anticipated 1-year appointment.Nōu te rourou | What's in it for youThis is an opportunity to contribute to a model of care that can have life-changing impacts for tamariki/rangatahi. Successful candidates will start in the role with specific training to be best prepared for this mahi. Annual remuneration for this position starts between $77,886 and $86,082 dependant on experienceMe pēhea te tuku tono | How to ApplyApply online with your CV and Covering Letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please ensure you apply with a log in using your Oranga Tamariki email address. jobs.title: Mechanic - Hamilton
jobs.description: Love fixing cars but need a change of scenery? Want to help do things differently in the industry? We're looking for a skilled mechanic to launch our quickly growing business in Hamilton.Join the technician team at Turners Service & Repairs and use your automotive skills in a start-up environment with a great remuneration package and state-of-the-art tools.All powered by custom built technology by our engineering team, you'll have input into what systems & tools you need to do your job well. jobs.title: Branch Manager
jobs.description: Are you a dynamic leader with a passion for fashion and retail management? Glassons is seeking a talented and experienced Branch Manager to join our team and lead our store to success! Position: Branch ManagerLocation: Glassons - Hamilton Centre PlaceJob Type: Full-time (40-45 hours Tuesday to Saturday) About Glassons:Glassons is a leading fashion retailer offering the latest trends in women's clothing and accessories. jobs.title: Senior Lecturer or Associate Professor in Sport Coaching
jobs.description: Shape the future of sport coaching and leadership in Aotearoa through research, teaching, and innovation.Are you an accomplished scholar and educator in sport coaching who is passionate about inspiring future coaches, advancing knowledge, and leading impactful research?This is a unique opportunity to join the School of Sport and Human Movement at the University of Waikato and help strengthen its national and international reputation as one of the world’s top-ranked sport schools. Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleWe are seeking an outstanding academic to contribute to teaching, research, and leadership within the Sport Development and Coaching major, as well as to broader interdisciplinary collaborations across the School of Sport and Human Movement.The appointee will contribute to teaching and supervision at undergraduate and postgraduate levels, lead and support research aligned with sport coaching, and engage in professional and community partnerships that enhance sport development across Aotearoa and beyond. Depending on experience and qualifications, the position will be appointed at either Senior Lecturer or Associate Professor level.The successful candidate will:Contribute to high-quality, research-informed teaching in sport coaching. A second discipline in areas such as sport psychology, sport sociology, performance analysis, strength and conditioning, athlete wellbeing, or leadership in sport would be advantageous.Maintain an active research profile, publishing in reputable journals, securing research funding, and mentoring postgraduate students.Provide academic leadership and mentorship to colleagues, supporting the growth of research and teaching excellence within the School.Build partnerships with sport organisations, community groups, and national bodies to support knowledge exchange and real-world impact.This is a continuing, full-time role based at our Hamilton campus, with teaching and research activities that may extend to Tauranga. Salary will be in the range of $129,718 to $161,729 per year based on skills, knowledge and experience brought to the position. Please see the linked position descriptions Senior Lecturer or Associate Professor for more information.All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You will hold a PhD in Sport Coaching or a closely related discipline and bring a strong record of excellence in teaching, research, and supervision.For appointment at Senior Lecturer level, you will demonstrate:Proven tertiary-level teaching experience in sport coaching or related areas.An established record of research publications and emerging success in research funding.A commitment to high-quality student engagement, curriculum development, and innovation in teaching methods.Ability to contribute to postgraduate supervision and interdisciplinary collaborations. For appointment at Associate Professor level, you will demonstrate:A sustained record of research excellence and recognised contributions to the academic field at national and international levels.Leadership in curriculum design, academic mentorship, and the development of research teams.Success in attracting external research funding and leading postgraduate supervision.Evidence of significant academic or professional service and engagement with sport or community organisations. Across both levels, you will be recognised for your ability to inspire students, foster collaboration, and integrate Te Tiriti o Waitangi, cultural safety, and inclusion into teaching, research, and leadership practice.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The Division of Health at the University of Waikato is dedicated to improving health and wellbeing outcomes across Aotearoa. Our programmes span Biomedical Sciences, Health Promotion, Human Performance Science, Midwifery, Nursing, Pharmacy, and Sport Development and Coaching.The School of Sport and Human Movement combines expertise in human performance, coaching, health, and wellbeing. You’ll join a friendly, supportive team backed by experienced leaders who are committed to your growth.Established in 2012, CarPow is part of New Zealand’s top-ranked personal finance brokerage network, and we’re proud to be continually expanding both our lending and vehicle delivery divisions.The RoleDue to ongoing growth and increased customer demand, we’re looking for new team members to join our Sales Support / Case Management team.You’ll play a key role in guiding customers through the car finance process, including:Assisting customers with their lending needsMaking outbound calls and sending emails to gather key informationEntering and assessing customer affordability detailsResponding to questions via phone, email, and our online portalRunning credit checks and ensuring all required documents are collectedProviding admin support to the sales and compliance teamsThis is a dynamic, fast-paced role with plenty of support and clear performance milestones.About YouYou don’t need finance experience — we’ll train you from scratch.If you’re confident on the phone, organised, friendly, and motivated, you’ll settle in quickly.You’ll shine if you have:Confidence with email and online systemsA warm, approachable personalityStrong organisational and time management skillsMotivation, initiative, and a strong work ethicExcellent attention to detailWhat We OfferCompetitive monthly salaryFull training + continuous supportA pathway to grow into senior Case Manager, Sales, or Operations rolesSupportive management that invests in your developmentA friendly, welcoming teamA company experiencing strong, ongoing expansion

jobs.title: Complex Care Worker- Hamilton & Surrounding Areas
jobs.description: Are you resilient, energetic and conscientious?We have an exciting opportunity for experienced and qualified mental health support workers or support workers with experience dealing with Service Users living with behaviours that challenge. We are looking for team members to take up permanent part-time roles in Waikato. About the Position | Te MahiSupport work is fun, people-facing, challenging, and very rewarding, and it is also a deeply empathetic journey. It is more than a job; it is an opportunity to provide invaluable support, led by the people you will be supporting.Job Location – Hamilton and Surrounding areas (Te Kauwhata, Huntly, Te kuiti, Pokeno)Responsibilities may Include:Working closely with our Service Users to provide support as they go about their daily tasksAssisting with complex personal caresAssisting with household management and meal preparationSupporting exercise programmesAssisting with accessing the communityBowel, Bladder, and Catheter caresMoving and handling hoists and manual transfersMedication supportSupport the Service Users in achieving positive goals in their lives and contribute to the effective day-to-day running of the servicesMaintaining the Service User’s safety and well-being.About you | He momoYou are a calm but confident natured individual who can demonstrate resilience and understand the challenges of our service users. There are many responsibilities associated with being a support worker which can be challenging and fulfilling. It is rewarding when you are part of the support that enables a person to live their best lives in the community. The candidate would have (Candidate Pre-Requisites):A supportive mindset to help our Service Users achieve their goals for independent living in the communityIdeally prior personal care experience is preferredFamiliarity with complex medical conditions, like spinal injuries, traumatic brain injuryA Level 3 or Level 4 Health and Wellbeing qualification is beneficial and those looking to enter the healthcare sector will also be considered (comprehensive training can be provided)Access to your own car and ability to drive Independently ( a Full New Zealand Driver's License is a must)Flexibility to work on a rotating rosterLegal right to work in New Zealand is a must.Employment Type: Permanent Part-TimeWe offer a range of employment opportunities including casual, part-time, and full-time positions, which will be discussed further during the recruitment process.Days of Work: As this is community-based work, rotating rosters would be involved including AM, PM and weekend work. Your preferred hours of work can be discussed during the recruitment process.The duration of these hours may vary, ranging from shorter to longer periods, depending on the specific needs of the people we support.Benefits | Ki te huangaPay Band: $24.13 - $30.03 per hour (This is based on the Pay Equity Settlement 2017 – hourly pay rates based on equivalency of Healthcare Qualifications assessed under Pay Equity).Flexible hoursTravel allowance as per In Between Travel (IBT) rulesOpportunities to gain your Level 3 and Level 4 Qualifications in Health and Wellbeing with Careerforce NZPaid competency trainingsFree EAP (Employee Assistance Programme) ServicesFree Flu vaccinationsRefer a friend programmeThe Organisation |Te WhakahaerengaHealthvision is a family-owned provider of homecare, community nursing, and rehabilitation services across Aotearoa. Guided by our family values, we are passionate about supporting people who need care to live life the way they want.We work closely with individuals, their families, and whānau to understand their holistic needs and provide comprehensive, wraparound in-home health services that promote independence and wellbeing. At Healthvision, our approach is grounded in compassion, collaboration, innovation, and dedication — values that shape everything we do.Hiahia | Interested?Contact us even if you do not have a qualification as we are looking for people who are willing to learn, who will be reliable and passionate about community support work. If you can demonstrate how you will travel between people we support, we are happy to talk about the opportunities, we may have for you.

jobs.title: Full Time Dental Assistant
jobs.description: About the roleAre you the type of person who brings good vibes everywhere you go?Do you love helping people, supporting others, and being a part of a close-knit team?We're on the lookout for a positive, energetic Dental Assistant to join our awesome team in Hamilton!Hours of operation are Monday to Friday: 8am - 5pmJob commencing: 12th January 2026 - however, we can be flexible on start date for the right candidateWhat you'll be doingAssisting dentists during procedures by passing instruments, holding suction devices, and ensuring the work area is clean and organisedSterilising and disinfecting instruments and equipment, as well as maintaining the cleanliness of the dental clinicGreeting patients, escorting them to the treatment room, and ensuring they are comfortable throughout their visitUpdating patient records and processing paymentsOrdering and maintaining an adequate stock of dental suppliesProviding support and guidance to other members of the dental team as neededWhat we're looking forPrevious experience as a Dental Assistant or a similar role in a dental practice; however, for the right candidate, on-the-job training will be considered.Someone friendly, upbeat and great at communicating with people.Reliable, organised, and happy to jump in wherever neededComfortable working in a fast-paced, patient-focused environmentWillingness to learn and adapt to new procedures and technologiesA caring and empathetic approach to patient careFlexibility with your schedule and access to a vehicle, as you will be required to work at dual locations (Victoria Street Clinic and Hamilton High Schools)What we offerAt Waikato Dental, we are committed to providing a supportive and collaborative work environment where our employees can thrive. We offer competitive pay rates, opportunities for professional development, and a range of health and well-being benefits to support our team. Our team of experienced dentists and dental professionals are committed to providing a comfortable and caring environment for all our patients.Apply now to become our next full-time Dental Assistant and join our friendly and dedicated team at Waikato Dental.Please email: reception@waikatodental.nz with your CV and cover letter. We would love to hear from you!

jobs.title: Social Worker
jobs.description: Permanent fulltime positions available across Care and Protection and Intake and Assessment teamsBased at our Hamilton city siteAnnual remuneration for this position starts between $81,206.00 and $97,557.00 dependant on experience Mō mātou | About usOranga Tamariki—Ministry for Children has a commitment to putting tamariki and rangatahi at the heart of what we do. In our work, we aim to demonstrate these values:We put Tamariki firstWe believe Aroha is vitalWe respect the Mana of peopleWe are Tika and PonoWe value WhakapapaWe recognise that Oranga is a journeyOur vision is to ensure New Zealand is the best place in the world to be a child. We are also committed to ensuring Oranga Tamariki partners with hapū, iwi and Māori organisations to find appropriate solutions for tamariki in need.About the role | Mō te tūnga https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=958578495960440Our social workers are passionate about the transformation of the child protection system and committed to ensuring that New Zealand is the best place in the world to be a child. We believe in teamwork, we put tamariki and whānau at the centre of everything we do, we strive to achieve authentic and genuine partnership and participation with tamariki, whānau and community partners.Kirikiriroa (The city of Hamilton) is known for its award-winning gardens, the mighty Waikato River, street culture, eateries, riverwalks and cycle paths. The Waikato is home to Waikato-Tainui, and the seat of the Kīngitanga at Tūrangawaewae marae in Ngāruawahia. We also celebrate annual events such as Balloon's over Waikato and National Agriculture Feildays.Come to Hamilton and join a supportive team who all have big hearts, for getting things right for tamariki. When a report of concern is made from a member of the public, professional or whānau which is reported to Oranga Tamariki it is our role to consider the concern, determine the appropriate response for te tamaiti and their whānau, complete an assessment appropriate to the level of concern, put in place the support or intervention that te tamaiti and their whānau require if necessary.Each team of Social workers are responsible for but not limited to:Engaging directly with te tamaiti, their parents/caregivers, significant whānau or family group, and seek and reflect their views, wishes and feelings.Consider direct engagement with, and reflect the views and participation of, hapū and iwi when it may be relevant to te tamaiti.Consult with the Care and Protection Resource Panel.Engage and collaborate with key people working with each tamaiti, to ensure their full range of needs are identified and addressed in a coordinated way.Support te tamaiti and their whānau or family when a specialist interview may be required.Hold whānau and professional hui. What you will bring | Ngā pūmanawatanga ōuA current SWRB practicing certificate, enthusiasm and experience working with tamariki and whanau.We are looking for people with the following:Full registration with New Zealand's Social Work Registration Board (SWRB) and current practicing certificate is essentialA commitment to bi-cultural practice and a culturally responsive approach (including Tikanga Māori and Te Tiriti o Waitangi)Strong written and verbal communication skills.Experience within the child protection sector and an understanding of New Zealand legislation that relates to the safety of children and young people.The ability to engage with whanau and establish working relationships with agencies, voluntary groups, and individuals.Ability to demonstrate sound judgement and organisational skills.The demonstrated ability to stay calm, work collaboratively and find solutions under stressful situations.A full, clean, current driver's licence Nōu te rourou | What's in it for youOranga Tamariki offer an impartial remuneration package, that offers progression annually for experience through tenure. We offer significant training and professional development so that you can thrive and grow. We welcome diversity and are committed to working in an inclusive and respectful way. This is your opportunity to apply your skills and experience to the wellbeing of tamariki and rangatahi. To see all the benefits of working for Oranga Tamariki, please visit https://mahi.orangatamariki.govt.nz/working-with-us/employee-benefits/Me pēhea te tuku tono | How to ApplyApply online with your CV and Covering Letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please ensure you apply with a log in using your Oranga Tamariki email address. If you have any questions about role, please contact Info_recruit@ot.govt.nzHurry as applications for this role close on Sunday 14th December 2025!If you are interested in any of our vacancies, please ensure that you make yourself familiar with our code of conduct as it sets out our expectations for our kaimahi and requires you to present at work free from the influences of both drugs and alcohol.

jobs.title: Registered ECE Teacher
jobs.description: NZ - Registered TeacherWhere curiosity has room to breathe, and tamariki are met with aroha.Do you love the spark in a child’s eyes when an idea lands?At House of Wonder Chartwell, we follow those sparks. We listen, we slow down, we notice. Our days are woven from small wonders and nurturing care, guided by Te Whāriki and animated by play.About us:House of Wonder Chartwell is part of Busy Bees Aotearoa, a nationwide whānau that backs its people to grow. Here, every child is a taonga and every kaiako is supported with real resources, mentoring, and PLD. We are Reggio Emilia inspired. Natural light, open-ended materials, and a calm environment invite exploration and collaboration. Kaiako walk alongside tamariki as facilitators, helping ideas grow from hands and hearts into language, drawings, structures, and stories. We step outside often for bush walks that ground us in Papatūānuku, and we visit the library to nourish early literacy and community connection. Strong partnerships with whānau hold it all together.About you:You bring current ECE or Primary NZ teacher registration, a warm, steady presence, and energy for the joyful work of early learning. You are confident with planning and assessment. You notice the quiet moments as much as the big milestones. You communicate clearly, build strong relationships, and are committed to responsive, culturally inclusive practiceThe work:Create thoughtful provocations. Hold space for collaboration. Contribute to learning stories and kaupapa that reflect each child’s voice. Keep safety and wellbeing close. Partner with whānau so every learner feels seen and supported.Why you'll love it here:Full Pay Parity!Monthly staff wellbeing budget and access to EAP servicesInduction, mentoring and meaningful PLD opportunitiesDiscounted childcareFirst Aid certification and annual flu vaccinationOngoing opportunities for career growth & personal and professional developmentTake advantage of this opportunity and send through your CV and Cover Letter today!Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid work visa.We are an Accredited EmployerWhy Work for Busy Bees?If you’re passionate about early learning, Busy Bees is the place to be. Although we are part of a global organisation, our company was founded by three families looking for better, more enriching childcare. Three decades later, we still keep the same values at heart.We know that we couldn’t do what we do without the important people in our teams. We invest in our people and work with them to build career pathways that inspire.

jobs.title: Principal Dams Engineer
jobs.description: Principal Dams EngineerAt Tonkin + Taylor, our purpose is simple: together, we create and sustain a better world.With dams being critical assets for water and energy security, our dam engineering services play a key role in achieving this purpose.For over 50 years, Tonkin + Taylor has been assessing, designing, and monitoring dams across New Zealand, Australia, the Near Pacific, and internationally. We have extensive experience with both large and small dams, serving a range of end uses including hydropower, flood detention, water supply, and energy storage.Our capabilities span investigation (often in remote and challenging terrains), assessment, design, consenting, construction supervision, and commissioning of new dams and upgrade works. We also provide expertise in ongoing dam safety management, safety reviews, surveillance, regulatory compliance, and decommissioning.We are seeking a Principal Engineer to make a leading contribution to the delivery of our dam engineering services and support our continued growth in this field.We are open to locations for the right candidate – with a preference for Auckland, Hamilton, Wellington, Tauranga, or Christchurch.Ngā kawenga | What you’ll be doingProviding specialist technical input into complex projects, including expertise in investigation, design, and construction of dams and dam upgrades, as well as dam safety management.Developing Tonkin + Taylor’s technical reputation and promoting our services to existing and new clients.Managing a diverse portfolio of projects, with a focus on leading and delivering multidisciplinary dam engineering projects.Nā tōu rourou | What you’ll bring20+ years of relevant experienceA Bachelor of Engineering or equivalentChartered Professional Engineer or equivalent (Recognised Engineer (Dam Safety) desirable but not essential)Proven ability to work in and lead multi-disciplinary teams, with strong interpersonal skills and the ability to engage with a broad range of stakeholdersRecognition as a leader in the field, ideally through active participation in industry development or thought leadershipNgā Hua | What We OfferExposure to a wide range of projects, from large-scale to community-focused initiativesA supportive team culture that values autonomy, mastery, and purposeProfessional memberships and continued education supportInternal training and mentoring programmes$750 annual wellbeing allowance and wellbeing programmeA vibrant social club and inclusive workplace cultureMō Tō Mātou Āhuatanga | Who We AreTonkin + Taylor is New Zealand’s leading engineering and environmental consultancy, known for solving complex challenges with technical excellence. We’re proudly employee-owned, and our mission is to create and sustain a better world.We’re committed to diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunity. As an Immigration NZ Accredited Employer and a proud member of the Rainbow Tick Whānau, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds, especially speakers of Te Reo Māori or Pacific languages.Ready to make a difference?Apply now! or contact Amelia Paton apaton@tonkintaylor.co.nz for a confidential chat.

jobs.title: Agricultural Mechanics - Field Service & Workshop
jobs.description: Are you a proven Agricultural Diesel Mechanic or an HD mechanic with a passion for customer service and ensuring that the job is done right, first time? Want the confidence of working for a company that bats well above their weight class in the clients that they service and the service they provide? Want to work for a company that empowers their techs to make decisions and to deal with the end user - from operator to owner – directly, and trusts that you will give them honest advice and support just as your employer would? This group makes coming to work feel like it should and is the very reason you completed your apprenticeship in the first place!If you are:Trade Qualified Automotive Engineer - Strand in Agricultural Equipment ideally but other strands will be considered or proven experience as an HD mechanic in this industry.Have strong diagnostic skills visually and plug in | Brand exposure or a passion to develop your computer diagnostic skills.Positive - forward thinking & passionate about the primary industry.Know what good customer service really is and how to provide that at every touch pointA desire to be part of a team and a proven ability to communicate both up and downWhat can we offer: Great Hourly Rate plus OTGuaranteed 40-hour weeks (we’ve got plenty of hours available!)Vehicle | Phone | Fuel Card | Tool AllowanceAutonomy to run your days in the field – we don’t do micro-managing around here!Ability to upskill and grow.Bring your tools and we look after the rest – Fully Kitted Vehicle & WorkshopFamily Owned and Operated Group who offer long term stability and growthMonthly BBQs – Our Team and their families matter to us!EPIC Recruitment is the brainchild of one of the longest standing maintenance recruiters in the market, with a passion for helping people in the industry not only unlock their potential - but get paid what they are worth - by aligning with groups that want to see them succeedReach out today for a confidential chat - What have you got to lose?Please note you MUST have valid open NZ working rights or residency to be considered for this role.Call or text Emily Peacock on 0272466464 to arrange a time to chat, or email me directly emily@epicrecruitment.co.nz

jobs.title: Receptionist / Administrator (Part-Time)

jobs.title: National Resources Planner / Scheduler
jobs.description: Location, HamiltonFixed term contract, maternity leave coverCompetitive remuneration + great benefits Position DescriptionHe whakamārama mō te tūranga mahi | About the role:The National Resources Planner/Scheduler is primarily responsible for assisting the National Resources Manager in the planning and day to day management of the wagon fleet and panel lifters. Reporting to the National Planning Manager, you will focus on managing an effective capacity planning process and maintaining a valid Master Schedule to establish accurate requirements and dates for forward scheduling and level loading, especially when demand peaks are greater than available capacity. This role also includes coordinating the scheduling of planned maintenance works in accordance with the manufacturer’s requirements.You will ensure that the activities planned are sufficient to fulfil our customers’ requirements and any modifications, and that improvements or other maintenance interventions are planned to be completed with minimal disruption to the fleet.No two days will ever be the same in this multi-faceted role and you will be involved in site visits across the country, which will mean occasional national travel across the country. Ngā pukenga e rapu nei mātou | What you will bring:To excel in this position, you will haveExperience working with teams in an operational environment and an excellent, customer focused communicator across all levels of a business 3 + years’ experience in similar planning/scheduling roleA commitment to a Zero Harm culture.Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work well under time, location, and customer pressure with a proven ability to apply sound judgement to decision making and problem-solving skills. Experience in working in complex regulated operating environmentsKnowledge of planning and scheduling principles, with proficiency in analysis and reporting software suites including Microsoft and SAP. Ideally, you would have some practical experience in a field relevant to rail and transportation.Nōu te rourou | What’s in it for you:Competitive remuneration + great benefits5 weeks annual leave (pro-rate as per FTC duration)Commitment to continued learning and developmentAccess to discounted travel, health insurance & holiday houses across NZ as part of our Staff Welfare TrustKua rite, kia rite | Ready to Make a Difference?Our people are everything. That’s why KiwiRail is committed to an inclusive, flexible, and supportive workplace where everyone can feel valued, respected, and have equal opportunity to succeed. We encourage applications from people of all ages, genders, sexual orientation, personalities, ethnicities, abilities, and cultures.If life’s a journey, KiwiRail is a great way of keeping your career moving through it. Ours is a fast-paced, inspiring, and truly customer-focused culture – where your career will connect you to real opportunities, while balancing work and whānau life.Me pēhea te tuku tono | How to ApplySubmit your CV and cover letter online. If you’re a current KiwiRail employee, please apply using your internal profile.Rā aukati | Applications close: 10th December 2025 (unless filled sooner)

jobs.title: Carpenters

jobs.title: Office Administrator
jobs.description: School Administrator Job Description:Position OverviewThe School Administrator is a key member of the school’s leadership and support team, responsible for ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of all administrative functions. This multifaceted role encompasses finance management, oversight of school uniforms and supplies, coordination of relievers, and general support for the day-to-day running of the school. The administrator acts as a central point of contact for staff, students, and parents, providing essential services that contribute to a positive and productive school environment.Key Responsibilities· Financial Management· Payroll· Staffing· Administration· First AidDescription of Responsibilities· Financial ManagementAdminister school finances, including budgeting, invoicing, expense tracking, and reporting.Coordinate the procurement and allocation of school supplies for students, teachers, and staff.Manage accounts payable and receivable, ensuring timely payments and collections.Manage supplier relationships and negotiate contracts for best value.Ministry of Education Auditors· Reliever and Staff CoordinationManage payroll processes, ensuring timely and accurate payment of salaries.Maintain a roster of available relief teachers and support staff.Organise and schedule relievers in response to staff absences, ensuring adequate classroom coverage.Handle student enrolment procedures, including maintaining accurate records and assisting with the admission process. Keep up-to-date records of staff attendance and leave.· AdministrationEnrolling new students into School Management System Student Daily Attendance.Student Daily Attendance.Respond to enquiries from parents, students, and staff in a timely and professional manner.Community -Communications produce weekly newsletters.Support the principal and leadership team with administrative support, including answering phone calls, responding to emails, and assisting with office tasks as neededAssist with organising school events and activities.· Uniform and Supply ManagementOversee the ordering, distribution, and inventory of school uniforms.Maintain accurate records of uniform purchases and stock levels.· Managing and Maintaining the First AidMaintain accurate student and staff records, including enrolment, medical, and emergency contact information.First Aid Certificate.Manage First Aid Room Supplies Required Skills and Qualifications· Calm and adaptable· Happy disposition· Good work ethic, conscientious· Attention to detail· Empathy· Previous experience in an administrative role, preferably within an educational setting.· Strong organisational and time management skills.· Experience in finance or bookkeeping (school environment preferred).· Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.· Competency with office software (e.g., Microsoft Office, accounting systems Google Drive).· Ability to multitask and adapt to changing priorities.· Attention to detail and accuracy.· Understanding of confidentiality and data protection requirements.Personal Attributes· Trustworthiness and reliability.· Professionalism and discretion.· Positive, proactive attitude.· Commitment to supporting the school’s mission and values.Reporting RelationshipsThe School Administrator reports directly to the Principal and works closely with teaching staff, support staff, and external suppliers.Working ConditionsThis is a part-time, school-based position (22.5 hours per week). Occasional flexibility may be required to support after-hours events or urgent school needs.

jobs.title: Weekend Barista & FoH
jobs.description: At The River Kitchen, we’re looking for a friendly, fast-paced Barista for our Front of House Team to work weekends only (Saturday & Sunday) at our busy café based at Hamilton Golf Club. Please note, we may only contact short listed applicants.

jobs.title: Pilot Home – Care Worker Homes
jobs.description: OverviewTwo Pilot Homes are being established in Dunedin and Hamilton. This is an amazing opportunity to be a part of a new approach to care in our Homes, helping to increase the capacity for care in regions and to be a part of a wider community of practice in the region.The pilot Home will test some new concepts which are aimed at reducing challenges we face when caring for tamariki and rangatahi in small group home settings.The Homes will provide emergency, respite or planned care for up to 5 tamariki in each location. Care in the Homes will be provided by full-time live-in caregivers, supported by skilled Care Workers.These 12-month pilot Homes, named 'WHARE', will:Provide Whanau-like care with fulltime, live in caregiversBe Helped by a small group of flexible and qualified care staff, overseen by a Supervisor (Social Worker)Be focused on Achieving the goals and aspirations that tamariki and whanau have set in their All About Me PlanFocus on providing Relational and restorative careBe closely Engaged with local communities, sites and regions with leadership coming from regional teams and accountability to local, external stakeholders Mō te tūnga | About the role: Care Worker HomesA Care Worker Homes is a key member of the care team in Homes responsible for providing day to day care and specialised programmes for tamariki living in Oranga Tamariki led Homes. jobs.title: Senior Lecturer in International Relations
jobs.description: Demonstrate expertise in a subfield of International RelationsBring specialist knowledge that complements our existing IR and Politics profileEnjoy a role with purpose inspiring the next generation Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleThe School of Law, Politics, and Philosophy is seeking a full-time Senior Lecturer in International Relations. We welcome applicants from any International Relations subfield, including (but not limited to) international security, international political economy, global governance, foreign policy analysis, gender and IR, international law, human rights, environmental politics, or regional and area-focused IR. The successful candidate will be able to deliver first-year foundational teaching in International Relations and offer specialist undergraduate and postgraduate courses aligned with their research expertise. They will play an active role in enhancing the School’s research culture, pursue an ambitious research agenda, and supervise research students at the honours, masters, and doctoral levels.We are open to applications from any theoretical or methodological perspective – including traditional paradigms and critical approaches that valorise “other” ways of knowing (such as Indigenous, non-Western, or feminist).Salary will be in the range of $110,392 to $128,508 per year based on skills, knowledge and experience brought to the position. This is a full-time role (37.5 hours a week), based on our Hillcrest Campus.For more information on the role please see the position description. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You will have a PhD in International Relations or a relevant discipline and offer a forward-looking research agenda. You will bring a passion for, and expertise in International Relations, actively demonstrate a commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi and understand how your research could enhance professional practice and community. You will have experience teaching undergraduate papers, including the ability to lecture to large numbers and conduct small-group seminars and tutorials effectively. You effectively communicate through innovative teaching methods, materials, models and virtual techniques. In addition, you should demonstrate how your own research aligns with or extends the existing research strengths in the School.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The Politics and International Relations Programme sits within the School of Law, Politics, and Philosophy. The programme offers majors in Political Science and International Relations. The School offers a range of papers at undergraduate, postgraduate, and professional training levels. Teaching occurs on the Hamilton and the Tauranga Campuses of the University of Waikato.The Political Science and International Relations Programme currently has an international reputation in the fields of foreign policy, geopolitics, environmental politics, gender politics, critical public policy, and political communication.He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. E herea ana te Whare Wānanga ki te kaupapa kia whakaratohia te mea angitū ōrite ki ngā tāngata katoa. Applications Close on Saturday 31st January 2026Requisition number: 1003174

jobs.title: Support Manager
jobs.description: About UsAt Downer we plan, create and sustain. Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. Through trusted relationships and world leading insight we work closely with our customers to design, build and sustain assets, infrastructure, and facilities. About the TeamDowner’s Transport & Infrastructure business manages and maintains road networks across Australia and New Zealand, with civil and commercial construction in New Zealand. We are an integrated trans-Tasman team with a leading portfolio of products and services. By sharing our capabilities and insights across our regions we achieve the best technical solutions for our customers’ challenges, and for our communities.Job DescriptionThe Opportunity | Te KōwhiringaWe are seeking a Support Manager to join our trans-Tasman team, based in Hamilton. This is an exciting opportunity for a customer-focused professional to lead a team dedicated to providing outstanding service and operational support. You will oversee the coordination of key activities, resolve queries promptly, and act as a trusted partner to stakeholders. This role is about building strong relationships, delivering high service standards, and creating a seamless experience for our internal customers while maintaining compliance and reliability across our network.Key ResponsibilitiesLead and support a high-performing team to deliver exceptional service to internal customers across ANZ.Act as the primary point of contact for operational queries, ensuring timely, accurate resolutions and clear communication with stakeholders.Coordinate procurement, maintenance, and compliance activities to guarantee seamless support and minimise downtime.Foster strong, collaborative relationships with operational teams and suppliers, ensuring service standards and reliability are consistently upheld.Monitor and manage service performance and customer satisfaction, proactively addressing issues and escalating concerns when necessary.Provide accurate, timely reporting on support activities, performance metrics, and compliance, enabling informed decision-making and continuous improvement.Maintain strict adherence to safety, regulatory, and company standards across all activities, safeguarding operational integrity. Important Skills | Nga Pūkenga MatuaWe’re looking for a strong leader with excellent operational, analytical, and communication skills. You will bring:Proven ability to inspire, mentor, and motivate a team to deliver exceptional customer service and meet performance targets.Strong customer service focus with a proactive approach to resolving queries and ensuring high satisfaction levels.Operational knowledge to support asset lifecycle management, compliance requirements, and maintenance standards.Supplier and stakeholder management skills to build strong relationships, influence outcomes, and maintain service continuity.Financial and analytical capability to prepare accurate reports, analyse performance, and manage cost control measures.Technology and process improvement expertise to implement tools that enhance efficiency and reporting accuracy, with proficiency in ERP systems (SAP, JDE) and Microsoft Office.Compliance and governance knowledge to ensure all activities meet regulatory standards and company policies. Why you will enjoy working here | Ko te take ka parekareka e koe ki te mahi ki kōneiDowner is committed to delivering excellence by ensuring our people have the environment and the means to be successful. We offer:Free access to Marram health care benefits and discounted holiday homes$500 bonus for current employees who refer a friend to DownerProgression and development programmes, including our inspiring leader’s programme for top performersOpportunities to work on innovative technologies and national improvement projectsA collaborative, supportive team environment that drives operational excellenceHave a look at our other great benefits here!How to apply | Me pēhea ki te tonoTo apply for this great opportunity, please click on "Apply" and submit your CV and Cover Letter.

jobs.title: Team Member
jobs.description: PURPOSE OF POSITIONThe Team Member is responsible and accountable for performing specific tasks and duties, as assigned, within the restaurant. The Team Member provides each guest with a positive guest service experience, prepares quality food products and keeps the restaurant clean.KEY ACCOUNTABILITIESGeneral Accountabilities & Work tasks Follow guest service guidelines and procedures; take appropriate action to ensure guests receive service beyond their expectations Work assigned stations accurately and productively; clean and stock station areas; perform other cleaning duties as assigned You may be required to cook as an when required by your supervisor Handle all food products according to RBL procedures Follow RBL food safety, food handling and sanitation requirements, to ensure the health and safety of guests and employees Report faulty equipment and fixtures to the manager on duty Work Tasks could include: Order taking and serving food and beverage orders. Operating an electronic register, receiving payment and making change. Packing products into food packaging for takeaway or trays for serving, with condiments. Handing packed orders to customers from the packing bench to front counter or out the drive-thru window to the customer’s vehicle. Washing, cutting, dicing, slicing vegetable and salad ingredients. Measuring and mixing foods e.g. potato mix, gravy mix Using a potato scoop to scoop mash potato into pottles and pouring gravy on top. ∙ Preparing food such as burgers, wraps and salads Operating cooking equipment such as potato mixer, microwave, warmer timers ∙ Heating simple food items e.g. burger buns, rolls and tortillasMonitoring food timers for food safety ‘shelf life’ control and discards products Loading chip basket with raw fries placing in to the fryer, lifting and dumping cooked chips from the basket into the chip hopper, ready for serve. Scooping hot chips using a chip scoop into takeaway packaging. Moving chicken trays from the warming cabinet into the chicken display. Cleaning food preparation areas, cooking surfaces, food containers and utensils ∙ Handling general purpose detergents and sanitiser for cleaning Clearing tables of food packaging, emptying rubbish bins and carrying rubbish bags to the rubbish skip back of house. Training and Development Strive to improve personal skills and performance Relevant cook training may be provided as and when required Communicate to immediate supervisor when additional training, guidance and practice are needed Keep immediate supervisor informed of anything which might affect guests, other employees and overall operations Is performance oriented and driven; understands performance expectations and is aware of performance results Effective Business Management Consistently meet job expectations to positively impact the sales and profits of the restaurant ∙ Contribute to the restaurant’s success by accomplishing the expected work during each shift; consistently produces quality work Support the goals, decisions and directives of restaurant management; perform additional duties and responsibilities as directed Follow RBL guidelines for food and cash controls, follow cost control guidelines to maintain and minimize restaurant costs; properly use all products, suppliers, equipment and facilities Health and Safety Take reasonable care for your own health and safety at work, and that your actions/omissions do not cause harm to any other person in the workplace (including, for example, co-workers and customers) Participate in creating and maintaining a safe and healthy work environment, particularly by complying with instructions, policies and procedures Advise manager of any/all work related injuries, accidents, near misses and hazards or potential hazards (including any faults to equipment), and risks or potential risks to health and safetyMOST FREQUENT CONTACTSRestaurant Manager Assistant Restaurant Manager Customers Area Managers Store TeamCritical Qualifications/Skills/ExperienceQualifications: Ideally a minimum of NCEA Level 1 or working towards Level 1 Business/Technical Skills Previous customer service or customer facing experience is favoured but not essential Experience (Behavioural): Places customer first and goes out of their way to ensure customer satisfaction ∙ Able to work under pressure, remaining calm at all times Works well with others and is supportive and collaborative Focused on achieving results and strives to meet targets Acts with integrity at all times Works within guidelines, policies and rules and is a natural rule follower Focused on the safety and wellbeing of others at all times including customers and peersCommunicates effectively verbally with customers and the team and is clear and concise ∙ Able to comprehend written English and able to complete online training modules and follow written procedures and policies with ease Manages time well to complete set tasks and works quickly and with purpose to maintain momentumThis Position Description summarises the primary responsibilities of this role at the time of commencement. Various other responsibilities not listed here may also fall within the responsibility parameters of the position. From time to time and with the natural developments of business structure and practice, an employee may be required to perform additional or new responsibilities that fall reasonably within the expectations of this role. Any significant adjustments to role responsibilities will always be made after consultation with the employee.P22-225231-2

jobs.title: CHEF WANTED!
jobs.description: The Hamilton Cosmopolitan Club is under New Management!Our restaurant is a critical part of our business that allows us to continue to serve our loyal members and community. With a club rich in history, supporting a new vision for our restaurant, we are on the hunt for an experienced Chef to join our tightknit team. You will need to be comfortable producing bistro meals, including our lunch and dinner menu and preparing catering for functions. Being able to relate to people is important to us along with experience with Food Control Plans and supervision of kitchenhands. You will report to our Club Manager and Events Manager working to deliver a great customer experience, great food in a happy workplace.You will be unsupervised over the weekends and are expected to help with functions and bookings. This is an ideal opportunity for someone returning to the workforce looking for stability, a young chef keen to settle and grow with the business or someone experienced seeking a new challenge. We are expecting around 30 hours of work per week with additional hours available. Some flexibility is needed as in all Hospitality. This role could develop into a full-time position for the right candidate. Must have experience:Relevant qualifications in Level 4 and above Cookery & Hospitality and or equivalent experience.No less than 2 years proven culinary experience.Experience with small, medium to large scale catering.Ability to troubleshoot and come up with on-the-spot solutions.The ability to work fast and with a small team.Sound knowledge of different cuisines or open to learning as well as food health and safety regulations.A strong understanding of modern diets.Experience or understanding of a club environment is preferred but not necessary.Excellent organisational and time management skills.Effective communication skills.Exceptional customer service skills.Detail-oriented.Duties & Responsibilities:Produce all items related to the menus and functions to the establishment’s standard, to satisfy diner expectations.Plan and organise workflows, order food items when required.Cost recipes and develop menu items for the establishment as requested.Keep recipe book up to date.Ensure equipment and work environment are operational.Ensure prep is up to date for days off.Impart knowledge and train staff to encourage high standards.Uphold morale in the kitchen and other departments.Communicate with and support staff.Attend kitchen meetings.Set the example of professional practice to all staff members.Understand, implement, and support the companies’ policies.This position requires the talents and ambitions of an individual who wishes to further their career whilst accepting the challenge of a busy and progressive establishment.If you believe you have the necessary skills, knowledge, and experience then we would like to hear from you.

jobs.title: Registered Legal Executive
jobs.description: New Firm? New Year? New You?We are seeking a Registered Legal Executive to join our team at Foley Douglas.A little bit about us:We pride ourselves on being a people-first firm. Foley Douglas is known for excellent client service, pragmatic advice, and sharp minds. At the core of our identity is a commitment to people; we embrace and foster a culture of trust, empathy, and continuous growth. As a well-established team, we’re fiercely loyal. We have sharp minds, extensive experience, and we’re all about an energising culture. As a team, we genuinely enjoy working together; each day is fuelled with coffee and a side of witty banter.Why Choose Foley Douglas?Engaging Work: As a firm, we handle a diverse range of high-calibre matters spanning general practice, property, commercial, employment, and intellectual property law.Supportive Environment: We focus on our people – as a team, we work together to foster a positive, collaborative culture where your expertise and input are valued.Benefits: Our office space is as unique as we are. Located in central Hamilton, our office is purpose-built (including elite outdoor spaces), and the nearby coffee and lunch options are endless.What You’ll Do:We’re strengthening our team and planning for the future, looking for experienced legal professionals to join us in our next season. As a general practice firm, with a focus on property and commercial, no two days are the same. We’re looking for individuals with a broad general scope across property and private client work. With client relationships at the forefront, the position is focused on providing expert support, advice, and guidance for our clients; creating or refining legal documentation (including agreements, deeds, leases, contracts); being involved in matters from the initial brief through to successful completion; and representing and supporting the Partners and wider team. We have a collaborative approach to what we do, and your involvement in matters will be valued as we work towards providing successful outcomes for clients.What We’re Looking For:Experience & Drive: Experience in general practice with a knack for estates, trusts, and property.Client-Centric Mindset: A passion for providing exceptional service and a proactive approach to problem-solving.Personable Team Member: Ability to collaborate well with others while maintaining a good sense of humour.Humility: We don’t take ourselves too seriously; that being said – nobody puts Baby in a corner!Benefits:Professional Growth: Enjoy real opportunities for career advancement with a focus on personal and professional development.Autonomy: Take ownership of your work in a supportive team environment. Grow your practice, learn from and lean on your team.Comprehensive Package: Receive a competitive remuneration and benefits package, including comprehensive insurance, tools of the trade, flexible working, extended leave, and car parking.The work in this position is high-calibre, stimulating, and broad, plus there are real opportunities for learning, career advancement, leadership development, and growth. Working with us means owning your career, with a level of autonomy and support in your work that is unmatched by traditional firms. We value the growth of our people as both humans and legal advisors; we are continuously committed to each person and their goals.Ready to Join Us?If you’re motivated and eager to contribute to a firm that values you as a key player in our journey, contact Fiona Morgan (Business Operations Manager) for a confidential chat. To apply, send your CV and cover letter to fiona@foleydouglas.co.nz.

jobs.title: Associate Professor in Biomedical Sciences
jobs.description: Lead research, teaching, and academic leadership that advances biomedical sciences in Aotearoa.Are you an established biomedical scholar with a record of research excellence, innovative teaching, and academic leadership?This is a significant opportunity to join the School of Pharmacy and Biomedical Sciences at the University of Waikato and help shape the future of biomedical education, research, and workforce development across Aotearoa. Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleAs Associate Professor in Biomedical Sciences, you will provide academic leadership in teaching, research, and service within the School and Division. You will contribute to the development of biomedical sciences curricula, including content for the New Zealand Graduate School of Medicine (NZGSM), and you will play a key role in academic governance, mentoring colleagues, and representing the School nationally and internationally.You will maintain an active, high-quality research programme, publish in reputable journals, attract external research income, and supervise Honours, Masters, and PhD students. You will contribute to curriculum development, research-led teaching, digital anatomy applications, and contemporary biomedical science innovations that support student success and discipline growth.This is a continuing, full-time role based at our Hamilton campus. Salary will be in the range of $146,629 to $161,729 per year based on skills, knowledge and experience brought to the position. For more information about the role, please see the position description. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted. Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You will hold a PhD in a biomedical sciences discipline, with a strong research and scholarship record of sustained excellence and recognised contributions at national and international levels.You are known for your commitment to high-quality, research-informed teaching and the ability to engage large cohorts as well as small-group classes. You bring expertise in curriculum design, academic leadership, postgraduate supervision, and innovative pedagogy, including online and technology-enabled delivery.You will demonstrate:A sustained record of high-impact research publication and scholarly outputs.Success in securing external research funding and completing competitive grant applications.Excellence in undergraduate and postgraduate teaching, including leading and coordinating papers.Experience supervising Honours, Masters, and PhD students to successful completion.Contributions to pedagogical innovation within biomedical sciences, such as digital anatomy tools or computational biomedical applications.Ability to provide mentorship and leadership to academic colleagues and contribute positively to School and Division administration.Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively and sensitively with students and staff from diverse backgrounds.You are self-motivated, collegial, and proactive, with a deep commitment to equity, cultural safety, and the University’s partnership with Māori under Te Tiriti o Waitangi.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The Division of Health at the University of Waikato is committed to advancing equitable and innovative health outcomes across Aotearoa. Our teaching and research span Biomedical Sciences, Health Promotion, Human Performance Science, Midwifery, Nursing, Pharmacy, and Sport Development and Coaching.The School of Pharmacy and Biomedical Sciences leads research and education in molecular biology, physiology, biochemistry, pharmacology, bioinformatics, digital anatomy, and more. The School contributes to undergraduate and postgraduate programmes and plays a central role in curriculum development for the NZGSM.Our values are grounded in partnership with Māori, integrity, creativity, and equity.He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?This is a career-defining opportunity to lead research, teaching, and academic development in a rapidly growing Division. You will influence future biomedical scientists, contribute to national and international scholarship, and help shape the biomedical curriculum for Aotearoa’s newest medical school.At the University of Waikato, we value integrity, creativity, diversity, and our enduring partnership with Māori. We are committed to a workplace that is inclusive and mana-enhancing, and we welcome applicants with the expertise, passion, and leadership to help us advance excellence in biomedical sciences.Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. E herea ana te Whare Wānanga ki te kaupapa kia whakaratohia te mea angitū ōrite ki ngā tāngata katoa.Applications Close: January 18, 2026Requisition number: 1003226

jobs.title: DevSecOps Engineer
jobs.description: Immediate StartEngaging on-site project (Hamilton)Permanent roleABOUT THE COMPANYA New Zealand-based organisation known for precision and innovation has expanded globally, earning recognition for its efficient and high-quality operations.Through strategic partnerships and advanced systems, it delivers fast, reliable outcomes across a wide range of activities. With a focus on adaptability and continuous improvement, the organisation remains committed to delivering value in a dynamic environment.ABOUT THE ROLEThe DevOps Engineer supports the delivery and maintenance of IT infrastructure, networks, desktop systems, and cloud services in a fast-paced laboratory environment. Responsibilities include managing Windows/Linux servers, VMware clusters, firewalls, and network components; enabling developers and analysts through secure, scalable environments; contributing to infrastructure projects and continuous improvement; and providing professional, user-focused support. The position emphasises automation, documentation, and collaboration while ensuring compliance with health and safety standards.SKILLS & EXPERIENCE5+ years in infrastructure, systems, or cloud engineering roles, including DevOps environments.Proficient in VMware, Fortinet, Aruba, Microsoft 365, Linux/Windows systems, and monitoring tools (e.g., ELK, CheckMK).Skilled in scripting and automation using PowerShell, Bash, or Python.Strong ability to support technical and non-technical users effectively.Calm under pressure, proactive, and solutions-focused.Tertiary qualification in IT, Computer Systems, Engineering, or related field; Microsoft, VMware, Fortinet certifications preferred.BENEFITSGrowing organisationExciting projectHOW TO APPLYClick the APPLY button and include your resume and cover letter or for further information please call Abeer on 07 834 0412.Please note, we can only consider applicants that are legally entitled to work in New Zealand at the time of application.
