jobs.title: Whanau Support Worker
jobs.description: At NZCL, we are dedicated to support people with disabilities in New Zealand. Our Disability Support Services reflect our belief that all New Zealanders deserve to live fully, have equal opportunities, and achieve their ambitions.We are committed to enabling good lives for all, with a strong focus on self-determination, early intervention, and person-centred support.We are looking for a part time Support Worker in Hamilton, to provide support for Rangitahi and Tamariki and the family, fostering their self-determination and empowering them to lead a valued life on their own terms.This is a part time role with the opportunity to increase these hours over time. What does a Support Worker do? | He aha te mahi a te Kaimahi TautokoAs a support worker, your primary role is to facilitate the family's journey toward a valued life of their choosing. You will actively engage with them in a hands-on capacity and collaborate closely with them.Your tasks will encompass a range of activities including grocery shopping, meal planning, preparation and cooking, laundry, light cleaning, and household support. As a support worker, your goal is to provide assistance, so they are able to maintain their active participation in daily living, both at home and in the community. Key responsibilities include but not limited to:Invest in creating a supportive environment for the family, focusing on their aspirations and independence rather than waiting for a crisis to arise.Support tamariki or rangitahi to go to school or access education.Observe and respond to health concerns or support the overall health and wellbeing of the young personSupport rangitahi/young people to work towards and attain their goals and improve outcomes.Tailor supports to the family's unique needs and goals, adopting a holistic approach that encompasses all aspects of their life.Provide simple, flexible supports that the family can readily use to enhance their life.What do you get? | He aha te whiwhiEarn competitive pay rates between $23.97 up to $29.68 per hour.Earn while you learn with free training towards NZQA Health & Wellbeing.Job security with Employee benefits, work phone, sick/annual leave and more.'Refer a friend' Bonus.PB Tech discount when shopping onlineDiscounted 2Degrees phone and broadband plansDiscounted Southern Cross Health InsuranceAccess to Samsung products at discounted priceEmployee Assistance program service anytime you need health and wellbeing supportWho are we looking for? | Ko wai ta tatou e rapu anaPeople who are passionate about helping others, are kind and understanding.A desire to support our rangitahi / young people to learn new skills and achieve outcomes.Previous experience working with young people/rangitahi.Full driver's license and owning your own vehicle is essential.A desire to support people to learn new skills and achieve outcomes.Somebody who has the initiative to push people for their goals, is energetic, outgoing, and can think outside the box. You need to be respectful of others thinking, and their way of living life that may be different to your own.Empathy, respect, and cultural awareness is important in this role as the people we support come from diverse backgrounds with varying needs and interests. If you are passionate about supporting people, then maybe there is a role for you here. Send your request to NZCL.Mēnā he tangata ngākaunui ana koe ki te tautoko i ngā momo tāngata, tēnā pea, kei konei he tūranga mōu. Tukua mai tō tono ki NZCL.Please bear in mind all applicants must be a NZ Resident/Citizen or have a valid NZ work permit.

jobs.description: Collaborative working environmentOpportunities to grow partnerships across the ECE SectorContribute to the next generation of teachers Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleWe are seeking an experienced and passionate leader to oversee the professional experience component of our Early Childhood Education (ECE) programmes. This pivotal role provides leadership and coordination across Hamilton, Tauranga, and NET programmes - ensuring high-quality placements, strong partnerships with ECE centres, and meaningful learning experiences for student teachers.You will work closely with centre leaders, teachers, academic staff, and students to support every aspect of professional experience—from placement and visiting to associate teacher development and documentation. Our programmes are research-informed and delivered through high quality academic staff catering for domestic and international students. jobs.title: 2IC Signals Technician
jobs.description: Position DescriptionHe kōrero mō mātou | About us:At KiwiRail, we’re committed to delivering a more connected and sustainable New Zealand. Our network is a vital part of the country’s transport system—supporting freight, tourism, and regional growth. We take pride in our teamwork, strong safety culture, and service to local communities. By joining us, you’ll be part of an organisation working together to keep New Zealand moving.He whakamārama mo te tūranga mahi | About the role:As the Signals Technician 2IC, you’ll be a key support for the day-to-day operation of our signalling assets—ensuring systems are maintained, installed, and repaired safely and efficiently. You’ll test and troubleshoot interlocking components, set up track circuits, and work closely with the wider team to keep our rail network running smoothly. This is a hands-on, varied role. From time to time, you’ll step up to lead the team and oversee work planning and delivery. You’ll also contribute to on-the-job training and play an active part in our safety-first culture.Ngā pukenga e rapu nei mātou | What (skills) you will bring:We’re looking for someone who is reliable, adaptable, and takes pride in their work. Ideally, you will have:Experience working as part of a technical or maintenance teamCompleted training for Signals Technician Level 4 (or equivalent)Confidence in reading technical drawings and working with rail signalling systemsGood communication skills and a strong sense of responsibilityA full Class 1 driver licence (Class 2 desirable)Registration as a New Zealand Electrician (preferred)First aid and CPR certificates (or willingness to obtain) You’ll also need to be safety-focused and comfortable working outdoors in varied conditions, with some travel and overnight stays.Nōu te rourou | What's in it for you:A competitive pay package and generous leave entitlementsOngoing training and development, with clear pathways for progressionThe chance to be part of a skilled and supportive teamOpportunities to grow your leadership experience in a nationally vital industryA role where your work directly supports the safety and reliability of our rail network Note: The role is based in the Hamilton depot covering mainly Hamilton North however will be required to work in other teams from time to time.Kua rite, kia rite | Ready to Make a Difference?If you're ready to step into a role where you can grow your skills and support essential rail services, we want to hear from you.Me pēhea te tuku tono | How to Apply:Apply now and help keep New Zealand moving safely and efficiently.Rā aukati | Application Close: 4th of Deember 2025

jobs.title: Senior Rural Manager or Rural Manager
jobs.description: Here at ASB, the customer is at the heart of everything we do. We are recognised as one of New Zealand's leading organisations with a highly engaged and talented workforce focused on accelerating the financial progress for all New Zealanders.ASB Rural Banking is a team of dedicated rural specialists who work closely with our customers to deliver unbeatable customer experiences. We operate in an extremely competitive market and our client service is the best in the industry. Our rural bankers have a good grasp of rural business realities; many are farmers themselves or have experience in farming and they are very much a part of their local community.The role | Te tūranga:As the Senior Rural Manager, you will be responsible for proactively managing a high-value customer portfolio and driving growth of quality rural business in the region. Here, your affinity with the rural sector, personal credibility within the industry, unbeatable people skills and innovative approach to delivering to your customer's needs will enable you to grow successful relationships with your customers while developing a strong network of contacts to draw on down the track. You'll understand the importance of working alongside customers to build stronger rural businesses that are resilient to the demands facing the sector and that ultimately support happier farming families.You will enhance ASB's external profile and reputation in the Rural sector using internal and external communication channels. This communication will focus on the promotion of ASB capabilities, knowledge and expertise in business activation and delivering superior customer outcomes for clients in the Rural sector.To continue our excellent success story in our Rural team, we are looking for a Senior Rural Manager to join our team based in Morrinsville or Hamilton. We are also open to applications at a Rural Manager level, as this team provides excellent support and career growth opportunities.About you | Ō pūkenga:Tertiary qualified or with significant knowledge of the finance and banking industry or rural sector, your proven track record in managing and growing a client portfolio will get your foot in the door; while your negotiation, problem-solving, time-management skills and courage to have robust business conversations with customers will underpin your on-going success. Naturally driven and motivated by providing unbeatable customer outcomes and solutions, you will thrive in working within a high-performing team. Banking experience is not essential if you have relevant experience within the rural industry.Working for ASB | Te mahi ki ASB:In return, you will work for an organisation that places huge importance and focus on its people. Our rural team are recognised as being market leaders, and this is a fantastic career move to make your mark in the industry, further your growth and success, and help keep our rural customers one step ahead.ASB is committed to fostering a culture where people are engaged, passionate and valued - living our values every day is integral to accelerating the financial progress of rural NZ.How to apply? | Me pēhea te tono:Please note that all applications must be received via our careers site online. For more information see the attached position description.To serve a diverse community, we need a diverse organisation. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds who bring unique perspectives and thinking styles that add to the culture and performance of our team.More details (document) Senior Rural Manager.pdf

jobs.description: Work be part of our distinguished Waikato Management School Competitive compensation and benefits - generous leave entitlement, up to 6.75% employer contributionsHamilton, Waikato New Zealand Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleWe are looking for a dynamic individual who will bring professional and academic experience to be part of a team dedicated to excellence in teaching, research and postgraduate supervision within the discipline of finance and technology. You will have the skills and experience to provide leadership and innovation in teaching. Along with teaching, your well-defined programme of research will help to advance research capacities, develop strategic cross and inter-disciplinary research initiatives, and engage with the community. You will be a supportive supervisor of graduate and postgraduate students and their research, alongside your own established and high-level record of impactful research, relevant to finance and technology. In addition, you will be able to demonstrate a commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi and an understanding of how your research could enhance professional practice and community. Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The Division of Management (known externally as the Waikato Management School, WMS) offers qualifications at the undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral levels and is one of four Divisions at the University of Waikato. The Division has distinguished itself among New Zealand business schools by the relevance and the rigor of its education and its research. It is a member of an elite group of global business skills that have earned Triple Crown status – an international acknowledgement of excellence in business education. What you'll experienceOur purpose is to make Kiwis' lives a little better every day.As a Woolworths Pharmacy team member you will receive a generous salary, bonus and company shares as well as: Travel/transfer opportunitiesRegular pay reviewsSupportive team environmentSupport further learning - we will pay for courses and trainingClear supportive career developmentReimbursement of APC, PDA and membership to PSNZGrocery discount card - 5 -10% off your groceries!Half price online delivery and free online delivery for new parentsEmployee Assistance ProgramDiscounts on health insurance, dental, optometrists, gym memberships, JB Hi-Fi, PB tech and many more!Samsung partnership - AMAZING discountsWe’re friendly, down-to-earth, and energetic - we work hard but we have a great time doing it, and we love what we do. There is plenty of scope for new ideas, lots of room for you to add value, and importantly, you’ll be working with a business that touches the lives of three million New Zealanders a week.If you’re smart and good at what you do, come as you are. Endless possibilities with Woolworths GroupWe're a proud part of the Woolworths Group – 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives working together connected by a shared Purpose – ‘to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow.Here you’ll be supported and empowered to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week. Backed by a culture of genuine care, a flexible approach to work and the support to grow your career and make a meaningful impact, the possibilities for what we can achieve together are endless.Everyone belongs Woolworths GroupWe believe that diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging are key to realising our purpose of better together for a better tomorrow. We recognise the value our team’s diversity brings to our business, our customers and our communities, and that teams with diverse experiences and backgrounds enrich our group and are better able to innovate and solve problems. As one of the largest employers in Australia and New Zealand, we aim to create a truly inclusive workplace where everyone feels that they belong, can be their best self and reach their full potential.We encourage all candidates to apply, please let us know in your application if we can support you with any adjustments in the hiring process.

jobs.title: Care Coordinator
jobs.description: Ko wai mātou? | Who are we? Access Community Health l Uru Ātea stands as a leading provider of home-based healthcare and support in New Zealand. Our nurses and Kaiāwhina | Support Workers provide services to more than 40,000 people. And we listen to each one of them, because we genuinely care. 'A better day, every day' He kōrero whakamārama mō tēnei tūranga | About the role This role plays an important part in helping our regions deliver quality health and wellbeing services to the community. Operating within a fast-paced call management environment, it is responsible for the seamless coordination of essential home-based care and support services. As the key link between our community Support Workers and valued clients, this position ensures the delivery of timely, personalised care—empowering individuals to live safely, independently, and with dignity in their own homes. Hourly Rate: $25.50 - Additional allowances of $0.45-$0.50 per hour apply based on role criteria. Work TimingsWeek one 7am - 4pmWeek two 8am - 5pm - than ongoingMōhou Ake | About You Strong customer service and relationship-building skills - able to connect with a wide range of people and adapt communication styles effectively. Empathy with professionalism - naturally caring while maintaining clear boundaries and focus. Excellent organisational and time management abilities - able to prioritise tasks and manage multiple responsibilities efficiently. Effective problem-solving and critical thinking - able to read between the lines and think creatively to resolve issues. Proficient computer skills - confident using Microsoft Office and general PC applications. Ngā pūkenga matua | Preferred SkillsExcellent customer service skills.General computer literacy and the ability to multi-task under pressure.Creative and strategic problem-solving abilities.A commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi and showing cultural awareness and sensitivity.He aha ai mātou? | Why Us? Access is leading the way in delivering exceptional service standards in our community - we provide ongoing training at every level in our workforce Access to exclusive discounts for major retailers and wellbeing benefits via our Perks App Exclusive Spark Mobile Plan: Get endless data (40GB at max speed, then reduced), unlimited NZ/AU calls & texts, hotspot access, and voicemail for just $24.15/month Access Community Health l Uru Ātea has a mission to create a better day, every day for thousands of people throughout Aotearoa to live independently in their own homes and communities. Access l Uru Ātea is more than just our name, Uru Ātea means "to enter space" and is our promise to deliver services in our client's space, wherever that may be.

jobs.description: NEXT is a leading new build construction company servicing Hamilton and the grater Waikato.NEXT construction has over 30 years combined building and development experience. jobs.description: At NZCL, we are dedicated to support people with disabilities in New Zealand. Our Disability Support Services reflect our belief that all people deserve to live fully, have equal opportunities, and achieve their ambitions. You will be part of a team who will provide a safe environment where people can develop confidence and new skills, build friendships with peers and interact with others in the community. You need to be respectful of others thinking, and their way of living life that may be different to your own.Flexibility to work overnight shifts across a roster, including weekends.Empathy, respect, and cultural awareness is important in this role as the people we support come from diverse backgrounds with varying needs and interests. If you are passionate about supporting people, then maybe there is a role for you here. Send your request to NZCL.Mēnā he tangata ngākaunui ana koe ki te tautoko i ngā momo tāngata, tēnā pea, kei konei he tūranga mōu. Tukua mai tō tono ki NZCL. jobs.title: Teaching Fellow in Biomedical Sciences
jobs.description: Are you passionate about helping students explore multiple pathways in health and science?Do you thrive in environments that value teaching excellence, innovation, and student success?This is an exciting opportunity to join the School of Pharmacy and Biomedical Sciences at the University of Waikato and contribute to the development of future leaders in biomedical science Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleAs Teaching Fellow in Biomedical Sciences, you will play a core role in delivering high-quality undergraduate and postgraduate teaching across areas relevant to the Biomedical Science major. This may include lectures, tutorials, workshops, laboratories, and fieldwork.Your responsibilities will also include contributing to assessment, paper administration, development of teaching materials, and training or supervising sessional assistants.Teaching Fellows at Waikato focus on excellence in teaching and learning rather than research, making this an ideal role for those passionate about education, student engagement, and impactful teaching practice.Salary will be in the range of $79,211 to $111,169 per year, based on the skills, knowledge, and experience you bring to the role. This is a full-time position (37.5 hours a week) based at our Hilcrest campus.For more information about the position, please refer to the position description. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted. Please note: Interviews for this role will take place in early January 2026. All candidates will be contacted and updated in the New Year.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You will hold a postgraduate qualification in a biomedical sciences discipline and have proven successful tertiary-level teaching experience in areas relevant to Biomedical Science.You are known for your ability to communicate effectively with students and colleagues, and for your commitment to delivering engaging, inclusive, and innovative learning experiences, including online and blended approaches.You will bring:Strong organisational and administrative skillsHigh accuracy in assessment and markingThe ability to adopt and apply new teaching methods, models, and technologiesA commitment to cultural safety, equity, diversity, and partnership with Māori under Te Tiriti o WaitangiThe ability to work collaboratively within a team-oriented, student-focused environmentA background in curriculum development is an advantage.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The Division of Health is dedicated to achieving better and fairer health outcomes for Aotearoa. We offer programmes in Biomedical Sciences, Human Performance Science, Health Promotion, Nursing, Midwifery, Pharmacy, and Sport Development and Coaching, with ongoing expansion into new health disciplines.The School of Pharmacy and Biomedical Sciences supports students across a range of programmes and contributes to the Division’s mission to address health inequities, strengthen Māori and Pacific health outcomes, and prepare graduates for future health workforce needs.He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?This is a unique opportunity to contribute to the development of Aotearoa’s newest health education and research ecosystem. You will play a key role in creating the technical infrastructure and operational systems that enable innovative, equitable, and sustainable health education for the future.At the University of Waikato, we value integrity, creativity, diversity, and our enduring partnership with Māori. We are committed to a workplace that is inclusive and mana-enhancing, and we welcome applications from candidates with the skills, authority, and vision to help us achieve our goals.Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. E herea ana te Whare Wānanga ki te kaupapa kia whakaratohia te mea angitū ōrite ki ngā tāngata katoa.Applications Close on Monday 5th January 2025Requisition number: 1003189

jobs.description: Lead student support across enrolment, exams & graduationDrive improvements using technology and streamlined processesStep in as manager to guide and support your team effectively Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleAs a Senior Student Centre Advisor, you’ll be the key escalation point for student enquiries across enrolment, exams, assessments, and graduation. Working as part of a collaborative, solutions-focused team, you’ll provide clear, timely advice that helps students confidently navigate university processes.In this role, you’ll lead aspects of training, reporting, and day-to-day operations, supporting the division to deliver exceptional customer service. You’ll also manage a primary and secondary portfolio, using technology and continuous improvement to enhance how we work. When required, you’ll step in for the Student Centre Manager to help keep the team running smoothly.Salary will be in the range of $85,279 to $97,532 per year based on skills, knowledge and experience brought to the position. This is a full-time role (37.5 hours a week), based on our Hillcrest Campus.For more information on the role please see the position description. For a confidential conversation about the role, please contact Laura McFarlane, Student Centre Manager, laura.mcfarlane@waikato.ac.nz. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You’ll bring strong analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills, along with the ability to plan, prioritise and manage a busy workload. You understand university processes and know how to build effective relationships across teams to achieve shared goals. You’re confident investigating issues, making sound recommendations, and using technology to improve the way work gets done.You’re an excellent communicator with a commitment to delivering exceptional customer service. You’re experienced in supporting team development through training, documentation and continuous improvement, and you’re comfortable working in an environment of ongoing change. Culturally aware and adaptable, you’re able to identify risks, offer solutions, and maintain high standards under pressure.It would be an advantage if you’ve studied at tertiary level, can speak a second language, or have experience with financial processes such as receipting and reconciliations.Don’t meet every single requirement?Research shows that some people are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. At The University of Waikato, we’re committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and genuine workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t perfectly match every listed qualification, we still encourage you to apply. You might be just the right person for this or another opportunity on our team.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? Student Systems and Administration provides high quality integrated services that foster engagement, promote wellbeing and support students in achieving their academic goals. The work of Student Systems and Administration comprises the following: administrative processes from enrolment through to graduation, enquiry management, as well as maintaining the student systems. The Director of Student Systems and Administration is responsible for the overall management of the Division, with assistance from the Managers. He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleJoin our dedicated International Student Services team and make a real impact supporting international students at the University of Waikato! We have two exciting fixed-term International Student Advisor roles available.In this dynamic role, you’ll provide personalised pastoral care, guidance, and support to help students feel welcomed, safe, and connected throughout their university journey. Working collaboratively across the University and with external partners, you’ll help deliver engaging events, workshops, and orientation programmes that foster belonging and success.You’ll also contribute as part of a supportive, multifunctional team, taking responsibility for a portfolio area while assisting with wider team initiatives.To succeed, you will:Have experience supporting students, ideally in tertiary education.Understand the unique challenges international students face.Be an excellent communicator (bilingual skills an advantage).Bring strong administrative and digital skills with a compassionate, proactive approach.Must have working rights in New Zealand to be considered for this role.If you’re passionate about student wellbeing and cultural engagement, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you.The salary for this position will be in the range of $71,275 to $84,695 per year, depending on the skills, knowledge, and experience the successful candidate brings.We are recruiting for two roles:One full-time position (37.5 hours per week)One part-time position (22.5 hours per week)Both roles are 12-month fixed-term appointments to support organisational priorities and project requirements. These positions are based at our Hillcrest Campus.For more information on the role please see the position description. For a confidential conversation about the role, please contact Alyssa Wolk-Bankier, International Student Services Manager, alyssa.wolk-bankier@waikato.ac.nz. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You are a compassionate, culturally aware professional with strong communication, organisational, and administrative skills. You thrive in a student-focused environment, bringing empathy, initiative, and professionalism to everything you do. With experience supporting people from diverse backgrounds—ideally within the tertiary sector—you’re confident navigating multiple systems, managing priorities, and building positive relationships. Your proactive and flexible approach, combined with cultural understanding and a commitment to excellence, ensures international students feel supported, valued, and empowered to succeed.Don’t meet every single requirement?Research shows that some people are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. At The University of Waikato, we’re committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and genuine workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t perfectly match every listed qualification, we still encourage you to apply. You might be just the right person for this or another opportunity on our team.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The Student Services Division provides a comprehensive range of relevant student services that support teaching, learning and research and enrich the Waikato student experience. The work of Student Services is comprised of the following: pastoral care, international student support, health, counselling, accommodation, and the Tauranga campus student support services. The Director Student Services & Pastoral Care is responsible for the overall management of the Student Services Division, with assistance from a team of Associate Directors and ManagersHe aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. E herea ana te Whare Wānanga ki te kaupapa kia whakaratohia te mea angitū ōrite ki ngā tāngata katoa.Applications Close on Friday 5th December 2025Requisition number: 1003104

this sounds like the opportunity for you, click Apply Now to submit your application! jobs.title: SALES REPRESENTATIVE - FIELD based BDM
jobs.description: Upbeat field-based BDM's for face-to-face new business role. Big $$ potentialHigh energy, motivated, goal driven, hungry to achieve - Sound like you?If you are looking for a great BDM role to sink your teeth into. THIS IS IT!Secure your future with this outstanding sales opportunity for my favorite clients.Interview now for a Jan 2026 start!Our leading service industry client, is growing their team and is looking for super motivated Sales Representatives to get out, acquire new business and grow their client base.The business is well known, and their value proposition is strong — which just makes your job easier. With growing demand and a business on the rise, they’re expanding their sales team, so we are looking for a Sales Representative to grow a Waikato based territory.This is a field based, hunting role, so we’re looking for a confident, face-to-face Sales Rep who thrives on activity, targets, and closing deals.In a nutshell you will be responsible for getting out and talking to all the businesses in your designated territory to make sales and grow revenue across your territory. We are looking for upbeat motivated salespeople that are comfortable talking to big businesses and small businesses and all those in between,And... if you are looking for a great team, of down-to-earth people.... and leadership that supports you and provides opportunity for your internal career growth.... then this role will tick all of the boxes.The RoleGenerate new business opportunities through proactive prospecting, networking, and client visits.This is a field-based role where you will be out calling on every business in your territory.This is not difficult as most commercial businesses with be sales prospectsThis will sound a bit blunt, but this role is NOT for those who prefer Account Management, or prospect by sending emails, or prefer to be office based. You will need to be high energy and enjoy getting out and aboutDevelop and manage a robust sales pipeline to consistently achieve (and exceed) targets.What we’re looking for:High Energy Go- GettersMin 1-2 years in field-based face to face B2B sales.Having a background in door knocking and direct sales is a bonusConfidence in prospecting, cold calling and making sales appointments with new customers.Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to influence and negotiate.Highly self-motivated, with the discipline to work independently, while managing a territory.Has strong presentation and closing skillsWho will put in the sales activity to talk to more customers and close more deals. We are looking for those that really want to make good $$$, so we only want highly motivated salespeople who will get out there and smash it.We require candidates who are confident in engaging with businesses through face-to-face interactions.The Rewards:You will receive amazing training, great learning opportunities and an environment which enables hard work to equal success and great rewards. A base salary of $80K + full use Company Car and uncapped commissions. On target earnings will be $130K++ (Good potential to earn a lot more - $150K++). This is an outstanding opportunity for those ready to seize it.How to Apply: Send your CV to lisa@kingsrecruitment.co.nzPlease note that only shortlisted applicants will be contacted, and this will happen within a week of your application.

jobs.title: Centre Administrator
jobs.description: Are you looking for an administration role in a vibrant, Reggio-inspired centre filled with aroha, curiosity and laughter? We have the role for you at House of Wonder Chartwell in Hamilton.We are looking for a warm, welcoming and professional superstar administrator to join our team at House of Wonder Chartwell. Our centre admin will play a key role in building and maintaining relationships within our centre community. You will provide a high level of support to the Centre Manager through effective management of administration systems and clear, friendly communication with whānau and external organisations.At House of Wonder Chartwell, we cherish every child as a unique taonga and celebrate the richness of our multicultural community. Guided by Reggio Emilia principles, tuakana teina and whanaungatanga, we create a space where relationships, nature, and child led exploration sit at the heart of our days. You will be part of a team that values genuine connection, shared humour and heart led mahi for tamariki and their families.This is a part time role offering 20 hours per week, Monday to Friday, with some flexibility.Key Responsibilities:Face to face interactions with parents, children and visitors to the CentreMaintenance of our childcare management system (Discover) - data entry, data audits, parent invoicing and payment receiptsAnswering and directing telephone calls, timely, accurately and professionally Daily and weekly reports and data collation as required by the Centre ManagerSupplying information to our Support Office in line with daily and weekly reporting requirementsAny other general admin-based tasks as required and requestedAbout You:You are warm, friendly and welcoming, with outstanding customer service skills and a natural way with people from diverse backgrounds. You are tech savvy with strong computer skills, especially in MS Office, and bring exceptional organisation, attention to detail and time management. You can juggle priorities, solve problems calmly, and are happy to pitch in and support others when needed. Experience with childcare management systems, WINZ funding, accounts or invoicing is an advantage, but not essential for the right person with the right attitude. In return for your commitment, we offer you a competitive remuneration package which includes subsidised childcare and an excellent induction programme with mentoring and ongoing opportunities for personal developmentIf you would like to be considered for this exciting opportunity to join us in providing exceptional administrative support, then please send your CV and cover letter today!Please note: Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visaWhy Work for Busy Bees?If you’re passionate about early learning, Busy Bees is the place to be. Although we are part of a global organisation, our company was founded by three families looking for better, more enriching childcare. Three decades later, we still keep the same values at heart.We know that we couldn’t do what we do without the important people in our teams. We invest in our people and work with them to build career pathways that inspire.

This role offers the opportunity to make a real impact on the health and wellbeing of our diverse student community. You’ll deliver expert clinical care while working collaboratively with a multidisciplinary team of healthcare professionals who share a passion for supporting young people through their university journey.We’re looking for someone who enjoys working in a dynamic environment, values holistic and preventative approaches to healthcare, and brings innovative ideas to enhance service delivery. You’ll also contribute to health promotion initiatives across the wider University community, helping to create a supportive and thriving campus environment.Salary for this role is in accordance with the Nurse Practitioners New Zealand Renumeration Guideline https://www.nurse.org.nz/npnz. It is based on skills, knowledge and experience brought to the position. This is a part-time role (15 hours a week minimum), based on our Hillcrest Campus.For more information on the role, please see the position description. You bring a patient-centred approach to your work, with excellent communication skills and a genuine interest in supporting students’ physical, mental, and emotional wellbeing.With your strong clinical background and current registration with the Nursing Council of New Zealand as a Nurse Practitioner in Primary Health Care, you’re confident in your ability to provide safe, high-quality care. You are collaborative by nature – someone who enjoys working alongside a multidisciplinary team to deliver holistic, inclusive, and culturally responsive healthcare.You’ll thrive in a fast-paced, diverse environment where every day brings new challenges and opportunities to contribute to positive health outcomes. You value equity, cultural understanding, and innovation, and you’re motivated by improving student health and wellbeing across the University community.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? Student Services provides high quality integrated services that foster engagement, promote wellbeing and supports students in achieving their academic goals. The work of Student Services comprises the following: administrative processes from enrolment through to graduation, enquiry management, pastoral care, international student services, health, accommodation, counselling, disabilities support, career development services, sport and wellbeing, student surveys and student complaints and appeals. The Director of Student Services is responsible for the overall management of Student Services, with assistance from a team of Associate Directors including the Associate Director, Student Health.The University Health Service provides high quality, accessible health and wellbeing care to students. The integrated, multidisciplinary team supports the educational process by modifying or removing health related barriers to personal development and learning.He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. What you'll experienceOur purpose is to make Kiwis' lives a little better every day.As a Woolworths Pharmacy team member you will receive a generous salary, bonus and company shares as well as: Travel/transfer opportunitiesRegular pay reviewsSupportive team environmentSupport further learning - we will pay for courses and trainingClear supportive career developmentReimbursement of APC, PDA and membership to PSNZGrocery discount card - 5 -10% off your groceries!Half price online delivery and free online delivery for new parentsEmployee Assistance ProgramDiscounts on health insurance, dental, optometrists, gym memberships, JB Hi-Fi, PB tech and many more!Samsung partnership - AMAZING discountsWe’re friendly, down-to-earth, and energetic - we work hard but we have a great time doing it, and we love what we do. There is plenty of scope for new ideas, lots of room for you to add value, and importantly, you’ll be working with a business that touches the lives of three million New Zealanders a week.If you’re smart and good at what you do, come as you are. Endless possibilities with Woolworths GroupWe're a proud part of the Woolworths Group – 200,000+ bright minds, passionate hearts and unique perspectives working together connected by a shared Purpose – ‘to create better experiences together for a better tomorrow.Here you’ll be supported and empowered to explore new ideas, make brave commitments and innovate better ways to meet the food and everyday needs of more than 24 million customers every week. Backed by a culture of genuine care, a flexible approach to work and the support to grow your career and make a meaningful impact, the possibilities for what we can achieve together are endless.Everyone belongs Woolworths GroupWe believe that diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging are key to realising our purpose of better together for a better tomorrow. We recognise the value our team’s diversity brings to our business, our customers and our communities, and that teams with diverse experiences and backgrounds enrich our group and are better able to innovate and solve problems. As one of the largest employers in Australia and New Zealand, we aim to create a truly inclusive workplace where everyone feels that they belong, can be their best self and reach their full potential.We encourage all candidates to apply, please let us know in your application if we can support you with any adjustments in the hiring process.

jobs.title: Kiehl's - Beauty Advisor

jobs.title: 3PL Store Person
jobs.description: About us You’ve probably seen our recognisable polar bear logo on trucks going from town to town across our beautiful country. jobs.title: Centre Administrator
jobs.description: Are you looking for an administration role in a vibrant, multicultural centre filled with aroha, connection and laughter? We have the role for you at Busy Bees Grandview Road in Nawton, Hamilton. We are looking for a superstar administrator to join our team at Busy Bees Grandview Road. We are seeking a warm, welcoming and professional individual who will play a key role in building and maintaining relationships within our centre community. You will provide a high level of support to the Centre Manager through effective management of administration systems and clear, friendly communication with whānau and external organisations. At Busy Bees Grandview Road, we celebrate the richness of our multicultural community and are guided by whanaungatanga and tuakana teina relationships. You will be part of a team that values genuine relationships, shared humour and heart led mahi for tamariki and their families.This is a part time role offering 15 hours per week, Monday to Friday, with some flexibility.Key Responsibilities:Face to face interactions with parents, children and visitors to the CentreMaintenance of our childcare management system (Discover) - data entry, data audits, parent invoicing and payment receiptsAnswering and directing telephone calls, timely, accurately and professionally Daily and weekly reports and data collation as required by the Centre ManagerSupplying information to our Support Office in line with daily and weekly reporting requirementsAny other general admin-based tasks as required and requestedAbout You:You are warm, friendly and welcoming, with outstanding customer service skills and a natural way with people from diverse backgrounds. You are tech savvy with strong computer skills, especially in MS Office, and bring exceptional organisation, attention to detail and time management. You can juggle priorities, solve problems calmly, and are happy to pitch in and support others when needed. Experience with childcare management systems, WINZ funding, accounts or invoicing is an advantage, but not essential for the right person with the right attitude. In return for your commitment, we offer you a competitive remuneration package which includes subsidised childcare and an excellent induction programme with mentoring and ongoing opportunities for personal developmentIf you would like to be considered for this exciting opportunity to join us in providing exceptional administrative support, then please send your CV and cover letter today!Please note: Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visaWhy Work for Busy Bees?If you’re passionate about early learning, Busy Bees is the place to be. Although we are part of a global organisation, our company was founded by three families looking for better, more enriching childcare. Three decades later, we still keep the same values at heart.We know that we couldn’t do what we do without the important people in our teams. We invest in our people and work with them to build career pathways that inspire.

jobs.title: Intermediate Architectural Designer
jobs.description: About PragmaPragma is a proudly family-run company, committed to delivering high-quality, well-planned, and affordable developments. As locals ourselves, we care deeply about the communities we help build — and that commitment is reflected in how we work with our clients, partners, and team.We’re growing and looking for a highly motivated, Intermediate Architectural Designer to join our team as we take on new projects across the Waikato.About the RoleThe role will provide general assistance to the Design team and Build consenting team. Our Design team develop concept designs all the way through to Building consents.This position would suit someone with a Qualification in Architecture, and a minimum of 5 years proven experience.Key Responsibilities:· To provide concept designs for residential houses in our subdivisions, and small commercial buildings within Hamilton, when required.· To turn the concept design plans into land use (resource consent), which allows for building/subdivision approval.· Provide subdivision plans to show section boundaries, party walls (inter tenancy walls), ROW’s, and drainage/services locations.· To provide working drawings for Building consent which includes: the drawing set, specifications, specific building details, and H1 reports.· Liaise with Pragma team members regarding design queries and changes.· Draw landscape plans when required including planting schedule information.· Organise daily workflow, including appointments and email management.· Liaise with external contractors to ensure correct documentation has been provided and is kept up to date with changes.About you:You’re a reliable and hardworking individual who is innovative and motivated. You are a team player, with good communication skills and a high level of attention to detail.You’ll bring:· A good level of computer literacy.· Proficiency in Revit and Archicad· A desire for quality output and will take great pride in your work.· Having an LBP license would be an advantage· The ability to produce 3D renders using Lumion· Proficiency in the Adobe SuiteWhy Join Pragma· Join a values-driven, family-run company where integrity and collaboration are at the heart of everything we do.· Collaborate with an experienced leadership team who genuinely support your growth· Enjoy a competitive salary package and a positive, inclusive work environmentHow to Apply If this sounds like the opportunity you’ve been looking for, please send your CV and cover letter to careers@pragma.co.nz.Join Pragma and help us shape the future of quality developments in our region.

jobs.title: Accommodation Office Administrator
jobs.description: Support leaders, staff, students, and visitors dailyBe a proactive problem-solver with great people skillsTwo great opportunities — one junior and one senior! Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleWe’re excited to offer two opportunities — one junior and one senior — for enthusiastic individuals to provide high-quality administrative, reception, accounts, and project support for the Accommodation Office. These roles play a key part in supporting an active, student-oriented campus environment, helping create a welcoming and engaging experience for all.As the friendly face and dependable point of contact for students, staff, and visitors, you’ll ensure our accommodation and homestay operations run smoothly and efficiently.Whether you’re looking to take the next step in your career or gain valuable experience in a supportive team, these positions are ideal for people who thrive in a busy, people-centred environment and take pride in delivering exceptional service within a vibrant university community.For the Junior role, the salary range is $58,439 to $70,692 per year, and for the Senior role, $71,275 to $84,695 per year. The actual salary will be determined based on the skills, knowledge, and experience you bring to the position. These are full-time roles (37.5 hours per week), based at our Hillcrest Campus.For more information about each position, please refer to the position descriptions:Junior Role – Position DescriptionSenior Role – Position DescriptionFor a confidential conversation about the role, please contact TJ Cloete, Associate Director Student Accommodation, tj.cloete@waikato.ac.nz. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You’re an organised, proactive, and approachable professional who thrives in a busy, people-focused environment. With strong administrative, organisational, and communication skills, you take pride in delivering high-quality support and exceptional customer service. Confident working with people from diverse backgrounds, you bring initiative, accuracy, and a positive attitude to everything you do. Whether managing reception, coordinating administrative or financial processes, or supporting students and staff, you’re adaptable, detail-oriented, and committed to creating a welcoming, efficient, and student-centred environment.Don’t meet every single requirement?Research shows that some people are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. At The University of Waikato, we’re committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and genuine workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t perfectly match every listed qualification, we still encourage you to apply. You might be just the right person for this or another opportunity on our team.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The Student Services Division provides a comprehensive range of relevant student services that support teaching, learning and research and enrich the Waikato student experience. The work of Student Services is comprised of the following: Pastoral Care International Student Support HealthCounselling Accommodation Tauranga campus student support services The Accommodation Service is responsible for all aspects of student accommodation including buildings, services and pastoral care as well as the provision of homestay services, accommodation advice and the operation of the University’s rental properties. The Associate Director Student Accommodation is responsible for the effective and efficient management of the Accommodation Service. The Accommodation Office Manager is responsible for the management of the Accommodation Office.He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. The Division of Health is committed to addressing health inequities and preventable diseases, with a particular focus on improving Māori and Pacific health outcomes. jobs.title: Solution Architect
jobs.description: Hybrid work 3 days on-siteIndustry leading innovative organisationA well-established brandAbout the companyOur Hamilton based client focusing on helping people, communities, and the environment. This is a collaborative business with aim to build a stronger community.About the Role:We are looking for an experienced Solution Architect with a strong background in software development to join our client on a 6-month contract. This role is perfect for someone who has hands-on coding experience and is ready to design and deliver scalable, secure, and innovative solutions that meet business needs.Key Responsibilities:Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions.Design end-to-end architecture for complex systems, ensuring scalability, security, and performance.Provide technical leadership and guidance to development teams throughout the project lifecycle.Evaluate emerging technologies and recommend innovative solutions.Ensure compliance with architectural standards and governance frameworks.What We’re Looking For:Proven experience in software development (Java, .NET, Python, or similar).Strong understanding of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and microservices architecture.Excellent knowledge of API design, integration patterns, and DevOps practices.Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Experience in designing solutions for enterprise-level applications.Preferred Qualifications:Previous experience as a Solution Architect or Technical Lead.Familiarity with containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes) and CI/CD pipelines.Certifications in cloud architecture (AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Azure Solutions Architect, etc.).HOW TO APPLYClick the APPLY button and include your resume and cover letter or for further information please call Abeer on 07 834 0412.Please note, we can only consider applicants that are legally entitled to work in New Zealand at the time of application.

jobs.title: Research Management Advisor
jobs.description: Support and help secure world-leading research projectsEngaging work that makes a difference, in a great team Exciting opportunity: Advisor or Senior Advisor role available Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleWe are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented professional for either an Advisor or Senior Advisor role to provide expert support and guidance on externally funded research contracts. In this position, you will collaborate with researchers, management, sponsors, and students to coordinate research funding applications, helping the University maximise its funding opportunities.You will provide high-quality, accurate, and timely advice across all aspects of research funding, including proposal development, budgeting, reporting, and identifying potential funding sources. Your ability to build and maintain strong, collaborative relationships with internal and external stakeholders - including funding providers and industry partners - will be key to your success.For a Senior Advisor role, the position also includes providing leadership and oversight of Research & Enterprise processes, supporting the Director of Research and Enterprise, and managing a specific portfolio within the office, such as research information systems, committee support, or other research-related functions.The Advisor role offers a salary range of $71,275 to $84,695 per year, while the Senior Advisor role offers $85,279 to $97,532 per year. Salary will be commensurate with the skills, knowledge, and experience you bring to the position. This is a full-time role (37.5 hours per week) based at our Hillcrest Campus.For more information on the role please see the position description for the Advisor role, here and the Senior Advisor, here. For a confidential conversation about the role, please contact Simon Lovatt, Director of Research and Enterprise, at simon.lovatt@waikato.ac.nz. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?We are seeking an enthusiastic, proactive, and suitably qualified professional for either an Advisor or Senior Advisor role to support the University’s research growth. You will provide high-quality advice and support on research proposals, budgeting, and project management, building strong relationships with researchers, management, sponsors, and students.You will have a relevant tertiary qualification, excellent administrative and project management skills, and proficiency with Microsoft Office and databases. Strong communication, organisational, and problem-solving abilities, along with attention to detail, are essential.For a Senior Advisor, experience in research or research management (typically 5+ years), leadership capability, and the ability to manage a portfolio or oversee processes is required. A commitment to equity and inclusion, including awareness of Māori and Pacific cultures, is valued.Don’t meet every single requirement?Research shows that some people are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. At The University of Waikato, we’re committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and genuine workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t perfectly match every listed qualification, we still encourage you to apply. You might be just the right person for this or another opportunity on our team.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The University of Waikato has many research partnerships with businesses, other research organisations and government. We have internationally recognised research capabilities and facilities across numerous disciplines, and strive to deliver pioneering, transferable research and cutting-edge new knowledge. The Research & Enterprise Office works closely with University of Waikato researchers to support all research-related activities, including consultancies and commercialisation. For more information about the Research and Enterprise Office please our website.He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students, and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. E herea ana te Whare Wānanga ki te kaupapa kia whakaratohia te mea angitū ōrite ki ngā tāngata katoa.Applications Close on Tuesday 2nd December 2025Requisition Number: 1003096

jobs.title: Team Leader
jobs.description: At NZCL, we are dedicated to supporting people with disabilities in New Zealand. Our Disability Support Services reflect our belief that all people deserve to live fully, have equal opportunities, and achieve their ambitions. We are looking for an energetic and motivated Team Leader for our Residential Houses in Hamilton. You will lead a team in supporting them to live as independently as possible. Supporting the person to plan and work towards their goals, making sure the person is at the centre of everything you do, and that the person lives a rich and fulfilling life.There will be a mixture of morning, afternoon, and evening shifts spanning across the week, so having the flexibility to support your team across a variety of shifts is a key part of this role.What does the role involve? | He aha te mahi a te mahiA Team Leader assists people with disabilities to live as independently as possible, as well as leading and motivating their team. Your day will involve a range of responsibilities and could include:Activities at home and in the community that are meaningful and purposeful to the people, including maximizing independence and involving Whānau.Household duties including meal preparation, daily care routines, and personal cares.Working together with a team to implement personal support plans consistently, with effective and positive teamwork and communication.Providing people with a warm and nurturing environment to live in, which is inclusive of ideas and feedback so that each person is supported towards their personal goals.What is in it for you? | He aha kei roto mo koeAs a company we are committed to our employees. We're proud to employ and train the best people in all areas of our organisation and we enjoy a vast degree of diversity within our staff teams.Earn competitive pay rates between $27.48 - 29.68 per hour. With an additional shift allowance of $1 per hour for Team Leader duties.Bespoke training that is tailored to the needs of the rangitahi/young personClinical Supervision to support best practicePB Tech discount when shopping onlineDiscounted 2Degrees phone and broadband plansDiscounted Southern Cross Health InsuranceDiscounted Samsung products Employee Assistance program service anytime you need health and wellbeing support'Refer a friend' Bonus.What are we looking for? | He aha ta tatou e rapu anaMinimum Qualification Level 3 in Health and Well-being requiredPeople who are passionate about helping others, are kind and understanding.Previous experience in a healthcare setting preferred, including experience with disabilities and challenges behaviours.Full driver's license is essential.Somebody who has the initiative to push people for their goals, is energetic, outgoing, and can think outside the box. You need to be respectful of others thinking, and their way of living life that may be different to your own.Flexibility to work overnight shifts across a roster, including weekends.A warm, calm, and friendly personality with a passion for supporting people to achieve positive outcomes for themselves.Empathy, respect, and cultural awareness is important in this role as the people we support come from diverse backgrounds with varying needs and interests. If you are passionate about supporting people, then maybe there is a role for you here. Send your request to NZCL.Mēnā he tangata ngākaunui ana koe ki te tautoko i ngā momo tāngata, tēnā pea, kei konei he tūranga mōu. Tukua mai tō tono ki NZCL. Please bear in mind all applicants must be a NZ Resident/Citizen or have a valid NZ work permit.

jobs.title: General Practitioner
jobs.description: Meaningful work supporting diverse student communitiesCampus-based role with regular hours and no after-hours workJoin a forward-thinking team focussed on collaboration and innovation Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleJoin our dedicated Student Health Services team as a General Practitioner providing high quality, student centred primary health care. This role offers the opportunity to make a real impact on the health and wellbeing of our diverse student community. You’ll deliver expert clinical care while working collaboratively with a multidisciplinary team of healthcare professionals who share a passion for supporting young people through their university journey.We’re looking for someone who enjoys working in a dynamic environment, values holistic and preventative approaches to healthcare, and brings innovative ideas to enhance service delivery. You’ll also contribute to health promotion initiatives across the wider University community, helping to create a supportive and thriving campus environment.Salary for this role is in accordance with the Association of Salaried Medical Specialists (ASMS) Te Whatu Ora Senior Medical and Dental Officers Collective Agreement https://asms.org.nz/employment-advice/meca/. It is based on skills, knowledge and experience brought to the position. This is a part-time role (30 hours a week), based on our Hillcrest Campus.For more information on the role, please see the position description. For a confidential conversation about the role, please contact Dr Kym Christodoulou, Medical Director, kym.christodoulou@waikato.ac.nz. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted.Please note that applications will be reviewed as they are received, and we encourage early submissions.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You’re an experienced and compassionate General Practitioner who is passionate about making a difference in the lives of young people. You bring a patient-centred approach to your work, with excellent communication skills and a genuine interest in supporting students’ physical, mental, and emotional wellbeing.With your strong clinical background and current registration as a Fellow of the Royal New Zealand College of General Practitioners (FRNZCGP), you’re confident in your ability to provide safe, high-quality care. You’re collaborative by nature – someone who enjoys working alongside a multidisciplinary team to deliver holistic, inclusive, and culturally responsive healthcare.You’ll thrive in a fast-paced, diverse environment where every day brings new challenges and opportunities to contribute to positive health outcomes. You value equity, cultural understanding, and innovation, and you’re motivated by improving student health and wellbeing across the University community.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? Student Services provides high quality integrated services that foster engagement, promote wellbeing and supports students in achieving their academic goals. The work of Student Services comprises the following: administrative processes from enrolment through to graduation, enquiry management, pastoral care, international student services, health, accommodation, counselling, disabilities support, career development services, sport and wellbeing, student surveys and student complaints and appeals. The Director of Student Services is responsible for the overall management of Student Services, with assistance from a team of Associate Directors including the Associate Director, Student Health.The University Health Service provides high quality, accessible health and wellbeing care to students. The integrated, multidisciplinary team supports the educational process by modifying or removing health related barriers to personal development and learning.He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. E herea ana te Whare Wānanga ki te kaupapa kia whakaratohia te mea angitū ōrite ki ngā tāngata katoa.Applications Close: This role will remain open until filled. Applications will be reviewed as they are received so we encourage early submissions.Requisition number: 1003061

jobs.title: Civil Estimator
jobs.description: We’re recruiting on behalf of a well-established civil construction company with a strong pipeline of infrastructure projects across the region. They deliver work in drainage, roading, earthworks, and three-waters—and are looking for an experienced Civil Estimator to join their commercial team.About the RoleYou will be responsible for preparing accurate and competitive estimates for projects ranging from $1M to $30M. This includes:Reviewing drawings, specifications, and tender documentsCompleting quantity take-offsSourcing subcontractor and supplier pricingPreparing detailed estimates, cost schedules, and tender submissionsWorking with project managers and engineers to finalize bidsSupporting post-tender clarifications and variationsWhat You’ll BringExperience estimating civil construction projectsStrong understanding of earthworks, drainage, roading, or three-watersGood commercial and numerical skillsConfident analysing drawings and doing take-offsStrong communication and the ability to meet tender deadlinesNZ experience or good knowledge of local standards/contractsWhat’s On OfferCompetitive salary based on experienceStable workload and a strong future pipelineSupportive, down-to-earth team cultureOpportunity to grow your influence in pre-constructionIf you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV. jobs.title: Scholarship Advisor
jobs.description: Interact with individuals from a range of backgroundsManage your own scholarships portfolio in a supportive, tight-knit teamContribute to a culture of continual improvement and innovation Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleJoin our small, high-performing team and take charge of your own portfolio of scholarships. In this rewarding role, you’ll provide high-level administrative support for scholarship processes and offer advice to students, staff, funders, and other external stakeholders. You’ll bring expertise in data and financial procedures, along with the ability to manage your workflow and deliver results.We’re looking for someone with sharp attention to detail, a flair for financial processes, and problem-solving skills. Proficiency in data manipulation will be a real asset in this role. You’ll work well independently and also thrive in a close-knit, collaborative team. This role also calls for empathy, sound judgement, cultural awareness, and the ability to meet deadlines. If you enjoy working with people, take pride in delivering excellent service, and have a knack for working with complex information and systems, we’d love to hear from you. The salary for this full-time role (37.5 hours per week) is $71,275–$84,695 per year, depending on your skills, knowledge, and experience. The position will be based at our Hillcrest Campus.For detailed information and to check your fit to the role please refer to the position description. For a confidential conversation about the role, contact Prof Emma Nicholson, Dean of Graduate Research, at emma.nicholson@waikato.ac.nz. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted.Please note applications will be reviewed as they are received. Early submissions are encouraged. Ko wai koe? – Who are you?Are you a well-organised team player and problem-solver who would thrive working in a tertiary environment? If so, we are looking for someone like you to join our dedicated and highly professional team of Scholarship Advisors.To be successful in this role you will have:A University degree, or equivalent relevant work experience Excellent administration skills, planning and organisation, and computer literacy including data manipulation and financial know-howStrong communication skills and professional approach with an eye for detailAbility to interpret, and experience with, working within fixed policies and processesDemonstrated commitment to high quality customer service Experience working with, and sensitivity to, people from varying backgrounds and cultures Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? Te Mata Kairangi is responsible for the strategic leadership and provision of services and administrative support for all scholarships, awards and prizes, and higher research degree qualifications at Te Whare Wānanga o Waikato the University of Waikato. There are two teams; one providing high quality service and advice to students, staff and external stakeholders for scholarships, at all levels of study, and the other managing the University’s doctoral qualifications. This position is within the Scholarships Team.He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students, and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply.
