jobs.title: Retail Loss Prevention Assistant
jobs.description: Our Hamilton branch is looking for a customer-focused loss prevention assistant to join our team full-time. Key Responsibilities: Support the retail team as directed by management.Monitor customer entry and exit points and maintain a presence on the retail floor.Operate and monitor CCTV systems effectively and responsibly.Conduct entry/exit checks, including invoice and product matching.Maintain store standards by ensuring customers follow bag, hat, and sunglasses policies.Assist in theft prevention through active surveillance and customer engagement.Perform regular stock checks with a focus on loss prevention and accuracy.Provide support to staff when managing upset or difficult customers.Identify and report individuals of concern or suspicious behavior promptly and professionally.RequirementsMust consent to and be able to satisfy pre-employment checks to progress through the recruitment process. As a minimum, these will include:Drivers LicenseMinistry of Justice Criminal History CheckPrevious experience in retail, loss prevention, or security is preferredStrong observational skills with the ability to remain alert and focused in a busy environment.Confident in monitoring customer behavior and identifying suspicious activity discreetly and professionally.Familiarity with CCTV systems and basic understanding of surveillance procedures (training can be provided).Calm and composed under pressure, especially when assisting with theft incidents or managing difficult customer situations.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.High level of honesty, integrity, and reliability.Physically fit and able to stand for extended periods.Willing and available to work weekends and public holidays as required.What we offer: Competitive payHealth insurance after working full-time for 12 monthsExclusive staff discounts on the latest tech products We appreciate all applications; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.Start dateASAPRef : 682

jobs.title: Experienced Industrial Blaster
jobs.description: Hamilton Blast and Paint is a long-standing industrial blasting and painting company based in Hamilton, Waikato. We are a privately owned family company that is firmly established.As a dynamic, fun team we are committed to up-skilling our employees and committed to workplace Health & Safety.This is primarily a workshop-based position in Melville, Hamilton with some off-site work available on occasion.This is a senior role and to be successful in this position we envisage you to:Be a self-starter, motivated, hardworking and reliable with a commitment to attendanceBe able to work independently as well as part of a teamHave a great attitude and work ethicBe keen to learn and keep improvingHave two references from previous employerBe able to pass pre-employment drug testingA minimum of 3 years’ experience as an industrial blasterIdeally be mechanically minded and able to make adjustments/minor repairs in the event of machinery breakdowns.Key tasks and responsibilities:Blast in a timely manner to the required specificationAccurate completion of daily timesheets which record job numbers and the specific timeMaintain and clean equipment/machinery used in the workshopAdhere to Health and Safety guidelines and company policies.We believe in remunerating our people fairly for their valued contribution and this will be determined based on experience.This is a full-time position with a requirement to do occasional weekend work.If you are looking for job security and a great place to work, have what we are looking for above, then attach current resume along with any relevant educational and employment related certificates to Cynthia – cynthia@hamiltonblastandpaint.co.nz

jobs.title: PHP Website Developer with Front & Back end development experience.
jobs.description: PHP/MySQl/React/Node.js/CSS/AI.You must be a New Zealand Citizen or Resident holding a work permit and be resident in New Zealand at the time of your application. If you don't have a work permit and are not living in New Zealand, do not apply.Website Angels are committed to elegant and usable Websites and digital solutions. Our websites and digital marketing solutions have been enabling local businesses to grow rapidly beyond their wildest dreams for the last six years.We are on the hunt for an experienced and passionate Website Developer that can assist us in our aim to deliver world-class user experiences that sell products and services for our customers. This also branches out into being responsible for the creation of websites that are visually stunning and technically excellent while being part of a very close-knit team.We build using our own in-house CMS, whilst often making use of WordPress, so a proven history of website development and troubleshooting for WordPress is ESSENTIAL. Our developers often live all-day writing in PHP, HTML, CSS/SCSS & JavaScript. Having experience in adapting AI processes into your workflows would be a great bonus. Our day to day work involves us utilizing GitHub to manage development projects.The successful candidate will work within the team to create functional websites, contribute ideas to enhance websites and not just sit there waiting to be told what to do. We love hearing about new ideas for existing projects or internal processes – we’d love to hear your ideas about what we can do differently. From the outset of a project, we strategize and plan a build with complete marketing solutions in mind through to the website being launched. A website is not finished once it goes live, it is only the beginning of its life. We work with our clients on their ongoing digital marketing needs to ensure that their phone is always ringing.The role is based in Hamilton, with 'work-from-home' as an option after a suitable period. We have an awesome team of Developers, Graphic Designers, Analysts and Strategists that enjoy what they do and work collaboratively as a team to provide world-class outcomes for our clients.Our ideal candidate would be kind, adaptable, naturally self-directed and thrive off working in a dynamic environment and being a bright character.Key Qualities that would make you the next ideal Angel:Proficient understanding of Object-Oriented ProgrammingBeing able to build and connect a website with a REST APIA strong passion for design with an eye for detailBeing able to communicate ‘technical’ readouts to a client in a simple and relatable mannerTime Management – ensuring all time spent on a project is recorded accurately and promptlyTech stack, tools, or process experiences:Websites built on WordPress & WordPress TroubleshootingGitHubPHPHTMLCSS/SCSSAI IntegrationJS – jQuery, React, Node.jsFigma & the Adobe Suite (InDesign, XD & Photoshop)You must be a New Zealand Citizen or Resident holding a work permit and be resident in New Zealand at the time of your application.We are a communications company, so having superb oral and written English skills in this role is a must.​

jobs.title: Family Home and Domestic Help Relievers
jobs.description: Casual positions available to join our team as a Family Home Reliever in Hamilton!Oranga Tamariki—Ministry for Children has a commitment of putting tamariki first, we believe aroha is vital, we respect the mana of people, we are tika and pono, we value whakapapa and we recognise that oranga is a journey.Mō te tūnga | About the roleOranga Tamariki operates Family Homes where between 1 and 5 tamariki are cared for by 2 Family Home Caregivers. When the caregivers have breaks of about 2 to 15 days, Family Home Relievers continue to provide the routine and maintain a safe, caring, responsible and supportive family environment on a 24/7 basis. Our Family Homes are also smoke free homes so this is something to keep in mind when considering your application.The role of a Family Home Reliever includes and not limited to cooking, shopping, recreation activities, helping with homework and supervision. Upon the start of your shift the caregiver will provide a detailed handover and a designated Social Worker in our family homes team will liaise with each home and provides the reliever with regular supervision. Our Social Worker provides care plans for tamariki therefore we are looking for candidates who can ensure that the activities continue to be carried out and are consistent with the care plan and handover instructions.An ideal candidate for this role is someone who has flexibility to be available 24 hours per day for a minimum of 3 days in a row and is committed to maintaining a safe, caring, responsible and supportive family environment in the family home. Ngā pūmanawatanga ōu | What you will bringKey requirements of the role include: Must hold a current full clean driver's licenceAbility to pass the background checks, which includes police and Oranga Tamariki vetting (The clean slate scheme does not apply to the police vetting for this role)Provide professional references from current and previous employersPrevious experience in social services work or working with children and young people would be an advantageUnderstanding and appreciation of cross-cultural practices in particular; knowledge of tikanga Māori, and Pacific peoples' cultureResilience to manage and support children and young people with varied needsBehaviour management/conflict resolution skillsBe a positive role modelHave a calm and professional mannerExcellent, listening, oral and observations skills and ability to write handover notes We encourage all applications from individuals with diverse backgrounds and expertise.Nōu te rourou | What's in it for youOur purpose is to ensure that all tamariki are in loving whānau and communities where Oranga Tamariki can be realised. We believe that by getting involved early in their lives and showing love and care, we give children the best chance of growing into happy thriving New Zealanders.We offer a great supportive team, that have a genuine commitment to wellbeing. We offer significant training and professional development so that you can thrive and grow, as this role is a casual role we are offering $26 p/hr + 8% holiday payMe pēhea te tuku tono | How to ApplyApply online with your CV and Covering Letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please ensure you apply with a log in using your Oranga Tamariki email address.If you have any questions about the role, please contact Info_recruit@ot.govt.nz. Hurry as applications for this role close on 5 December 2025!If you are interested in any of our vacancies, please ensure that you make yourself familiar with our code of conduct as it sets out our expectations for our kaimahi and requires you to present at work free from the influences of both drugs and alcohol.

jobs.title: Mental Health Professional
jobs.description: Additional university leave Low/no charge university papers and career development opportunitiesDiscounted gym membership Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleWe’re looking for one exceptional Mental Health Professional to join our Student Health Service team. Whether you are a social worker, counsellor, or registered nurse (mental health), you’ll play a vital role in supporting students to thrive personally and academically.In this role, you will:Assess mental health and psychosocial needs, working with students and their whānau or support networks.Deliver high-quality, recovery-focused therapeutic or clinical interventions.Use clear pathways of care, referring to internal and external services where appropriate.Provide case management for more complex student situations.Contribute to proactive wellbeing initiatives that strengthen mental health and resilience across our campus.Work collaboratively within a supportive interdisciplinary team committed to improving student wellbeing.We welcome applicants from any of the three professional backgrounds who are passionate about student wellbeing and ready to make a meaningful impact.The salary range for the Counsellor and Social Worker position is $85,279 to $97,532 per year (pro rata). The salary range for the Registered Nurse (Mental Health & Wellbeing) position is $71,037.19 to $100,067.81 per year (pro rata).Final remuneration will be based on the skills, knowledge, and experience you bring to the role. This is a part-time position (30 hours per week) based at our Hillcrest Campus.For more information on either of these roles, please see the position descriptions below:Social Worker: Position DescriptionCounsellor: Position Description Registered Nurse (Mental Health & Wellbeing): Position DescriptionFor a confidential conversation about the role, please contact Joanne Knight, Associate Director Student Health, joanne.knight@waikato.ac.nz. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted. Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You will be fully registered as per the individual position descriptions. You are a skilled and compassionate Mental Health Professional - whether a social worker, counsellor, or registered nurse (mental health) who brings strong assessment, therapeutic, and case management capability. You have experience supporting people with mental health needs, delivering brief, recovery-focused interventions, and using clear pathways of care to ensure clients access the right support.You understand the Aotearoa mental health environment, including community services, referral processes, and the factors that influence student wellbeing. Culturally responsive practice is central to your work, and you are committed to supporting Māori, Pacific, Rainbow, and diverse student communities with sensitivity and respect.You communicate clearly, build strong relationships, and work effectively both independently and within an interdisciplinary team. Adaptable and organised, you remain steady under pressure and are committed to continuous learning, professional integrity, and contributing positively to student wellbeing.Don’t meet every single requirement?Research shows that some people are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. At The University of Waikato, we’re committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and genuine workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t perfectly match every listed qualification, we still encourage you to apply. You might be just the right person for this or another opportunity on our team.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The Student Services Division provides high quality integrated services that foster engagement, promote wellbeing and support students in achieving their academic goals. The work of the Division comprises the following student services: administrative processes from enrolment through to graduation, enquiry management, pastoral care, international student services, health, accommodation, counselling, disabilities support, career development services, sport and wellbeing, student surveys and student complaints and appeals. The Director of Student Services is responsible for the overall management of the Division, with assistance from a team of Associate Directors including the Associate Director Student Health.The Student Health Service provides high quality, accessible primary health care, mental health and counselling services to the University of Waikato students and enhances the educational process by modifying or removing health-related barriers to personal development and learning. jobs.title: Assistant Store Manager Sales
jobs.description: Farmers is an iconic Kiwi brand serving the New Zealand market for over 100 years. jobs.title: Project / Programme / Design Manager
jobs.description: As part of our continued commitment to delivering high-impact infrastructure solutions across Aotearoa, Tonkin + Taylor is seeking experienced a Programme/Project/Design Manager to join our Project Delivery Group, ideally in Auckland but will consider other locations!This opportunity reflects our focus on strengthening project leadership capability across key sectors, ensuring we continue to deliver excellence for our clients and communities. You’ll bring:10+ years’ experience in project/design management, ideally in civil infrastructure, energy, or water sectorsProven ability to manage multidisciplinary teams and deliver complex projectsStrong stakeholder engagement, contract and financial management skillsA bachelor’s degree in engineering (or equivalent)Experience in a design-centric consulting environmentExcellent communication and report writing skillsFamiliarity with project management tools (e.g. MS Project, Primavera) and strong Excel capabilityPMP or similar project management qualification (or interest in pursuing one)Ngā Hua | What We OfferExposure to a wide range of projects, from large-scale to community-focused initiativesA supportive team culture that values autonomy, mastery, and purposeProfessional memberships and continued education supportInternal training and mentoring programmes$750 annual wellbeing allowance and wellbeing programmeA vibrant social club and inclusive workplace cultureMō Tō Mātou Āhuatanga | Who We AreTonkin + Taylor is New Zealand’s leading engineering and environmental consultancy, known for solving complex challenges with technical excellence. jobs.title: Centre Manager
jobs.description: Centre ManagerWe are looking for an extraordinary person to lead our team of highly skilled teachers. This role will give you the opportunity to utilise your outstanding leadership skills! About you:As a passionate and experienced leader, you will wear many hats to allow you to manage in an ever-evolving environment and be adaptable to meet a variety of needs. You will have a strong “on the floor” presence, providing mentoring and role modelling of exceptional teaching practice to the team.Role Requirements:B Ed/Dip Teaching Level 7 (ECE) and current teacher registration/certification.Demonstrated leadership experience you will love to coach, mentor and inspire!Initiative, desire and passion for quality practice standards and commitment to the principles of Te Whāriki.Familiarity with the New Zealand Education Council, ERO, MOE requirements, Licensing Criteria, 2008 Regulations and Code of Ethics.A comprehensive understanding of how to maintain and grow occupancy levels.Innovative, resilient, committed, passionate and enthusiastic!Why work for us?We offer an exceptionally competitive salary package! This includes a competitive pay rate, a performance related bonus, subsidised childcare, First Aid Certification, Flu vaccination and financial support to maintain full registration plus a generous time out of ratio to enable you to coach and mentor your team and attend to operational and compliance requirements. You will have the opportunity to be a part of an innovative service and grow professionally with plenty of ongoing professional development and mentoring! This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced ECE specialist with exceptional leadership qualities, so do not hesitate APPLY NOW with your CV and cover letter! Please note: Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.We are an Accredited employer.Lead with purpose…. Inspire with passion …. Make a lasting impact Are you an inspiring leader with a passion for ECE? We are looking for an extraordinary person to lead and empower our team of highly skilled teachers at Busy Bees Grandview.About usOur centre features three classrooms specifically designed for different age groups, fostering Tuakana/teina relationships and engaged tamariki. Our focus is empowering tamariki to direct their learning while ensuring they feel supported and safe. We offer diverse open-ended and natural resources to encourage teachable moments and create happy, learning-focused experiences.As the Centre Manager of Busy Bees Grandview, you will have access to an excellent support network within the group, along with a Regional Manager who is committed to coaching and developing your success. We value Professional Development for all our teachers and are committed to upskilling and growing your professional development.About you:As a Centre Manager you will lead with heart and purpose – supporting and guiding a team of passionate teachers. As well as being responsible for creating solid community relationships, compliance management, mentoring and driving exceptional standards of teaching, you will be an integral part of making decisions which will drive the future focus for the centre, both in terms of environment and education. Role Requirements:An inspirational leader with an innate ability to develop and lead a team to deliver best practice childcare servicesB Ed/Dip Teaching Level 7 (ECE) and current teacher registration/certificationDemonstrated leadership experience you will love to coach, mentor and inspire!Initiative, desire and passion for quality practice standards and commitment to the principles of Te WhārikiFamiliarity with the New Zealand Education Council, ERO, MOE requirements, Licensing Criteria, 2008 Regulations and Code of EthicsA comprehensive understanding of how to maintain and grow occupancy levelsWhy choose Busy Bees?Full Pay Parity, subsidised childcare, First Aid Certification and Flu vaccinationOngoing professional development and mentoringLeadership development course to grow new leadersA generous time out of ratio to enable you to coach and mentor your teamA companywide commitment to employee wellbeing with access to EAP ServicesApply now with your CV and Cover Letter and be part of our journey to deliver the best possible childcare services to our community.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.We are an Accredited EmployerWhy Work for Busy Bees?If you’re passionate about early learning, Busy Bees is the place to be. Although we are part of a global organisation, our company was founded by three families looking for better, more enriching childcare. Three decades later, we still keep the same values at heart.We know that we couldn’t do what we do without the important people in our teams. We invest in our people and work with them to build career pathways that inspire.

jobs.title: Health Care Assistant
jobs.description: Support student wellbeing in a welcoming, dynamic environmentPart-time role covering fixed-term parental leave at HillcrestGain hands-on experience in clinical and administrative duties Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleIn this role, you’ll play a key part in supporting the wellbeing of our student community. Working under the guidance of the Clinical Nurse Manager, you’ll carry out a variety of administrative and clinical duties that keep our service running smoothly and ensure students receive timely, high-quality care.You’ll work closely with our healthcare team, assisting with assessments, providing health promotion support, and helping create a safe, welcoming environment for every student who walks through our doors.As one of the first points of contact, you’ll deliver warm, professional customer service—making sure students feel understood, supported, and confident in the care they receive from Student Health.If you're compassionate, organised, and committed to making a positive impact on student wellbeing, we’d love to hear from you.The salary for this role ranges from $56,343.75 to $65,960.62 per year (pro-rata) depending on the skills, knowledge, and experience you bring to the position. This is a part-time role (20 hours per week) on a fixed-term basis, ideally starting in February 2026 and continuing through to December 2026 to cover parental leave. The role will be based at our Hillcrest Campus.For more information on the role please see the position description. For a confidential conversation about the role, please contact Jo Thomas, Clinical Nurse Manager, jo.thomas@waikato.ac.nz. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You’re a compassionate, organised individual with strong communication skills and a genuine interest in supporting student wellbeing. You’re confident working both independently and as part of a busy, multidisciplinary team, and you bring a positive, solution-focused attitude to everything you do. You have a good general education (NCEA Level 2 or equivalent), are comfortable using Microsoft Office, and are willing to learn new systems and skills—phlebotomy included. Experience in primary care, general practice, or community health is an advantage, as are First Aid, CPR, or other relevant health qualifications.You work well with young people, value cultural awareness, and can relate to students from diverse backgrounds with sensitivity and respect. You stay organised under pressure, manage competing priorities, and contribute to a collaborative, flexible, and inclusive team culture. An interest in youth or women’s health, and knowledge of Te Reo, Tikanga, or additional languages, will help you thrive in this role and make a meaningful impact on our student community.Don’t meet every single requirement?Research shows that some people are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. At The University of Waikato, we’re committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and genuine workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t perfectly match every listed qualification, we still encourage you to apply. You might be just the right person for this or another opportunity on our team. Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? Student Services provides high quality integrated services that foster engagement, promote wellbeing and support students in achieving their academic goals. The work of the Division comprises the following student services: student recruitment, administrative processes from enrolment through to graduation, enquiry management, pastoral care, international student services, health, accommodation, counselling, disabilities support, career development services, sport and wellbeing, student surveys and student complaints and appeals.The Director of Student Services is responsible for the overall management of the Division, with assistance from a team of Associate Directors including the Associate Director Student Health.The University Health Service provides high quality, accessible health and wellbeing care to students. The integrated, multidisciplinary team supports the educational process by modifying or removing health-related barriers to personal development and learning.Student Services Mission - To enable student success and wellbeing through collaboration, innovation and high-quality integrated services.He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! jobs.title: Technical Officer in Health Science
jobs.description: Diverse client-facing role supporting Head/s of School, staff and students.Are you a go-getter, a quick learner, eager to proactively solve problems, with a friendly personality and excellent computer skills?Join the Division of Health and be part of the team that is committed to addressing health inequities and preventable diseases, with a particular focus on improving Māori and Pacific health outcomes. Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleAs a Technical Officer in the Division of Health, you’ll deliver high-quality technical support that underpins our teaching and research in Health Science from applied sciences and clinical skills to simulation and cutting-edge digital technologies. Your expertise will help bring learning to life, ensuring our students gain the practical, hands-on experience they need to excel.You’ll be part of a collaborative team of Technical Officers, each with specialist skills, working together to support the Division’s professional health programmes. While you’ll have your own focus area, you’ll also share knowledge and responsibilities across the team, particularly with colleagues in clinical and applied sciences, ensuring our staff and students receive seamless, expert support at every stage.Salary will be in the range of $71,275 to $84,695 per year based on skills, knowledge and experience brought to the position. This is a full-time role (37.5 hours a week), based on our Hillcrest Campus.For more information on the role please see the position description. For a confidential conversation about the role, please contact Emma Woutersen, Division Director, emma.woutersen@waikato.ac.nz . All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You are an experienced and hands-on technical professional with a strong background in a scientific/ health science laboratory-based environment. You have a proven track record in operating and maintaining laboratory instruments, equipment, reagents etc. Additional experience in handling and operating simulation manikins, VR technologies and basic AV/IT equipment and devices would be ideal. Your expertise extends to planning and coordinating teaching and research activities with a strong emphasis on health and safety. You are highly skilled in troubleshooting, problem-solving, and contributing to the development of new resources, with excellent written and oral communication abilities, advanced ICT skills, and strong analytical and data management capabilities. You are highly organised and capable of leading multiple small to medium projects simultaneously, managing complex workloads and prioritising tasks effectively. Flexibility with timing to accommodate varying lab schedules is important for this role. Your experience includes project coordination, inventory tracking, arranging servicing, and raising purchase requests. You possess knowledge of health and safety requirements, ideally with experience in tertiary academic or healthcare settings, and hold a full New Zealand driver’s licence (or equivalent). A relevant tertiary qualification is essential, and a Master’s qualification or scientific instrument servicing experience is highly desirable.Don’t meet every single requirement?Research shows that some people are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. At The University of Waikato, we’re committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and genuine workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t perfectly match every listed qualification, we still encourage you to apply. You might be just the right person for this or another opportunity on our team.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The Division of Health undertakes research and teaching to achieve better, fairer health outcomes in Aotearoa. Currently, it offers programmes in Biomedical Sciences, Health Promotion, Healthy Active Living, Human Performance Science, Midwifery, Clinical, Pharmacy and Sport Development and Coaching. Future plans include establishing graduate-entry programmes in Medicine, Occupational Therapy and Physiotherapy. The Division of Health is committed to addressing health inequities and preventable diseases, with a particular focus on improving Māori and Pacific health outcomes. jobs.description: At NZCL, we are dedicated to support people with disabilities in New Zealand. Our Disability Support Services reflect our belief that all people deserve to live fully, have equal opportunities, and achieve their ambitions. jobs.title: Grounds Person
jobs.description: About PragmaPragma is a proudly family-run company, committed to delivering high-quality, well-planned, and affordable developments. As locals ourselves, we care deeply about the communities we help build — and that commitment is reflected in how we work with our clients, partners, and team.We’re growing and looking for a skilled Grounds person to join our team in construction projects across the Waikato. From residential properties to commercial projects, you will be responsible for ensuring that lawns, gardens, and landscapes are well-maintained, safe, and visually appealing. presented to a high level.Key Responsibilities· Operate and maintain various landscaping equipment, including lawnmowers (Ride-on and push), line trimmers, small Chainsaws, and edgers.· Perform regular lawn mowing, edging, and weeding to maintain the appearance of outdoor spaces in all season environments.· Carry out proper watering, fertilizing, and pest control measures to promote healthy jobs.title: Clinical Academic Nursing
jobs.description: Multiple roles with flexible hours across campuses Shops and food outletsDiscounted gym membership Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleWe are seeking passionate and experienced Registered Nurses to contribute to the education, mentoring, and pastoral care of students in our nursing programmes. These roles offer the opportunity to maintain clinical currency through structured practice, while fostering a seamless integration between clinical expertise and academic learning. Successful candidates will ensure students receive education grounded in contemporary clinical realities, preparing them for a rewarding career in healthcare.Multiple positions are available, offering flexibility in hours of work, across our campuses.The salary for this position ranges from $114,025 to $121,444 per annum (pro-rata), depending on the skills, knowledge, and experience the successful candidate brings to the role. These part-time positions range from 0.6 to 0.9 FTE (22.5–33.75 hours per week) and will be negotiated with each applicant. Placement requirements will be aligned to teaching responsibilities. This role will be based at either Hamilton or Tauranga Campus.For more information on the role please see the position description. For a confidential conversation about the role, please contact Jewel Barlow-Armstrong, Student Experience and Clinical Learning Lead, jewel.barlow-armstrong@waikato.ac.nz. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You are an experienced and dedicated Registered Nurse with NZ registration and a current practicing certificate. You will have a Postgraduate Diploma in Nursing or are working towards this. You bring extensive clinical experience and a strong record in teaching and clinical supervision, with expertise in areas such as Primary Health, Māori and Pacific Health, Mental Health, or Acute Care. You are confident in communicating effectively with students and staff, contributing to programme administration, and applying ICT and innovative teaching methods to support learning.You are a collaborative, proactive, and professional team member who can work autonomously, thrives under pressure and responds sensitively to diverse student and staff needs. You are committed to academic and clinical excellence, support equal opportunity, and will uphold the University’s partnership with Māori, guided by Te Tiriti o Waitangi. You are motivated to inspire the next generation of health professionals while maintaining your own clinical currency.Don’t meet every single requirement?Research shows that some people are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. At the University of Waikato, we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and genuine workplace. So, if you are excited about this role but your experience doesn’t perfectly match every listed qualification, we still encourage you to apply. You might be just the right person for this or for another opportunity in our team.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The Division of Health is committed to addressing health inequities and preventable conditions, with a particular focus on improving outcomes for Māori and Pacific communities. It advances equitable health outcomes across Aotearoa through innovative research and high-quality teaching in Biomedical Sciences, Health Promotion, Healthy Active Living, Human Performance Science, Midwifery, Nursing, Pharmacy, and Sport Development and Coaching. In 2028, the Division of Health will welcome the inaugural cohort of students to the New Zealand Graduate School of Medicine (NZGSM).He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. E herea ana te Whare Wānanga ki te kaupapa kia whakaratohia te mea angitū ōrite ki ngā tāngata katoa.Applications Close on Tuesday 25th November 2025Requisition number: 1003131#LI-DNI

jobs.description: First business school in New Zealand to achieve the prestigious Triple Crown AccreditationExcellent personal and professional development opportunities Up to 6.75% superannuation scheme + generous leave entitlements Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleBased on our Hamilton campus, you will produce high-quality research in your specialist area of supply chain management or logistics, actively engaging with colleagues across the Division and the wider academic community to communicate the impact of your work. It is a member of an elite group of global business skills that have earned Triple Crown status – an international acknowledgement of excellence in business education. jobs.title: Casual Relief Teacher / Teacher Aid
jobs.description: Improving the holistic wellbeing of Pasifika Communities in New ZealandK’aute Pasifika Trust works with local communities towards a shared vision of improved health and wellbeing. We’re a charitable trust based in Kirikiriroa/Hamilton providing health, education, employment and social services to Pasifika communities, and all other ethnicities who wish to access our services. We have a strong 24-year history of supporting people and their families to make meaningful changes that benefit their health and wellbeing, and helping create the kind of connected community we all want to be part of.Our Early Learning Centre was created to provide meaningful learning environments that empower the wellbeing of our fanau. Our inclusive environment is rich in Pasifika language, culture, identity and Christianity to ensure children develop a sense of security and belonging.We have a fantastic opportunity at Early Learning Centre for Casual Relief Teachers/Teacher Aids to join our Kāinga/family. In this role, you will support our Registered Faiaoga/Teachers to deliver programmes and activities tailored specifically to the needs of our fanau by:Assisting with one to one or small group learning activitiesProviding personal care for babies and children from 0 – 5 years of ageSupporting with extra activities to promote children’s learning development and health and wellbeingHelping create and execute daily lesson plansYou will be supporting the delivery of a high-quality Pasifika educational programme designed to provide a meaningful learning environment that empowers and grows our fanau.The ideal candidates will be enthusiastic about education, be open minded and able to motivate children. The ability to speak a Pasifika language fluently would be advantageous but not essential.To be considered for this role, the following is a must:Experience working within an early learning centre environmentHave the proven ability to communicate clearly and work with children and adults from a range of backgrounds and culturesBe able to provide a clear Police Vetting and Ministry of Justice reportConfident and culturally competent in Pasifika settingsFlexible and adaptive to change and improvementBe able to work well in a teamExcellent time management skillsBe communicative and work well in a team environmentFull Class 1 Driver’s licence or reliable transportIf you are looking to make a difference in your community, click on the APPLY button now - We can’t wait to welcome you to our village!How to applyAll applications must be submitted online by clicking the APPLY button above. Please ensure that you include an updated CV and a cover letter that outlines why you believe you are the ideal candidate for this position.We offer a supportive working environment that encourages and supports your fakalakalaka kihe kahau (future prosperity). We're an equal opportunity employer and are committed to the principle of equal opportunity for all.

jobs.title: Retail Assistant
jobs.description: Experienced Retail Assistant - Lingerie DepartmentRostered Hours:Tuesday 11:00am - 5:00pmWednesday 11:00am - 5:30pmThursday 10:00am - 6:00pmFriday 10:00am - 6:00pmSaturday 10:00am - 5:30pmAt New Zealand's leading department store, we understand the value of delivering exceptional service that goes above and beyond for our loyal customers.We're currently on the lookout for a dedicated Retail Assistant with a strong focus on merchandising to join our The Base team. If you have 3-4 years of experience in personalised retail sales, and a passion for creating an outstanding in-store experience, we want to hear from you!What does a day-to-day look like?In this role, you'll combine your merchandising skills with exceptional customer service by:Presenting our product ranges attractively and professionally to inspire and engage customersSetting up in-store promotions accurately and on schedule, ensuring offers are clear and compellingImplementing new season plans, making sure merchandise flows logically and draws customer attentionAs a service and selling expert, your role will also include:Providing personalised service, consulting with customers to understand and meet their unique needsAdvising across multiple departments, drawing on your wide product knowledge and experienceCoaching new team members, leading by example to uphold high service standardsWhat will you bring to the role?To succeed in this role, you'll bring:3-4 years of experience in a personalised retail service and sales roleA background in in-store styling or personal shoppingProven ability to set up promotions and implement new season adjacency plansA solid understanding of visual merchandising principlesA positive, energetic attitude and flexibility to thrive in a fast-paced retail environmentIf you're passionate about retail, enjoy making an impact through visual merchandising, and love helping customers find exactly what they need, apply now to become part of our trusted and dynamic team!Entitlement to work in New ZealandIn accordance with the Immigration Act 2009, you will be asked to provide evidence of your entitlement to work in New Zealand during the selection process. jobs.title: Project Coordinator - Commercial Paint Business
jobs.description: About The Opportunity A fantastic opportunity exists for a Project Coordinator to join our commercial painting team in Hamilton. This integral role is responsible for managing operational activities on the job, including safety, contractors, compliance, and profitable project delivery. This role will be responsible for developing, establishing and maintaining the project management framework and ensuring that it is complied with by the team. This integral role will provide you with the opportunity to join our supportive and collaborative team that delivers commercial painting projects to high-profile clients. Nature of the position: Permanent, Full Time Location: HamiltonSalary: $75,000 + Fully maintained work vehicle.BenefitsVehicle, tools of the trade, and PPE: Enjoy a fully maintained company vehicle, all the necessary tools and equipment, and comprehensive personal protective equipment (PPE) provided.Exclusive employee perks: Access discounts and benefits with over 600 retailers.Investment in you: We're passionate about personal and professional growth, offering access to certificates, webinars, mentorship, and practical training to help you thrive in your career.Your well-being, our priority: Strong safety culture, generous paid parental leave and access to our Employee Assistance Program, including tailored well-being initiatives designed to support your personal and family needs. Key Responsibilities Manage a variety of commercial paint and washing projects.Organize timely provision of project services to meet safety, timeframes, budget and quality requirements. Organise and plan subcontractors and internal labour for the projectsArrange all materials and equipment for siteMonitor associated key performance indicators. Manage client expectations through frequent, accurate and timely updates, and resolve operational issues in a timely manner. Follow company processes and procedures for working with contractors and assist in ensuring that all subcontractors have the necessary knowledge, skills and competencies to deliver the operational requirements in line with Programmed HSE policies and procedures. Ensures the safety of all people on our sites through our HSEQ policies and procedures. About You To be successful in this role, ideally, you will have experience in managing site-based teams and be driven to deliver exceptional results. Additionally, you will demonstrate and possess the following:Current Driver’s License First-class stakeholder engagement and customer service skills Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written Competencies in the use of excel, word and outlook. A strong commitment to the safety of yourself and others Cultural alignment with our core values: Safety Leadership, Care & Empathy, Customer Service, and Diversity, Inclusion & Equality About Us Programmed Property Services is a leading provider of painting, signage and open space maintenance services across a multitude of industries. Working with Programmed Property Services means you will become part of the Programmed team: a company that encourages career development, supports flexibility and cares about your personal well-being and safety. Work With Us Join us on our mission to build outstanding people, strong customers and great communities. Apply today. Our Commitment Programmed and PERSOL supports a workplace culture of zero harm and encourages this in all that we do. Programmed and PERSOL strives for diversity, inclusion and equality of our people. We seek a workforce that is representative of the communities we work in. We encourage people of all cultures, genders, age, sexual orientation or abilities to apply. To learn more about working with Programmed and PERSOL, we encourage you to visit our website.

jobs.title: Forklift Diesel Mechanic
jobs.description: Job reference - 1120271Work on a modern fleet of forkliftsHigh hourly rates per hour plus company vehicle and ongoing development opportunitiesMix of workshop and field based dutiesAccess 34 years of our client relationships and connections and find your next job. New Zealand's leaders in motor industry recruitment since 1991. Automotive Employment NZ has been awarded Sourcr Automotive Agency of the Year for the second year in a row (2024-2025).About the employerThis established, forward-thinking leader in heavy equipment operations is renowned for its commitment to innovation and employee growth. With a modern fleet of late-model machinery and a clear expansion strategy, this company offers stability in a sector poised for continued success.What truly sets them apart is their collaborative culture and a shared drive to gain forward momentum for growth, uniquely positioning themselves for the projected upturn that will soon be self-evident.The roleBased out of the Hamilton workshop, your duties will be split between workshop and on-site field service. You'll tackle complex repairs and maintenance across a range of internal combustion (IC) forklifts and heavy machinery.Your expertise in diagnostics, electrical systems, and hydraulics will ensure minimal downtime for clients, while your ability to work autonomously will make you a trusted problem-solver.This is a permanent, full time role offering a minimum of 40 hours per week.Duties will include:Diagnose and repair electrical, hydraulic, and mechanical faults in IC diesel forkliftsPerform routine servicing, including engine overhauls, brake systems, and transmission repairsTroubleshoot advanced control systems, wiring, and battery-powered componentsConduct safety inspections and ensure compliance with NZ regulatory standardsManage parts inventory, source components, and liaise with suppliersProvide clear technical advice to clients and maintain detailed service recordsMentor junior technicians and contribute to team knowledge-sharingSkills soughtA relevant trade qualification (NZQF Level 4 or equivalent) in Automotive Engineering, Heavy Mechanics, or related field3+ years of experience maintaining and repairing IC diesel forklifts or similar heavy machineryStrong electrical aptitude: the ability to interpret schematics and diagnose CAN-bus systemsExpertise in hydraulic systems (pumps, valves, cylinders) and diesel engine diagnosticsCurrent full driver's licence (Class 1 minimum; Class 2 or 4 advantageous)Certifications in OSH/WHS or forklift operation (desirable)A proactive mindset with meticulous attention to safety protocolsHow to applyClick the apply section of this ad.All applications are welcome, including those from local, national, and international candidates. If you are based offshore and want to move to New Zealand, our in-house licensed immigration advisers are able to assist you with your visa requirements, subject to eligibility and skills, making the process easy and seamless.For more information, contact the team at Automotive Employment NZ Ltd for a confidential discussion. Phone during NZ business hours: Freephone 0800 67 57 47 from landline and mobile. The international landline is +64 9 271 3200You can also visit the job board on our website to view further vacancies www.automotiveemployment.co.nz/jobsJobcorp owned companies include Jobcorp NZ Ltd, Jobcorp Immigration, and Automotive Employment NZ. Our company has business interests in recruitment, the provision of immigration advice, and the provision of employment relations advice.We partner with organisations committed to inclusive workplaces, where every individual is valued and respected.

jobs.title: ECE Unregistered Teacher
jobs.description: Do you love working with children and watching them grow? Whether you are just starting out in Early Childhood or looking for a fresh change, we’ve got a role for you!We are looking for an Unregistered Teacher to join our team at Busy Bees Grandview. This is a fixed term role with an immediate start for 6 months to help cover an increase in roll growth.Dive into the wonderful world of ECE with us and make a positive impact on the lives of our tamariki, nurturing their love for learning and creativity every step of the way. This is the perfect opportunity to build a meaningful career and inspire our future generation!About us:At Busy Bees Grandview Road in Nawton, Hamilton, we embrace the beauty of diversity and proudly celebrate the richness of our multicultural community. Our inclusive environment honours every child’s unique background, helping them feel seen, heard, and deeply valued.We are guided by the principles of tuakana-teina—a traditional Māori concept of reciprocal learning between older and younger peers—and whanaungatanga, which emphasises building meaningful relationships through shared experiences and connection. These values shape a warm, supportive space where tamariki thrive in a sense of belonging.About you:Previous experience in an ECE environment would be a definite advantage although candidates who are great at communicating, friendly, approachable and who are passionate about nurturing and caring for the needs of our tamariki should also consider applying. You will be supporting a professional team of teachers in a fun, positive and rewarding environment.As a valued teacher at Busy Bees, you will be provided with:Discounted childcareAnnual flu vaccinationUniformA monthly staff wellbeing budget and access to EAP servicesComprehensive induction and ongoing mentoringA highly skilled and supportive team to work alongside!This is a fantastic opportunity to put theory into practice and to join a wonderful team! Apply now with your CV and Cover letter and join the whanau who know how to support great people!Please note: Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. Why Work for Busy Bees?If you’re passionate about early learning, Busy Bees is the place to be. Although we are part of a global organisation, our company was founded by three families looking for better, more enriching childcare. Three decades later, we still keep the same values at heart.We know that we couldn’t do what we do without the important people in our teams. We invest in our people and work with them to build career pathways that inspire.

jobs.title: ECE Registered Teacher
jobs.description: We are on the lookout for a Registered Teacher to complete our team of amazing kaiako! Get ready to inspire, nurture, and get creative with our tamariki, creating new and exciting learning adventures!About usWelcome to Busy Bees Grandview Road, we love to have quiet, peaceful, beautiful environments, a space where children feel calm and nurtured. We love to surround our children with beautiful things. We take great pride in providing a safe and empowering environment for tamariki to learn and grow. Our centre features three classrooms specifically designed for different age groups, fostering Tuakana/teina relationships and engaged tamariki. Our focus is empowering tamariki to direct their learning while ensuring they feel supported and safe. We offer diverse open-ended and natural resources to encourage teachable moments and create happy, learning-focused experiences.What we’re looking for:An ECE or Primary teacher qualification and registration as an ECE teacher in New ZealandGenuine care and love for the well-being and development of tamarikiA personality that fosters and develops strong relationships with staff and parents/whānauAbundant reserves of enthusiasm and energyCompetency in planning, curriculum, and regular and emergent reviewsThe ability to build and maintain responsive relationships with children and their whānauAs part of the Busy Bees team, you can look forward to receiving:Full Pay Parity!Discounted childcareFirst aid certification, annual flu vaccines and staff uniformsA generous PLD budget where you can choose PLD for your own learning.Comprehensive induction, mentoring and coaching and ongoing opportunities for career growth and personal and professional developmentWe would love to hear from you so do not hesitate, apply now send by sending through your CV and cover letter today!Please note: Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa. We are an Accredited EmployerWhy Work for Busy Bees?If you’re passionate about early learning, Busy Bees is the place to be. Although we are part of a global organisation, our company was founded by three families looking for better, more enriching childcare. Three decades later, we still keep the same values at heart.We know that we couldn’t do what we do without the important people in our teams. We invest in our people and work with them to build career pathways that inspire.

jobs.title: Senior Administrator

The role is focused on working and supporting a multi-disciplinary team who support the newly formed School Attendance Services.This is a permanent, full time (40 hours per week) role, based in Hamilton.Excellent communication and organisational skills are key to this role. You’ll also need resilience, flexibility and the ability to build strong relationships across the team both onsite and across the wider organisation.To undertake this role you will need to be comfortable working with Microsoft Office suite. You will be responsible for the office admin needs of the attendance services, ensuring effective administration systems and practices are implemented and maintained. In addition, you will support the management of contractors and support the leaders with tasks relating to payroll. Skills and experienceYou will be a well-organised and efficient Administrator excited about making a difference for rangatahi. keen eye for detail and the ability to manage multiple tasks with competing deadlinesGreat communication skills, both verbal and writtenExperience in the co-ordination and management of contractorsConfidence using Microsoft Office products, including ExcelWhy Choose Barnardos?Be at the forefront of trauma-responsive youth care in New Zealand, contributing to groundbreaking programsJoin a respected NGO with over 55 years of impact in child welfare and advocacyAccess ongoing professional development opportunities, including specialized training in trauma-informed practices and the latest youth care methodologiesSWRB fees covered, supporting your continued professional registrationEnjoy family-friendly policies, including flexible work arrangements where possibleBenefit from discounted childcare at Barnardos Early Learning centersCompetitive salary commensurate with experience and qualificationsSupportive team environment with regular supervision and careKaikōkiritanga (Innovation): Drive positive change with creativity, constantly seeking new and effective ways to support tamariki and rangatahiĀta Whakarongo (Active Listening): Let tamariki and jobs.title: Driver Operator - Class 5

jobs.title: Systems Analyst
jobs.description: Make it happen in a role that matters.About UsRiverlea Group is a proud New Zealand, family-owned manufacturer and distributor of high-quality brands. Since 1992, we’ve been designing, building, and delivering trusted products from our custom-built site in Hamilton. From our industry-leading Armorsteel® cladding systems to our garden sheds, wheelbarrows, and lifestyle ranges — we’re known for quality, reliability, and down-to-earth service.Behind it all are our people — positive, passionate, and driven to deliver great outcomes. We work hard, have fun, and genuinely care about each other and our customers. Our values guide everything we do.We’re growing fast, and with that comes exciting opportunities to strengthen how we work. This newly created role is one of them.About the RoleAs our Systems Analyst, you’ll play a key part in maintaining, optimising, and advancing Riverlea Group’s operational systems — with a focus on NetSuite and its connected platforms. You’ll help keep our procurement, logistics, admin, and operations systems running smoothly and continuously improving.You’ll work across teams to:Manage and support integrations with systems such as Navbridge, Dispatch Track, and 3PL logistics.Champion NetSuite best practices, ensuring data accuracy, access control, and process consistency.Build and refine reports, dashboards, and analytics that give our people the insights they need.Support and improve product master data, procurement processes, and workflow automation.Identify and implement system and process improvements that drive efficiency and reliability.This role is ideal for someone who enjoys connecting technology with real business outcomes — someone who loves to solve problems, streamline processes, and help people work smarter.What You’ll BringWe’re looking for someone who:Has experience working with NetSuite (or similar ERP systems) in a systems, admin, or analyst role.Understands how technology supports supply chain, manufacturing, or logistics operations.Is analytical, detail-focused, and process-driven, with a natural curiosity for improving systems and workflows.Builds relationships quickly, enjoys engaging with people across teams, and thrives in a collaborative, hands-on environment.Is social and approachable, enjoys being part of a fun, supportive team, and genuinely cares about making things better for others.Communicates clearly, collaborates easily, and isn’t afraid to suggest or test new ideas.Why You’ll Love It HereAt Riverlea Group, we know that great systems and great people go hand in hand. When you join us, you’ll be part of a team that celebrates wins, supports growth, and believes in rewarding effort:GBS profit share – where everyone shares in our success.Employee discounts at selected stores.Volunteer Programme – giving back to our community.Value Champions – recognising team members who live our values every day.If you’re ready to make an impact, keep improving, and join a team that cares — we want to hear from you.Apply now with your CV and cover letter showing your best.

jobs.title: Experienced Fitness Trainer - Special Populations
jobs.description: Great team vibe + supportive cultureDynamic, vibrant campus environmentInclusive Sport and Wellbeing community Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleWe’re looking for a motivated Experienced Fitness Trainer to deliver exceptional fitness experiences at UniRec. In this role, you’ll engage with members, design tailored exercise programmes, and ensure a safe, supportive, and inspiring gym environment.You’ll lead the exercise prescription for our LifeFit (functional ageing and seniors) and WellFit (mental and physical wellbeing) programmes, driving their development, delivery, and impact. As a senior team member, you’ll also mentor Fitness Trainers and contribute to new fitness initiatives that grow and enhance our offerings.If you’re passionate about helping others achieve their best and want to make a real difference in our fitness community, we’d love to hear from you.Salary will be based on skills, knowledge and experience brought to the position. This is a part-time role, mornings (20-30 hours a week, with flexibility to work weekends and evenings if required), based on our Hillcrest Campus. For more information on the role please see the position description. For a confidential conversation about the role, please contact Georgia Tong, Health and Fitness Manager, georgia.tong@waikato.ac.nz. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You’re a qualified and experienced fitness professional with a passion for helping others thrive. With a degree in Sport or Exercise Science and strong knowledge of safe, effective training practices, you bring expertise in supporting older adults, students who require extra support, and those with health or wellbeing goals.You’re an excellent communicator who builds trust easily, leads with empathy, and thrives in a collaborative, high-energy environment. Motivated, adaptable, and client-focused, you’re committed to fostering inclusion, wellbeing, and continuous growth - for yourself, our team, and our UniRec community.Don’t meet every single requirement?Research shows that some people are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. At The University of Waikato, we’re committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and genuine workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t perfectly match every listed qualification, we still encourage you to apply. You might be just the right person for this or another opportunity on our team.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The Sport and Wellbeing Group develop and manage high quality, relevant sport and wellbeing programmes and facilities that support students, staff and the wider community to be active and healthy, enhancing the University of Waikato experience. Sport and Wellbeing managed facilities and services include UniRec, Wellbeing Hub, Esport Arena, and university sports fields, events and clubs. The Group is part of the Office of the Vice-Chancellor, the university’s executive leadership office, and is led by the Associate Director, Sport and Wellbeing He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. E herea ana te Whare Wānanga ki te kaupapa kia whakaratohia te mea angitū ōrite ki ngā tāngata katoa.Applications Close on Sunday 23rd November 2025Requisition number: 1003078

jobs.title: Media Search Analyst
jobs.description: Ready to ditch the traditional 9-5 grind? If you are an English speaker living in New Zealand join our community as a Media Search Analyst, set your own flexible schedule and complete engaging tasks with an innovative web-based evaluation tool!What You’ll Do As A Media Search Analyst:Assess diverse media categories: music, books, podcasts, videos, and more.Evaluate app store content, ensuring search result accuracy and relevance.Utilize your cultural knowledge and market expertise to validate query intent.Why Join the AI Community?Be part of the global and diverse TELUS Digital AI Community with 1M+ global contributors.Support machine learning for world-leading brands with no prior professional experience.Make use of your communication and analytical skills and enjoy extra income with great flexibility!Basic Requirement and Assessment:Full Professional Proficiency in English and being a resident on New Zealand for the past year, aware of local media and trends.An active Apple ID email address is essential, ownership of an Apple device and familiarity with Apple products.Complete ID verification at your convenience within a specific timeframe and pass an open book qualification exam with guidelines provided.Join us today and help revolutionize digital media content!

jobs.title: Postie
jobs.description: We have a new and exciting opportunity to join our DX team as a Part-time Motorcycle Postie - ThamesHere's what you'll do… You will be the face of the company as you deliver mail from our depot across the Thames area. We also have employee rewards because we recognize our teams' dedication, commitment, and service. Then there's the fun stuff like barbeques, sports, and social gatherings.Come and join us… If you are an honest, motivated, hardworking person and want to meet new people, then don't miss this opportunity, Hit the Apply Now button!Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.DX Mail is committed to ensuring a safe and healthy work environment. Therefore, you will be required to pass a drug test and MOJ security check. We will require evidence at the pre-employment stage of our recruitment process.

jobs.title: Whānau Support Workers
jobs.description: Be part of the newly formed Attendance ServicesSupport tamariki to overcome barriersPermanent, full time opportunity in HamiltonWe’re looking for 8 compassionate Whānau Support Workers to join our Multi-disciplinary Team supporting the newly formed School Attendance Services.These are all permanent, full-time (40 hours per week) opportunities, based in Hamilton.In this role, you’ll work directly with tamariki and their whānau in schools, homes, and communities—building trusted relationships and taking a wellbeing-focused approach to address barriers to school attendance.Your ability to connect, empower, and uplift whānau aspirations will be key to success in this role.Your Role:Ensure the wellbeing and safety of Tamariki remains paramountImprove access to learningSupport the development of life skillsSupport intervention planning with goals for changeMaintain concise and up to date client informationParticipate in case management, assessment and planning meetingsDevelop and maintain supportive, trusting relationships with Tamariki and whānauWhat you’ll bring:NCEA Level 2 or NZQA level 2-3 (essential)Relevant qualification in Social Services, Education, Human Services and/or Health and Wellbeing (desirable)2+ years’ experience working with Tamariki/rangatahi with complex needs (essential)2+ years’ experience managing, resolving and diffusing complex situations (essential)Full, clean NZ drivers’ license (essential)A strengths-based, culturally responsive approachAbility to work collaboratively within a multi-disciplinary teamCultureThis work can sometimes be challenging. You will need resilience and a passion for working with youth, be flexible, have a positive attitude, and exhibit the ability to build strong professional relationships with young people, whanau/families, staff, and service providers. A comprehensive induction programme is undertaken with ongoing education, training, and support offered to all staff.Embody Our ValuesKotahitanga (Unity): Cultivate a sense of belonging through meaningful relationships with tamariki, rangatahi, colleagues, and the wider communityMahi Tōtika (Excellence): Demonstrate unwavering integrity and purpose in all aspects of your work, striving for the highest standards of careKaikōkiritanga (Innovation): Drive positive change with creativity, constantly seeking new and effective ways to support tamariki and rangatahiĀta Whakarongo (Active Listening): Let tamariki and rangatahi voices shape your approach, ensuring their perspectives are central to decision-makingMāiatanga (Empowerment): Nurture growth and unlock potential in tamariki, rangatahi, and colleagues, fostering a culture of continuous learning and developmentAbout Barnardos Aotearoa For over 55 years Barnardos has been shaping brighter futures together with children and families in Aotearoa. Apply now and let's transform young lives together!We will commence interviews as applications are received.

jobs.title: School of Science Administrator
jobs.description: Support leaders, staff, students, and visitors dailyBe a proactive problem-solver with great people skillsDo you have a passion for seeing students succeed? Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleProvide efficient and effective administrative and office support to ensure the smooth day-to-day running of the school by supporting the School Manager, Dean, Heads of programmes, staff and students, and visitors of the School of Science.This role is varied and exciting as your scope of work will range from being the friendly face that’s the first point of contact at the school office, supporting the coordination of the annual timetable of student-related academic processes, coordinating rooms and resources, assistance with staff travel requests, bookings and queries, assistance with purchasing and processing payments, contributing to organisation of key events, as well as being the seamless interface between the School and our Student Services team.Salary will be in the range of $71,275 to $84,695 per year based on skills, knowledge and experience brought to the position. This is a full-time role (37.5 hours a week), based on our Hillcrest Campus.For more information on the role please see the position description. For a confidential conversation about the role, please contact Klaus Reiter, School Manager, School of Science at klaus.reiter@waikato.ac.nz. All applications must be submitted through the online portal, emailed applications will not be accepted. Please note: Applications will be reviewed as they are received.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?If you love diversity and being busy, then this role is for you! Your friendly personality will shine as you will be the first point of contact in our school office. You will be able to showcase your excellent communication skills to build connections, and maintain constructive relationships to support our outreach activities, social media, and general administrative processes. You are confident, a fast and keen learner, eager to embrace new ways of doing things. You are proactive and not afraid to ask pertinent questions to help you navigate your role. You will have strong administration and computer skills and knowledge of Microsoft Office. Your communication skills and enthusiasm for supporting learners will be utilised in this role on a daily basis. Experience working in tertiary education could be an advantage but is not essential.Don’t meet every single requirement?Research shows that some people are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. At The University of Waikato, we’re committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and genuine workplace. So, if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t perfectly match every listed qualification, we still encourage you to apply. You might be just the right person for this or another opportunity on our team.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? Te Aka Mātuatua School of Science is a research-intensive school with teaching and research activities that cover a broad range of science disciplines. We are passionate about science and the difference that it can make to some of the biggest challenges facing Aotearoa and the world. With excellent facilities in Hamilton and Tauranga and staff who are genuinely world-class, we are driven in the pursuit of outstanding scientific teaching and research. Find out more about Te Aka Mātuatua School of Science here He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have the legal right to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. E herea ana te Whare Wānanga ki te kaupapa kia whakaratohia te mea angitū ōrite ki ngā tāngata katoa.Applications Close on Sunday 30th November 2025Requisition number: 1003101
