jobs.title: Fleet Manager
jobs.description: About UsAt Downer we plan, create and sustain. Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. Through trusted relationships and world leading insight we work closely with our customers to design, build and sustain assets, infrastructure, and facilities. About the TeamDowner’s Transport & Infrastructure business manages and maintains road networks across Australia and New Zealand, with civil and commercial construction in New Zealand. We are an integrated trans-Tasman team with a leading portfolio of products and services. By sharing our capabilities and insights across our regions we achieve the best technical solutions for our customers’ challenges, and for our communities.Job DescriptionTe kōwhiringa | The Opportunity Downer is an industry leader in fleet management, providing efficient solutions to our customers. Our dedicated and high performing team offers whole-of-life vehicle and mobile plant management, from procurement, lease management, and disposal, to scheduled and unscheduled servicing, maintenance, and defect management. As Fleet Manager you will use your effective management and strategic leadership to drive operational excellence within your delivery portfolio. You will form robust relationships with key (internal) customers and the wider Fleet team to promote Fleet services, ensure optimal performance of assets and return on investment.Key responsibilities include:Maximising fleet utilisation by providing informed advice and support to customersFostering a strong culture of safety and complianceCollaborating with Senior Management to align fleet operations with strategic goals and lead change initiativesDeveloping and maintaining strong stakeholder relationships through developing a deep understanding of the customer base and providing regular updates to Senior ManagementPerforming regular review of asset performance; identify improvement opportunities and manage maintenance schedules to minimise downtimeUsing Data insights for operational optimisation This is a key role within our Fleet Delivery team that services the Waikato region. Ideally you will be based in Hamilton to enable close working relationships with key internal stakeholders. Nga pūkenga matua | Important SkillsTo be successful in this role, you will have a high-level of people and project management experience, ideally in a fast-paced environment and working with multi-functional teams across the business. In-depth knowledge of fleet management principles, asset lifecycle management, and maintenance best practices will be advantageous. You will also have:Excellent relationship building skills with the ability to positively engage and influence peers and stakeholdersStrong technical aptitude with the ability to quickly learn new software and systemsDemonstrated experience in strategic planning, business development, and successfully implementing process improvementsA solid understanding of Health, Safety and Environmental regulations and best practicesStrong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and provide actionable insightsEffective communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to engage, influence and empower others Strong problem solving and decision-making skills, with a focus on delivering practical and innovative solutions The ability to travel and stay away from home as required Ko te take ka parekareka e koe ki te mahi ki kōnei | Why you will enjoy working hereDowner is committed to delivering excellence by ensuring our people have the environment and the means to be successful. We offer:Company vehicle and work phone included Free access to Marram health care reimbursements and discounted holiday homes Discounts for Samsung, PB Tech, Gym memberships and more!Progression and development programs on offer including our inspiring leader’s programme for top performersWant to know more about what it is like to work at Downer? Then head to our People Site here!Me pēhea ki te tono | How to apply If this sounds like the opportunity for you, click Apply Now to submit your application! The reference number for this role is 726582.We are committed to a safe working environment for everyone - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a pre-employment drug test, medical and a Ministry of Justice check prior to starting employment. If you need support with this requirement, please talk to our team.

jobs.title: Property Manager
jobs.description: About UsAt Downer we plan, create and sustain. Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. Through trusted relationships and world leading insight we work closely with our customers to design, build and sustain assets, infrastructure, and facilities. Job DescriptionWe currently have an opportunity for a Property Manager to join our Department of Corrections and the Ministry of Justice team and play a key role in our high performance Property Management team. Reporting to Senior Property Manager, you'll help deliver high-quality outcomes that support our essential services.Te Kōwhiringa | The Opportunity Downer holds a long-term Asset Management and Facilities Management contract with the Department of Corrections and the Ministry of Justice that proactively manages and delivers to the national portfolio of facilities including 15 prisons, 98 courts and 141 community correctional sites. The Property Manager oversees service delivery for a set portfolio of Ministry of Justice and Corrections Community Sites. They manage jobs from start to finish, supported by coordinators but ultimately accountable for performance. The role involves travel for site inspections, and due to a lower workload in this area, they may occasionally assist Property Managers in other regions.What You’ll Do This role offers a broad scope, with key responsibilities including:Promote Zero Harm by ensuring all work is delivered safely and aligns with Downer Values.Build and maintain strong customer relationships to foster trust and collaboration.Oversee job delivery to meet safety, quality, cost, and KPI targets, including managing contractors for maintenance and reactive work.Control job costs within budget and provide support to other property managers when required.Ensure site compliance with regulations such as BWOF and HSNO in a timely manner.Communicate effectively with clients, site staff, and subcontractors to ensure smooth operations and service delivery.Demonstrate technical and administrative capability, including basic knowledge of HVAC/electrical/plumbing/fire systems, familiarity with CAFM systems, and proficiency in preparing reports and quotations.Flexibility to work outside regular hours as operational needs or emergencies require.This is a fantastic role that will suit someone who is outcome-focused, enjoys a challenge, and is able to take initiative whilst building great relationships with our team and client.Nga pūkenga matua | Important SkillsOver 5 years’ management experience in the facilities industry.Strong analytical, numeric, and data interpretation skills to support evidence-based decision making.Skilled in driving operational performance, ensuring quality, timely delivery, and minimal rework.Effective at resource planning, scheduling, and meeting deadlines with strong ownership and commitment.Solid understanding of the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.Strong interpersonal, leadership, time management, and organisational skills; able to work both independently and in teams.Competent in MS Outlook, Word, and Excel at an intermediate level.NZ Full driver's license is required. More than anything, you’ll bring a strong work ethic, a positive attitude, and a commitment to delivering high-quality outcomes for our clients.Ko wai mātou | Our Organisation At Downer, we plan, create, and sustain essential public services across Australia and New Zealand. From hospitals to data centres and defence partnerships, we manage critical infrastructure that keeps communities thriving.Ko te take ka parekareka e koe ki te mahi ki kōnei | Why you will enjoy working hereWe’re proud of our high-performance culture and commitment to diversity, offering:Training and development to support and diversify your career. With 30% of vacancies filled internally you’ll find real opportunities to advance your career.Perks@Downer: healthcare discounts, great savings on retail purchases, car purchases and much more.Employee Assistance Program: professional support for you and your family when you need it most.A company car is provided as part of this role.You want your work to matter and so do we. With over 26,000 people across Australia, New Zealand and the Pacific, our team is made up of individuals with unique perspectives, backgrounds, and ideas.We know that diversity makes us stronger and we actively celebrate it through our commitment to inclusion and belonging.We’re committed to building a team that reflects the diverse communities we serve and we welcome people of all ages, genders, sexual orientations, cultures, abilities, and lived experiences. We especially encourage applications from those whose voices have traditionally been underrepresented in our industry, including women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, Māori and Pasifika Peoples, veterans, people with disability, and neurodivergent individuals. Even if your experience doesn’t align perfectly with this role, we’d still like to hear from you. If it feels like the right fit, apply - potential counts, and so do you.If you need support or adjustments through the recruitment process, just let us know, we’re here to help you put your best foot forward.Me pēhea ki te tono | How to applyClick "APPLY" and please include your CV and copies of relevant licenses/qualification. If you need support with this requirement, please talk to our team.

jobs.description: Te Whare Korowai Taangata o Kirikiriroa provides emergency and transitional housing for single adults in Hamilton. We operate 2 facilities on a 24/7 basis with support workers. jobs.description: About Us: You've probably seen our recognisable polar bear logo on trucks going from town to town across our beautiful country. About Us:McKenzie Centre, located in Hamilton, is a leading early intervention centre that supports children with developmental delays (birth to school age) and their whānau in the Waikato. We provide family-centred, play-based, trans-disciplinary services that help children reach their potential. Our team includes Speech-Language Therapists, Physio and Occupational Therapists, Early Intervention Teachers, Peer Support Workers, Psychologists, and Education Support Workers. We are an innovative, passionate team committed to empowering families and children to be the best they can be. About the Role:We are seeking qualified Early Intervention Teachers, or registered Primary or Early Childhood Education Teachers working towards their Post Graduate Diploma in Specialist Teaching, who are preferably experienced in early intervention and family-centred practice. As a member of our trans-disciplinary team, you will provide holistic support in areas such as child development, family advocacy, and community engagement. You will be involved in both individual and group interventions, working in the centre and community settings, utilising performance coaching and supportive strategies to enhance children’s learning outcomes. jobs.title: Foreign Buyer Adviser
jobs.description: About UsCHT Developments is a leading property development company, known for delivering high-quality residential and commercial projects with purpose and passion. We specialise in designing, planning, and building properties that combine innovation with lasting value. With strong expertise in property development and project delivery, we are now seeking a Foreign Buyer Adviser to join our dynamic team.________________________________________Key ResponsibilitiesAs a Foreign Buyer Adviser, you will play a central role in driving sales and managing client relationships, particularly with overseas buyers and investors. Your responsibilities will include:• Sales & Business Developmento Promote and sell company properties to both local and foreign buyers.o Develop and maintain strong relationships with real estate agencies, property managers, and key stakeholders.o Negotiate terms of sales and contracts, ensuring alignment with company objectives.o The primary objective will be to present offerings to foreign buyers with the best foot forward for New Zealand.• Client Relationship Managemento Advise international buyers on property opportunities, investment benefits, and purchase processes in New Zealand.o Provide guidance on property management, tenancy requirements, and related services.o Ensure a high level of client satisfaction through personalised service and clear communication.• Market Development & Strategyo Research market trends, competitor offerings, and buyer demographics to identify opportunities.o Assist in creating and executing sales strategies to expand into international markets.o Represent the company at property expos, trade shows, and investor meetings.• Coordination & Reportingo Work closely with internal teams to align sales strategies with development projects.o Reporting to the Employer and providing advice on foreign buyer requirements, expectations and how best to present the Employer’s offerings in a way which will be most favourable to prospective buyers.o Prepare regular sales forecasts, reports, and market analyses for management.o Cooperate in a timely and synergistic manner with both New Zealand team and off-shore teams.o Ensure compliance with property, sales, and consumer protection regulations in New Zealand.________________________________________Qualifications & Experience• A Bachelor’s degree or higher in Business, Property, Marketing, or a related field.• OR if no tertiary qualification, a minimum of 5 years’ relevant work experience in sales or advisory roles related to real estate, property management, or property investment.• Proven experience in sales management or buyer advisory, preferably in the property sector.• Strong understanding of real estate transactions, property regulations, and investment processes.• Excellent communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to engage both local and international clients.• Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, target-driven environment.• Multilingual ability (Mandarin, Cantonese, or other foreign languages) would be an advantage but not essential.________________________________________What We Offer• Competitive salary package plus performance-based incentives.• Professional development and career growth within a dynamic and expanding business.• A supportive team environment focused on excellence and innovation.________________________________________How to ApplyIf you are passionate about property and thrive in a sales-focused, client-facing role, we would love to hear from you.Please apply by submitting your CV and a cover letter outlining your experience and suitability for this position.

jobs.title: Intensive Wraparound Facilitator - Te Kahu Tōī
jobs.description: Are you autonomous practitioner?Can you progress plans toward a better outcome?Do you enjoy the challenge of complex situations?Barnardos and the Ministry of Education (MOE) deliver the Intensive Wraparound Service (IWS) which works with students who have complex behavioural needs (which may include behavioural impairment). You will be working with the student and family/whānau to engage them in the IWS process and support them and the IWS team to develop and monitor plans.This is a permanent full-time position (40 hours per week, Mon - Fri), based in Hamilton and will require travel so a full NZ drivers' license is essential. This role can be challenging but is also extremely rewarding and is a vital part of our work to make Aotearoa a better, safer, happier place for Tamariki. Your Role:To orient the students and family/ whānau to the wraparound process and provide co-ordination of key team members.Support the development of a plan with agreed outcomes for the family/whānau, and to monitor and record the progress of these outcomes.Develop and maintain strong and collaborative relationships with the family/ whānau, Ministry of Education Learning Support and other groups to ensure a coordinated wraparound service.Produce timely and accurate documentation to support the Intensive Wraparound Service’sWhat You'll Bring: A tertiary qualification in social work or other relevant qualification.Proven experience working with children, families/whānau and Māori and Pacific communities.To value diversity and encourage it in others, especially when working with children with high and complex needs and their families.The ability to work autonomously and manage competing priorities.Excellent communication, organisation and meeting facilitation skills.The ability to build strong professional relationships and champion the perspective of the student and their family through the IWS process.Resilience and a clear understanding of your own self-care needs and when to practice them.A clean, full NZ driver’s licence (travel across the region will be required).CultureThis work can sometimes be challenging. You will need resilience and a passion for working with youth, be flexible, have a positive attitude, and exhibit the ability to build strong professional relationships with young people, whanau/families, staff, and service providers. A comprehensive induction programme is undertaken with ongoing education, training, and support offered to all staff.Embody Our ValuesKotahitanga (Unity): Cultivate a sense of belonging through meaningful relationships with tamariki, rangatahi, colleagues, and the wider communityMahi Tōtika (Excellence): Demonstrate unwavering integrity and purpose in all aspects of your work, striving for the highest standards of careKaikōkiritanga (Innovation): Drive positive change with creativity, constantly seeking new and effective ways to support tamariki and rangatahiĀta Whakarongo (Active Listening): Let tamariki and rangatahi voices shape your approach, ensuring their perspectives are central to decision-makingMāiatanga (Empowerment): Nurture growth and unlock potential in tamariki, rangatahi, and colleagues, fostering a culture of continuous learning and developmentWhy Choose Barnardos?Be at the forefront of trauma-responsive youth care in New Zealand, contributing to groundbreaking programsJoin a respected NGO with over 55 years of impact in child welfare and advocacyAccess ongoing professional development opportunities, including specialized training in trauma-informed practices and the latest youth care methodologiesEnjoy family-friendly policies, including flexible work arrangements where possibleBenefit from discounted childcare at Barnardos Early Learning centersCompetitive salary commensurate with experience and qualificationsSupportive team environment with regular supervision and peer supportOpportunity to make a lasting difference in the lives of vulnerable young peopleAbout Barnardos: For over 55 years Barnardos has been shaping brighter futures together with children and families in Aotearoa. Our mahi across social services, early learning and advocacy for children’s rights and wellbeing means we're there for the whole childhood journey, and beyond.If you would like a copy of the position description or have any questions, please email recruitment@barnardos.org.nzThis role closes on 29 November 2025, however we will progress candidates as we receive applications, and will close the role if a suitable candidate is found.

jobs.title: Lecturer or Senior Lecturer in Media and Creative Technologies
jobs.description: Ngā kōrero mō te tūranga – About the roleTe Kura Toi School of Arts is seeking a full-time Lecturer or Senior Lecturer in Media and Creative Technologies. The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to teach theory and film/media production in a hands-on workshop environment (including camera, editing and Adobe suite skills), with a preference for someone with experience in relevant creative industries. A history of academic research and publication will be essential. Applicants with knowledge of Māori and Indigenous media cultures are encouraged to apply.This role will involve teaching relevant undergraduate courses in majors that contribute to the Bachelor of Arts, Bachelor of Communication and Bachelor of Design, and postgraduate courses in the Master of Arts and Master of Media and Creative Technologies. Contributing actively to the School’s research culture and supervising research students is also part of this role.The salary for the Lecturer position ranges from $90,125 to $107,452 per year, and for the Senior Lecturer position from $110,392 to $128,508 per year, depending on the skills, knowledge, and experience the successful candidate brings to the role. This is a full-time position (37.5 hours per week) based at our Hillcrest Campus.For more information about the role, please refer to the position description for the Lecturer position here and the Senior Lecturer position here.For a confidential discussion about the role, please contact Professor Gareth Schott at gareth.schott@waikato.ac.nz. All applications must be submitted online using the Apply Here function.Ko wai koe? – Who are you?You will have a PhD (or be in the final stages of completion) in Media and Creative Technologies or a relevant discipline. You will bring a passion for, and expertise in Media and Creative Technologies, actively demonstrate a commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi and understand how your research could enhance professional practice and community. You will have experience teaching undergraduate papers, including the ability to lecture to large numbers and conduct small-group seminars, tutorials and workshops effectively. You effectively communicate through innovative teaching methods, materials, models and virtual techniques. In addition, you should demonstrate how your own research aligns with or extends the existing research strengths in the School.Ko wai mātou? – Who are we? The role of Te Kura Toi School of Arts is to teach at undergraduate, postgraduate and experiential (internship/externship) levels in the fields of Arts (including Media and Creative Technologies, English, History, Music and more) and to undertake research in these areas. The school offers a range of papers in these Arts fields, at undergraduate, post-graduate and professional training levels.He aha ngā take me tono mai ai koe? – Why should you apply for this position?We want you to be part of our success! Our University stands proudly on the world stage as a provider of future-focused, international education and an active player in global research. Our rankings reflect these strengths. Working with us means you’ll enjoy a satisfying work environment with many benefits.The University of Waikato is distinctive for the diversity of its staff and students and encourages applicants with the relevant capabilities from all backgrounds to apply. All applications need to be made online and applicants need to be legally allowed to live and work in NZ in accordance with the NZ Immigration regulations which can be found here. Ko te Tangata – For the PeopleThe University of Waikato prides itself on the quality of its engagement with the communities that it serves, the provision of a world-class education and the national and international impact of its research. Our policies are guided by the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and equal opportunity for all. E herea ana te Whare Wānanga ki te kaupapa kia whakaratohia te mea angitū ōrite ki ngā tāngata katoa.Applications Close on 23rd November 2025Requisition number: 1003058

jobs.title: Registered ECE Teacher
jobs.description: NZ - Registered TeacherWhere curiosity has room to breathe, and tamariki are met with aroha.Do you love the spark in a child’s eyes when an idea lands?At House of Wonder Chartwell, we follow those sparks. jobs.title: Heavy Auto Electrician
jobs.description: Job reference - 1120297Join a high-performing team in a modern, well-equipped Hamilton workshopTackle auto electrical challenges performing varied, non-repetitive workBe part of a company known for innovation and reliability in the transport industryAccess 34 years of our client relationships and connections and find your next job. The role is hands-on, varied, and ideal for someone who enjoys working on custom builds and integrating electrical systems into large, complex vehicles and equipment.You'll be responsible for wiring, fault-finding, and installing everything from lighting systems to braking controls, steering electronics, and onboard diagnostics - all within a specialised heavy transport environment where no two builds are ever the same.Duties will include:Wiring and installing 12V/24V systems on heavy-duty trailers, modules, and custom transport rigsDiagnosing and repairing electrical faults - lighting, brakes (ABS/EBS), sensors, relays, etc.Reading schematics and wiring diagrams to carry out clean, precise installsIntegrating modern electronic features like steering controls, load sensors, and safety systemsWorking alongside mechanical, hydraulic, and fabrication teams to complete full buildsEnsuring all work meets quality, safety, and compliance standardsWhat we're looking forQualified and experienced auto electrician with a heavy vehicle and heavy machinery backgroundStrong understanding of trailer/truck electrical systems and fault diagnosticsFamiliar with ABS/EBS braking systems, CAN-bus, relays, and load control unitsGood attention to detail and pride in tidy, reliable installsA proactive approach - someone who can work independently and solve problems on the floorClean drivers licence/s - a Class 2 licence is a bonus (but not essential)What's on offerSecure, full-time position in a well-established business with a strong reputationVariety and challengeWork with a passionate team and high-end tools in a modern, well-equipped workshopOpportunities to grow your skills in areas like electronic steering and integrated load systemsCompetitive pay and a team culture built on quality, safety, and innovationHow to applyAll applications are welcome, including those from local, national, and international candidates. jobs.title: Category Manager
jobs.description: Job Title: Category Manager – Huntech & DivetechLocation: HamiltonEmployment Type: Full-TimeIndustry: Outdoor Apparel / Dive Equipment / Sporting Goods / Retail / WholesaleAbout the Role:We're seeking a commercially savvy and strategically minded Category Manager to take ownership of two specialist brands at the forefront of their industries: Huntech and Divetech. Based in our Hamilton Head Office 2 to 3 days a week, you will be part of the wider Global Velocity Group team.www.globalvelocity.co.nzHuntech is a respected leader in technical hunting apparel, known for durable, high-performance gear tailored for rugged outdoor environments. With a legacy grounded in functionality and innovation, Huntech is built for hunters who demand performance and reliability from their gear.Divetech supplies premium diving equipment for recreational, commercial, and technical divers, offering everything from masks, fins, to wetsuits and booties. The brand is synonymous with safety, innovation, and performance in the dive community.This role presents an exciting opportunity for a strategic thinker with a passion for the outdoors and an understanding of niche consumer needs in the hunting and diving sectors.Key Responsibilities:Product Strategy & Lifecycle Management: Develop, plan, and manage the product category strategy for both brands — from ideation and sourcing to go-to-market execution and post-launch performance analysis.Market & Trend Analysis: Stay ahead of industry trends in both hunting and diving — including consumer behaviour, seasonality, product innovation, sustainability, and compliance requirements.Collaboration & Leadership: Work cross-functionally with internal teams, including sales, marketing, design, supply chain, and operations, to bring category strategies to life and ensure strong brand execution. Reporting to our International Sales Manager and Head of Marketing.Sales & Financial Performance: Analyse sell-through data, inventory performance, pricing, and promotions to drive growth, manage margins, and deliver category profitability.Customer-Centric Thinking: Maintain a deep understanding of our customer segments – from avid hunters tracking game in alpine conditions to experienced divers – and ensure product range and strategic direction are in alignment.Supplier & Vendor Management: Build and manage supplier relationships to ensure product quality, delivery timelines, and commercial terms align with company goals.About You:Ideally, at least 3+ years of experience in category management, product development, or brand leadership in the outdoor, sporting, FMCG, or retail industries.A deep understanding (or a strong willingness to learn) about the hunting and/or diving communities, their needs, habits, and product expectations.Strong analytical skills and experience using data to drive strategic decisions and product development.Excellent project management, organisation, and communication skills that can keep projects on track and the team informed.Experience working with cross-functional teams and external stakeholders (e.g. suppliers, retailers).A passion for the outdoors – whether it's hunting, diving, or both – is a major asset.Why Join Us?Lead two established and respected brands with loyal customer bases in growing niche markets.Make a real impact on product strategy, brand growth, and market positioning.Collaborate with a passionate and experienced team that values innovation, quality, and a love for the outdoors.Enjoy a flexible and adventurous work culture, a competitive salary, staff discounts, and the potential for domestic and international travel (to test gear in the field, visit suppliers, or attend industry events).Ready to dive into a career that blends business strategy with outdoor adventure?Apply now with your CV and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience.

jobs.title: Social Media & Digital Content Creator
jobs.description: Full-time | Remote (preferably based in Auckland, Waikato, or Bay of Plenty) We’re looking for a creative and motivated Social Media & Digital Content Creator to help us bring our stories to life across multiple platforms, from high-energy youth events to powerful community and sponsorship stories. You’ll be joining a small, dynamic team that works with national partners, schools, and media to showcase the incredible mahi happening across Aotearoa. About us Waddell is a company specialising in sponsorship, strategy, and social impact. Led by Olympic gold medallist Rob Waddell, we partner with some of New Zealand’s most recognisable organisations to deliver partnerships that make a tangible difference. Over the past twelve years, we’ve helped secure significant funding for the not-for-profit sector and supported hundreds of youth sporting events across the country. We’re a small, dynamic, and supportive team that punches well above our weight, and we’re passionate about creating opportunities that help young New Zealanders thrive. About the role This is a hands-on role where you’ll manage and grow several of our digital and social media channels, including websites, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube and LinkedIn, as well as content for partner pages and our school sport sponsors. You’ll plan and schedule content, engage with audiences, and capture the energy and impact of what we do. You’ll also be very good at creating content from idealisation all the way through to posting. There’s huge scope here to make a real difference, from helping tell the stories of rangatahi and school communities, to showcasing sponsors’ impact, to celebrating the people and places that make it all possible. If you’re someone who can balance creativity with strategy, loves creating scroll-stopping content, and enjoys working at pace, this could be the perfect fit. You’ll be responsible for Planning and delivering digital and social media content for key partners and events (including partners, schools and national tournaments) Creating and curating engaging video, photo, and written content that amplifies our stories Managing day-to-day posting and engagement across Waddell’s social media channels Coordinating coverage of live events, including highlight clips, behind-the-scenes moments, and sponsor activations Growing and maintaining online communities, ensuring content aligns with our kaupapa and tone of voice Tracking and reporting on performance and reach to show impact and value Supporting internal communications and campaign storytelling across multiple brands We’re looking for someone who Is passionate about storytelling and using digital and social media platforms for good Has experience creating content and managing digital and social media accounts Is confident with posting, scheduling, and engaging online communities Has good judgement, a sense of humour, and can communicate authentically with young people and professionals alike Can create, shoot and edit videos or create graphics Is proactive, reliable, and happy to pitch in wherever needed Has a strong understanding of Māori culture and values, and fluency in te reo Māori would be highly advantageous Other details This is a full-time remote role, though preference will be given to those in Auckland, Waikato, or the Bay of Plenty. Some travel may be required around major sporting events, with all expenses covered. If this sounds like you, someone who loves bringing stories to life, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and wants to make an impact through sport, community, and culture, we’d love to hear from you. Applications close 5pm, Monday 3rd November.

jobs.title: Trials Agronomist
jobs.description: Trials Agronomist – North IslandApply now - Applications close 8am Monday 3rd November - unless filled earlier.Cropmark Seeds Limited is a progressive forage seed company whose core activities are the breeding, production, marketing, and export of a range of proprietary forage grasses, forage herbs and brassica seeds.An exciting opportunity has become available for a technically qualified and highly motivated person to join our experienced and enthusiastic product development team. The position will be based in the Waikato.Reporting to the Trials Manager, the appointee will be responsible for operation of the company’s Upper North Island product development trials and participation in the National Forage Variety Trials program of the New Zealand Plant Breeding and Research Association. The overall objective of the role is to assist Cropmark Seeds to identify elite new forage cultivars arising from the company’s breeding program to improve the productivity and profitability of pastoral farm systems.The appointee will have a good understanding of rotational pasture management, pasture agronomy research and data collation. Ideally you will have a mix of applied research and pastoral farming experience.Key tasks include (but not limited to):Mowing & recording yield from forage trialsData entryForage sample collection for analysisTrial observation and scoringEstablishment of spring and autumn sown replicated forage trialsAgrichemical and fertilizer applicationFarmer relationship management and sourcing of host farms to run trialsIt will be necessary for the appointee to be a motivated self-starter, be comfortable working remotely in a rural environment and to have the ability to communicate well with the product development team, trial host farmers, company sales representatives and retailer customers. Key internal relationships are with the company Technical Manager and Research & Development manager.Recognised prior qualifications in Agricultural or Applied Sciences such as a BAgSc degree would be advantageous. This is an important position with career opportunities for the right person who demonstrates initiative and produces results to grow and develop with the company.An appropriate remuneration package will be structured to recognise experience and performance including a company work vehicle. This will be discussed with and offered to the successful applicant.

As part of our team, you can expect:- Competitive remuneration and employee discounts- Opportunities for career development and growth- A collaborative and friendly team culture- Flexible working arrangements to maintain a healthy work-life balanceAbout usYou will be emplyed by the industry leading retailer of high-quality footwear, accessories, and clothing. With a focus on exceptional customer service and a passion for providing exceptional customer outcomes , we have been a trusted name in the local community for over 20 years. Join our team and be a part of our continued success story.Application close on 9th of November at midnight or earlier if we find the best match. The position commences on 5th of January offering 36 hours per week with roaster set three weeks in advance.Apply now for this exciting Office administrator & Personal Assistant.

jobs.title: Telecommunications Technician
jobs.description: Our Wireless and Critical Infrastructure team is seeking an experienced self-driven technician to join our Telecommunications division.What’s on offer? Competitive pay, excellent benefits including Health Insurance and Fuel DiscountsVentia offers a supportive and inclusive work environment where you matter Opportunities for career advancement About the RoleThis is an exciting new role as you will be working on new and upcoming projects with high-profile clients within the Power and Telecommunications industry. Your main responsibilities will be to install, commission, test, and troubleshoot Transmission communication systems. The work will predominantly be within Waikato and Bay of Plenty areas, so we can potentially accommodate people in Hamilton, Rotorua or Tauranga. Flexible working hours and participation on a 24/7 stand-by roster is a requirement for this role, a willingness to travel for projects and work away from home, occasionally with short notification, are requirements for this role. About YouTo be successful in this role, you will need to be physically fit and comfortable working at heights. Experience working on a New Zealand or Australian telco/power network is essential for this role. Your strong written and verbal communication skills will help you to build string working relationships and produce commissioning reports.Ideally you will have exposure to the following:Low Voltage DC Power Plant Installation, Commissioning - Battery TestingIP Experience - Nokia, Alcatel Lucent, Cisco experience preferableTransmission Installation, Commissioning - Ethernet, SDH, PDHOutside and Inside Plant Cable installation, Testing & Fault RepairProtection Signaling SystemsData Cabling, Data Tray/Raceway InstallationWiFi & VOIP Installation, CommissioningSCADA SystemsExcel & Word The following would be advantageous:Electrical RegistrationThe ability to interpret and work from drawingsRF Feeder and Antenna installation experience About VentiaVentia is a leading infrastructure services company, operating across Australia and New Zealand. Our clients are the owners and operators of assets that are critical to our local communities. We pride ourselves on working smart, safely and sustainably, harnessing the latest technologies and brightest minds. With a diverse and proud heritage, we have a track record of delivering essential services to the communities in which we operate. Diversity Ventia is enriched by the diverse experiences, talents and cultures that our people bring to the organisation, while celebrating and respecting the communities we operate in. We are committed to providing a safe and positive environment that provides equal opportunities for individuals of all backgrounds, including Māori and Pasifika people, LGBTTQIA+, Women, Veterans and spouses and people with disabilities. How to applyIf you are looking to expand your career with a business that rewards and values its employees, please apply below by clicking on the apply now button. Position Reference Number: 164273

jobs.title: Tractor Operator
jobs.description: Tractor Mower Operators – Waikato/WaipaWe’re after Tractor Mower Operators to join a Hamilton-based team for the upcoming grass-growing season.The jobYou’ll be operating tractors fitted with boom or reach mowers to keep roadside grass under control. The fleet includes Massey Ferguson, Iseki, SAME, Fendt, and John Deere tractors.Experience with reach mowers, hedge cutters, sickle bars, mulching heads, or saw blades is helpful but not essential – full training is provided. The team also runs tractor-towed sweepers.Alongside tractor work, you’ll pitch in with other vegetation control tasks like ride-on mowing, weed spraying, chainsaw use, chipper work, and general site clean-up. Fencing experience is a bonus.Public-facing workSome mowing and tidy-up work takes place in busier public or commercial areas, so you’ll need to be professional, polite, and safety-minded around the public. You’ll also deal directly with local farmers, keeping them updated on work progress and maintaining good relationships.About the clientThis is a family-owned Hamilton company that values safety, teamwork, and loyalty. You’ll be known by name, not number. The business also works across civil construction, vegetation control, arborist work, and traffic management – offering plenty of variety and chances to learn new skills.Other workFlexibility helps – at times you’ll lend a hand with other crews doing civil, landscaping, roadside maintenance, or even rubbish collection.Team cultureYou’ll join a solid, down-to-earth crew who value reliability, safety, and a good sense of humour. A positive, can-do attitude will make you a great fit here.The dealStarting rate: $28.95 per hour (on wages)Full training providedOutdoor role – all weather, physical fitness neededWhat you’ll needFull NZ driver’s licence (manual)Ability to reverse a trailerSolid tractor operating experience (W endorsement preferred; T and R useful)Able to pass pre-employment and random drug and alcohol testingNice to haveConstruct Safe, Grow Safe, chainsaw, or First Aid ticketsExperience in traffic managementWhat we offer:Weekly payAll PPE providedVariety of work across different sitesWhy work with Tradestaff?We’re a trusted recruitment partner with over 3 decades of experience in matching skilled tradies with great opportunities. We’re also proud members of the Recruitment & Consulting Services Association (RCSA) of Australia and New Zealand, which means we’re committed to high standards and ethical practices.

jobs.title: Procurement Lead
jobs.description: An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Procurement Lead to shape and drive the strategic direction of procurement within a respected regional organisation based in Hamilton. This role is perfect for someone who thrives on providing high-level guidance, ensuring that procurement strategies are not only robust and future-focused but also aligned with government policy and the broader needs of the communityWhat you'll do:As Procurement Lead you will play a crucial role in shaping how the organisation approaches its purchasing activities at every level. Your day-to-day responsibilities will see you working closely with senior leaders to set strategic priorities for procurement while ensuring that all processes are efficient, transparent, and aligned with both regulatory requirements and community expectations. You will act as a trusted advisor across multiple directorates—educating colleagues on best practices in contract management; reviewing tender recommendations; providing guidance during planning stages; and supporting staff who hold accountability for contracts.Develop and lead the strategic direction for procurement services, ensuring alignment with government policy and organisational objectives while proactively identifying opportunities for broad procurement outcomes.Design, review, and implement fit-for-purpose procurement strategies, policy frameworks, and processes that deliver sustainable benefits across the business.Provide expert advice, education, and support to staff at all levels to ensure an end-to-end approach to procurement encompassing needs analysis, market development, strategic sourcing, supplier contracting, and management.Establish regular reporting mechanisms to track benefits and savings achieved through procurement activities, offering insights that inform decision-making at the highest levels.Identify strategic commercial opportunities for the organisation and support their implementation by collaborating closely with senior leadership teams.Offer oversight and thought leadership to staff responsible for procurement within their directorates, guiding them through complex tendering processes and probity requirements.Build strong relationships with key external partners including central government agencies, local authorities, contractors, service providers, and sector peers to maximise regional and national procurement opportunities.Champion sustainability by embedding environmental considerations into all investment decisions related to goods, services, and assets procured by the organisation.Ensure compliance with all legal requirements and internal policies while actively promoting excellent customer service in line with organisational values.Contribute positively to health and safety culture by adhering to relevant policies, participating in hazard management reviews, and supporting civil defence initiatives as required.What you bring:You will bring extensive experience managing high-value procurements within complex organisations—ideally those operating in public sector or similarly regulated environments. Your background should include hands-on involvement in developing strategy frameworks; leading cross-functional teams through change; negotiating contracts; managing risk; overseeing compliance; driving process improvements; reporting on performance metrics; facilitating stakeholder engagement; championing sustainability initiatives; supporting knowledge sharing among colleagues; resolving disputes amicably; adapting quickly when priorities evolve; demonstrating empathy towards others’ perspectives; communicating persuasively regardless of audience size or composition; exercising sound judgement when making recommendations under scrutiny from multiple parties simultaneously. Your interpersonal skills will be second-to-none: you thrive on building trust-based networks both inside your own team structure as well as externally among partner organisations. A passion for continuous learning coupled with genuine enthusiasm for helping others succeed makes you an invaluable resource throughout every stage of the procurement lifecycle.A tertiary qualification in business administration, economics, logistics or supply chain management is essential for success in this position as it provides a solid foundation for understanding complex procurement environments.Membership of the Chartered Institute of Procurement & Supply (MCIPS) or equivalent professional accreditation is highly desirable as it demonstrates your commitment to best practice standards within the field.At least 9-10 years’ experience in senior procurement roles within large or complex organisations is required so you can confidently navigate multifaceted challenges with a strategic mindset.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills are necessary to convey complex information clearly across diverse audiences including executive leadership teams and external partners.Proven ability to build effective relationships with stakeholders at all levels—both internally across departments and externally with suppliers or government agencies—is vital for achieving shared objectives.Demonstrated critical thinking skills enable you to analyse situations holistically while aligning procurement decisions with long-term organisational goals.Political awareness combined with sensitivity when dealing with confidential or bi-cultural issues ensures you can operate effectively within dynamic public sector environments.Experience delivering results under pressure in rapidly changing political contexts is important so you can maintain focus on key deliverables even when circumstances shift unexpectedly.Previous exposure to local government or public sector settings is advantageous as it equips you with valuable insights into statutory requirements and governance structures relevant to this role.What sets this company apart:This organisation stands out due to its unwavering commitment to serving its communities through responsible stewardship of resources while fostering an inclusive workplace culture built on respect, transparency, collaboration, and continuous improvement. Employees benefit from flexible working arrangements designed to support work-life balance alongside generous professional development opportunities tailored towards individual growth aspirations.What's next:If you are ready to take your career in strategic procurement to new heights within an organisation dedicated to positive community impact—this is your moment!Apply today by clicking on the link provided—your next rewarding challenge awaits.Robert Walters endeavours to review all applications in a maximum of five working days. If you have not received correspondence in this timeframe please do not hesitate to contact Courtney Taylor on +64 9 374 7360.

jobs.title: Youth Worker
jobs.description: Permanent full-time, Monday to Friday, 8:30am-5:00pm5 weeks of annual leave + 2 wellbeing days annuallyEarn up to $29.83 per hour + other great benefitsSupport taiohi to build life skills and resilience whilst transitioning to independent living.Real | Mō mātouOur spirit is 'loving life' – and that's what we do – we work with our taiohi to realise this aspiration.Te Hononga is a youth-centred service that focuses on the hauora of our taiohi and whānau. Supporting taiohi transitioning to independent living, you’ll help to develop life skills and resilience and provide support with practical problem solving.You | MōuIn this role you will need:The Level 4 New Zealand Certificate in Health and Wellbeing (NZCHW) or a recognised equivalent or be studying towards a recognised equivalentExperience working with young people and an understanding of trauma-informed careBoth de-escalation skills and relationship building skillsA current full New Zealand driver’s licenceA current New Zealand first aid certificate or be prepared to obtain oneKnowledge of, and demonstrable commitment to, the principles of the Te Tiriti o WaitangiMāori and Pasifika are strongly encouraged to apply for this role. We also encourage people with lived experience to apply. Closing Date | Rā Katinga: 1 November 2025. Please note, this job may close sooner if a suitable candidate is found.Position description: https://www.wisegroup.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/Pathways-Youth-Worker-Sep-2024.pdfContact | Whakapā: Hoki Henry, Team Coach, Hoki.Henry@real.org.nz.For further information, visit www.real.org.nz Real is supported by Pathways Health Limited, part of the Wise Group. Pathways are committed to healthy lifestyles and actively support a smoke-free environment.Note: The Criminal History Check is Exempt from The Clean Slate Act. In other words, the Clean Slate Act does not apply to this position. Please declare any offences (even outside 7 years) in your application.All new appointees into Pathways require background checking. Under the requirements of the Children's Act 2014, new employees that are identified as coming under this act are required to undergo further safety checks as part of the recruitment process.

jobs.title: Geotechnical Engineer or Engineering Geologist
jobs.description: We are a dedicated team of professionals who enjoy our work and like to have fun! At Tonkin + Taylor, we're more than just an environmental and engineering consultancy we're a team of passionate people committed to making a positive impact. We love what we do and have fun doing it. Whether you're designing resilient infrastructure, collaborating on innovative solutions, or tackling complex geotechnical challenges, your work will make a real difference here.As a proudly 100% employee-owned company, we're known for our technical excellence and strong partnerships. Our people are at the heart of our success - energetic, inspired, and committed to delivering award-winning solutions. We invest in their growth, well-being, and career goals because they are key to our success.We have an exciting opportunity for a Geotechnical Engineer / Engineering Geologist to join our growing national team. Based in one of our key offices - Auckland, Hamilton, Tauranga, Hawke's Bay, Nelson, Wellington, or Christchurch you'll be part of a diverse and supportive group of professionals delivering meaningful projects across New Zealand and the Pacific. You'll collaborate closely with local and national staff across a wide variety of disciplines.About You:We're looking for someone who is curious, client-focused, and driven to deliver high-value outcomes. You'll enjoy working collaboratively and have a hands-on approach to both fieldwork and design. You're passionate about geotechnical challenges, including slope stabilisation, retaining walls, foundations, earthworks, and ground improvement.Geotechnical Engineer: A BE Civil (or equivalent qualification) or higher. You will either have CPEng or progressing toward CPEngEngineering Geologist: A degree in Geology (or related field) with strong practical experience in geotechnical environments. You will either have PEngGeol or progressing toward PEngGeolAt least 5 years of engineering consulting experienceA collaborative, practical nature with a focus on delivering quality resultsA desire to contribute to a variety of complex and meaningful projectsOur Benefits:Flexible working options and the ability to purchase additional leaveSupport for professional development, including CPEng or PEngGeol and further studyLong service leave and sabbatical opportunitiesAn active social club with regular team eventsHealth and well-being initiatives (e.g., vaccinations, fruit baskets)Corporate discounts with over 400 retailersModern, collaborative office spaces across New ZealandA values-driven culture - 100% employee-ownedWhy Tonkin + Taylor?At Tonkin + Taylor, our various technical specialists are trusted advisors to Government and non-Government organisations, Councils, and private enterprise. We are proudly 100% employee-owned and operated, and live and breathe the Tonkin + Taylor goal to be "the Best to work for, the Best to work with, and the Best at what we do."If that sounds like a place where you'd thrive, apply now and bring your geotechnical expertise to a team where your work will truly matter.We are proud to be a member of Diversity Works. We particularly encourage speakers of Te Reo Māori or Pasifika languages to apply.

jobs.title: Compliance WOF Technician
jobs.description: Automotive Technician - WOF / ComplianceDrivesure is a New Zealand owned and operated Vehicle Testing business with branches across Auckland and Hamilton. We have busy, happy teams with great customers and we offer steady work in a friendly, modern environment - at great pay rates. Our Frankton, Hamilton vehicle compliance facility is currently seeking a qualified and reliable full time automotive technician with minimum WOF authority. The successful applicant would be expected to train through to Compliance Inspector and so high levels of technical understanding and literacy are essential.The role will suit those with WOF+ authorities who enjoy working in a highly functional team and wish to progress their career in vehicle inspection.To be successful in this role you will:have as a minimum a current NZTA WOF authorityhave a genuine interest in what's best for the team, company and customersbe an excellent communicatorpossess a good knowledge of vehicles and inspection requirementsenjoy working efficiently in a good teamWhat's in it for you:good pay rates, stable work hours, social activities, other advantagesIf this sounds like you, please hit the apply-now button; be sure to include your cv and, importantly, a cover-letter to tell us why we should choose you!
